translated: If you say that the omniscient one does not exist because of the nonapprehension of a speaker, then the nonapprehension of the pervasion is established.

original: bshad pa / thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba ma dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa de ni yul bltar mi rung ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / thams cad mkhyen pa smra ba ma dmigs so zhes bya ba ma dmigs pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yin pa de ni yul bltar mi rung ba'i don yin no //
translated: We reply: This kind of nonapprehension, “The omniscient one does not exist because of the nonapprehension of a speaker,” is a case of an object that is not visible.

original: gal te smra ba mthong yang gzhir gyur pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bltar mi rung ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te smra ba mthong yang gzhir gyur pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni bltar mi rung ba yin te /
translated: Even if one sees a speaker, the omniscience of the basis is not visible.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni shes pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because omniscience is a particular kind of knowledge.

original: yul bltar rung ba rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs 'di the tshom gyi rgyu yin no zhes mi dmigs pa'i skabs su shad zin to //
analyzed: yul bltar rung ba rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs 'di the tshom gyi rgyu yin no zhes mi dmigs pa'i skabs su shad zin to //
translated: We have already explained in the section on nonapprehension that nonapprehension is a cause of doubt, because the object is not suitable to be seen.

original: des na mi dmigs ba las thams cad mkhyen pa la smra ba med par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi dmigs ba las thams cad mkhyen pa la smra ba med par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, omniscience is not ascertained to be nonexistent on the basis of nonapprehension.

original: gang gis na 'gal ba dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zlog pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra @141a * //
analyzed: gang gis na 'gal ba dmigs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid zlog pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang smra @141a * //
translated: How could the apprehension of something incompatible with omniscience, such as speech, reverse omniscience?

original: ba 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ba 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Speech is not incompatible with omniscience.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la 'gal ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba yin no //
translated: What is incompatible with what?

original: 'di snyam du lhan cig gnas par ma dmigs pa nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du lhan cig gnas par ma dmigs pa nyid kyis 'gal ba yin no //
translated: You might think that it is incompatibility through the nonapprehension of co-existence.

original: gang zhig gang dang mi 'gal ba de ni de dang lhan cig ma mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang mi 'gal ba de ni de dang lhan cig ma mthong ba yin te /
translated: That which is not incompatible with something is not seen to be co-existent with it,

original: dper na bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no //
translated: like a pot and a cloth.

original: smra ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ma mthong ste des na 'gal ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: smra ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ma mthong ste des na 'gal ba yod do zhe na /
translated: Objection: Speech is not seen to be omniscience. Therefore, there is a contradiction.🔽In response Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gal te 'gro ba 'dir blo zhan pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / gal te 'gro ba 'dir blo zhan pa yin te /
translated: If you think that this world is of little intelligence,

original: mthong ba'i don yang skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par nges par byed pa khyed ni blo zhan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i don yang skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par nges par byed pa khyed ni blo zhan pa yin no //
translated: you are of little intelligence, for you ascertain the meaning of seeing as not being momentary, and so on.

original: mthong ba nyid la sogs pa thams cad nges par byed pa ni blo gros chen po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid la sogs pa thams cad nges par byed pa ni blo gros chen po yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Ascertaining all things such as seeing and so on is the work of the intelligent, not of others.

original: mig kyang zhan pa yin te rgyang ring ba dang phra ba dang chod pa'i don mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: mig kyang zhan pa yin te rgyang ring ba dang phra ba dang chod pa'i don mi mthong bas so //
translated: The eye is also of little intelligence, for it does not see distant, subtle, or obscured objects.

original: de la gal te blo dang mi gzhan pa khyod kyis mi dmigs pa'i don mthong ba sbyin pa'i sems pa la sogs pa bde ba rgyu nyid la sogs pa dang / gtan ma mthong ba dag spongs na /
analyzed: de la gal te blo dang mi gzhan pa khyod kyis mi dmigs pa'i don mthong ba sbyin pa'i sems pa la sogs pa bde ba rgyu nyid la sogs pa dang / gtan ma mthong ba dag spongs na /
translated: If you, who are not intelligent, see the meaning of nonobservation, such as the thought of generosity and so on, and then abandon the meaning of what is not seen, such as the cause of happiness, and so on,

original: 'o na khyod 'jig rten gyi lugs las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na khyod 'jig rten gyi lugs las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then you have fallen from the ways of the world.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: pha'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ma la mang la 'jog par byed pa gang yin pa de ma dmigs pas ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ma la mang la 'jog par byed pa gang yin pa de ma dmigs pas ldog par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mother is not observed, the convention of “mother” would be reversed.

original: des na skyed byed du ma shes pa la pha zhes par tha snyad byas pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad par 'gyur ba des na khyed nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na skyed byed du ma shes pa la pha zhes par tha snyad byas pa gang yin pa de mi 'thad par 'gyur ba des na khyed nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not tenable that the father is the one who is conventionally called “father” in dependence on the mother, you are defeated.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis lhan cig gnas pa ldog pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis lhan cig gnas pa ldog pa ni ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, mere nonobservation of simultaneous presence does not reverse simultaneous presence.

original: gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: By what means would there be contradiction?

original: gal te smra ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir mi 'gal lo zhe na ni ma mthong du zin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de thams cad smra ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'dra🔽ba'i ldog pa ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gal te smra ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir mi 'gal lo zhe na ni ma mthong du zin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa gang yin pa de thams cad smra ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'dra ba'i ldog pa ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: If you say “There is no contradiction because there is no contradiction between speech and omniscience in either way,” then even though it is not observed, it is not established that the one who is omniscient is not a speaker.

original: mthong ba yin na ni mi 'grub na /
analyzed: mthong ba yin na ni mi 'grub na /
translated: If it is not established when it is observed,

original: ma mthong na ci ltar mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ma mthong na ci ltar mi 'grub ce na /
translated: how could it be established when it is not observed?

original: bshad pa / the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Because of doubt.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smra ba mthong yang the tshom za'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smra ba mthong yang the tshom za'o //
translated: Even if one sees a speaker of omniscience, one doubts.

original: the tshom za ba nyid sgrub pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: the tshom za ba nyid sgrub pa'i bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the very doubt:

original: gnod par byed pa yong na ni gzhan med par nges par byed do //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yong na ni gzhan med par nges par byed do //
translated: If there is an object of refutation, one ascertains that there is no other.

original: gal te smra ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod byed du rtogs nas smra ba po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te smra ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnod byed du rtogs nas smra ba po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands that all speech is an object of refutation of omniscience, then all speech would be refuted as omniscience.

original: tshig @141b gnod par byed pa ci ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig @141b gnod par byed pa ci ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: How could the words be an object of refutation?

original: gang gi phyir dbang po las 'das pa'i dngos po'i gnod pa ni shes par bla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po las 'das pa'i dngos po'i gnod pa ni shes par bla ba ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not easy to know the refutation of a thing that is beyond the senses.

original: gnod par shes par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod par shes par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to know the refutation.

original: gal te rtag pa nyid dbang po las 'das kyang mi rtag pa nyid la gnod byed du shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa nyid dbang po las 'das kyang mi rtag pa nyid la gnod byed du shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: If permanence is beyond the senses, is impermanence not known to be the refutation of it?

original: de ltar yin na sgra rtag par dogs pa yang dgag tu med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na sgra rtag par dogs pa yang dgag tu med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is the case, then the doubt that sound is permanent could not be refuted.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'gal ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'gal ba zhes smos so //
translated: The characteristic of non-contradiction is mentioned.

original: gang zhig gang yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin de ni de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin de'i gnod par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yongs su spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin de ni de dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin de'i gnod par byed pa nyid de /
translated: That which abides by abandoning something is the nature of that which is incompatible with it. It is the nature of that which is incompatible with it.

original: dper na rtag pa nyid la mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtag pa nyid la mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, impermanence is incompatible with permanence.

original: de bzhin du smra ba po nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su spangs te gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra ba po nyid ni thams cad mkhyen pa yongs su spangs te gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the nature of being a speaker does not abide by abandoning omniscience.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gnod pa ni shes par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gnod pa ni shes par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the contradiction with omniscience cannot be known.

original: de'i phyir smra ba po thams cad ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes thams cad nye bar bsdus pa dang ldan pa khyab par ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba po thams cad ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin no zhes thams cad nye bar bsdus pa dang ldan pa khyab par ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the pervasion that all speakers are not omniscient is not established as including all.

original: ci ltar ma khyab gang gi phyir smra ba po 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos ji snyed dang ldan par mthong ba de thams cad ni smra ba de thams cad la 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar ma khyab gang gi phyir smra ba po 'ga' zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos ji snyed dang ldan par mthong ba de thams cad ni smra ba de thams cad la 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: How is it not a universal? Because whatever qualities, such as not being omniscient, are seen to belong to some speaker, all of those qualities would belong to all speakers.

original: des na mi dmigs pa'am 'gal ba'i phyir ni smra ba po thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa'am 'gal ba'i phyir ni smra ba po thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not because of nonobservation or contradiction that all speakers are not omniscient.

original: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid nges pas 'gal ba'i rang bzhin thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid nges pas 'gal ba'i rang bzhin thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gog pa yin no //
translated: However, because it is ascertained that they are not omniscient, the contradictory nature of omniscience is refuted.

original: bshad pa / smra ba po thams cad kyis chos nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / smra ba po thams cad kyis chos nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Because it is impossible to ascertain the nature of all speakers.

original: gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de yongs su gcad par bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de yongs su gcad par bya mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to ascertain the nature of all speakers, that is, the nature that must occur, it is impossible to ascertain the nature of all phenomena.

original: smra ba po thams cad kyis chos nyid yongs su gcod pa ni gdon mi za bar med pa yin te /
analyzed: smra ba po thams cad kyis chos nyid yongs su gcod pa ni gdon mi za bar med pa yin te /
translated: It is definitely impossible to ascertain the nature of all phenomena by all speakers.

original: smra ba po thams cad kyis chos nyid yongs su gcod pa de nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba des na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po thams cad kyis chos nyid yongs su gcod pa de nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba des na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: Since all speakers would be omniscient, because they would delimit reality, then omniscience would not be refuted.

original: 'di snyam du smra ba so so la kho bo cag gis chos yongs su gcad par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du smra ba so so la kho bo cag gis chos yongs su gcad par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you think that we do not delimit phenomena in each individual statement,

original: 'on kyang bdag nyid rang gis rig pa smra ba po'i chos des gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bar yongs su gcod par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag nyid rang gis rig pa smra ba po'i chos des gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bar yongs su gcod par byed do zhe na /
translated: but rather, the speaker’s phenomena that are known by himself are also delimited in the same way for others,

original: gal te de ltar bdag la tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bdag la tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba gang yin pa de /
translated: then if that which is seen together with the words in that way

original: tshig mthong ba las gzhan la yongs su gcod na bdag la tshig dang @142a * //
analyzed: tshig mthong ba las gzhan la yongs su gcod na bdag la tshig dang @142a * //
translated: is delimited for something other than the seeing of the words, then that which is seen together with the words,

original: lhan cig tu mthong ba dkar sham nyid dam lus che ba nyid gang yin pa de yang tshig las gzhan la rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhan cig tu mthong ba dkar sham nyid dam lus che ba nyid gang yin pa de yang tshig las gzhan la rjes su dpag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the mere white color or the large body, would also be inferred for something other than the words.

original: de rjes su dpog na yang mngon sum dang 'gal bas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rjes su dpog na yang mngon sum dang 'gal bas ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you infer it from that, it is contradicted by perception, and there is an absurd consequence.

original: cig shos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa /
translated: The other says:

original: skyes bu gzhan la mthong ba sdo bsangs nyid gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba bdag nyid la mthong ba'i dkar sham nyid mi sgrub pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan la mthong ba sdo bsangs nyid gang yin pa de dang 'gal ba bdag nyid la mthong ba'i dkar sham nyid mi sgrub pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: The dark complexion that is seen in another person is not established as the fair complexion that is seen in oneself, which is incompatible with it.

original: rigs pa mtshungs na mthong ba dang 'gal ba yang ci ste mi sgrub /
analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs na mthong ba dang 'gal ba yang ci ste mi sgrub /
translated: If the reasoning is the same, why is the incompatibility with perception not established?

original: 'di ltar bdag la tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa bzhin du dkar sham nyid kyang gzhan la rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa bzhin du dkar sham nyid kyang gzhan la rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid do //
translated: In this way, because the word is seen to occur together with the person, omniscience is like the fair complexion that is to be inferred in another.

original: 'on te thams cad bsgrub par mi nus na de'i tshe rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad bsgrub par mi nus na de'i tshe rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is impossible to establish all of that, then it is unreasonable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dkar sham nyid la 'gal ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dkar sham nyid la 'gal ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the fair complexion that has the characteristic is incompatible with it.

original: tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rigs pa ni tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba'i dkar sham la gnod pa'i phyir 'khrul pas na rigs pa sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rigs pa ni tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba'i dkar sham la gnod pa'i phyir 'khrul pas na rigs pa sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The reasoning that has the characteristic of being seen to operate together with the words is refuted by the error of being seen to operate together with the white color, which is not the word.

original: ci'i phyir 'di rigs pa ma yin zhes brjod /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di rigs pa ma yin zhes brjod /
translated: Why is it said that this is not reasoning?

original: gang gi phyir bdag rang nyid la chos gang dang tshig lhan cig ma mthong ba de'i mthong ba tsam gyis ni tshig go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag rang nyid la chos gang dang tshig lhan cig ma mthong ba de'i mthong ba tsam gyis ni tshig go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because when one does not see a certain property and word together with the self, the mere seeing of that does not make the word understood.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: ldog pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa las kyang yin te /
translated: It is also from the exclusion.

original: gal te lhan cig spyod par mthong ba'i chos ldog ni tshig kyang ldog na ni go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig spyod par mthong ba'i chos ldog ni tshig kyang ldog na ni go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the exclusion of the property that is seen to operate together with the word also excludes the word, then it would make the word understood.

original: dkar sham nyid ni skyes bu gzhan las ldog pa na tshig ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dkar sham nyid ni skyes bu gzhan las ldog pa na tshig ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: But when the whiteness is excluded from another person, the word is not excluded.

original: des na dkar sham nyid ldog na tshig ldog pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa'i yul ma yin pa mthong ba dang 'gal ba gzhan ni mi sgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: des na dkar sham nyid ldog na tshig ldog pa med pa'i phyir ldog pa'i yul ma yin pa mthong ba dang 'gal ba gzhan ni mi sgrub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, when the white color is excluded, since the word is not excluded, it is not established that the object of exclusion is seen as something else that is not excluded.

original: gal te de lta na ci ltar sngo bsangs la tshig 'jug par dkar sham ldog pa la med par ma grub pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug par the tshom za bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa med pa la med par
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci ltar sngo bsangs la tshig 'jug par dkar sham ldog pa la med par ma grub pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug par the tshom za bas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin pa med pa la med par
translated: If that is so, just as it is not established that the word does not occur in the white color when it occurs in the pale, in the same way, since there is doubt that the word occurs in omniscience, it is not established that the word does not occur in nonomniscience.

original: ma grub par mtshungs so //🔽ci skad du bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba la zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: ma grub par mtshungs so // ci skad du bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba la zhugs pa'am /
translated: It is the same.

original: zhugs par the tshom za bas bsgrub par bya ba med na tshig med par ma grub par mtshungs so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhugs par the tshom za bas bsgrub par bya ba med na tshig med par ma grub par mtshungs so zhes bshad do //
translated: As it is said, “When there is doubt that the word occurs in the probandum or in what is contradictory to the probandum, it is the same that the word does not occur in the absence of the probandum.”

original: des na mthong ba thams cad sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mthong ba thams cad sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, not all that is seen is established.

original: gzhan yang dkar sham ma yin pa @142b de dag ni bdag nyid bltar rung ba nyid kyis phan tshun spangs pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dkar sham ma yin pa @142b de dag ni bdag nyid bltar rung ba nyid kyis phan tshun spangs pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, those that are not white and so on are not mutually exclusive, since they are not visible.

original: de'i phyir dkar sham ma yin pa yod pa la dkar sham bsgrub par mi nus pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir dkar sham ma yin pa yod pa la dkar sham bsgrub par mi nus pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, since it is not possible to establish that which is not white in the presence of that which is white, it is not the object to be established.

original: 'gal bar nges pa gang gi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs gsal nas te /🔽rang dang 'gal ba spangs te gcig tu ma nges par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa bltar mi rung ba rnams ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rang gi 'gal zla dag dang 'gal bar yang nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal bar nges pa gang gi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs gsal nas te / rang dang 'gal ba spangs te gcig tu ma nges par byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa bltar mi rung ba rnams ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs rang gi 'gal zla dag dang 'gal bar yang nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the object to be established when the opposite of the property of the subject is ascertained as contradictory.🔽Since all things that are not visible, such as omniscience, are not ascertained as one, since they are excluded from being the opposite of their counterparts, they are not ascertained as contradictory with their counterparts, the opposite of themselves.

original: rtags med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nges pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rtags med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nges pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the nature of those such as the nonomniscient one not ascertained, because there is no evidence.

original: rang gi ngo bo nges pa yod du chu ga kyang rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag dang 'gal bar yang nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nges pa yod du chu ga kyang rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag dang 'gal bar yang nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: But even if one does ascertain its nature, one will not ascertain that it is in opposition to its incompatible class. This is the meaning of the word “also.”

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par rtogs su bcug kyang de tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin par rtogs su bcug kyang de tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one causes the understanding that something is not omniscient, one will not thereby be free from its incompatible class.

original: ci ste 'gal bar ma nges na ci ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin /
analyzed: ci ste 'gal bar ma nges na ci ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin /
translated: But if it is not ascertained that they are in opposition, how can they be incompatible?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Incompatibility is just opposition.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs na yang ci ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ma yin zhe na /🔽bden te / bltar mi rung ba rnams la phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs na yang ci ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa ma yin zhe na / bden te / bltar mi rung ba rnams la phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: But how can one who is in the incompatible class be free from the incompatible class?🔽It is true that those that cannot be seen are mutually exclusive.

original: 'gal ba gcig nges na gnyis pa ldog pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba gcig nges na gnyis pa ldog pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: But if one is ascertained to be in opposition to one, it is possible to be free from the other.

original: 'on kyang bdag nyid bltar rung ba nyid kyis rgyu 'gal bar yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i rgyu la yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag nyid bltar rung ba nyid kyis rgyu 'gal bar yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i rgyu la yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: But if the self were visible, then omniscience would be the cause of non-omniscience, because the cause would be known to be contradictory.

original: des na 'gal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'gal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there would be no contradiction.

original: 'dir rgyu 'gal ba 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu 'gal ba 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Here, the cause is refuted as contradictory.

original: rgyu 'gal ba med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma bkag na thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma bkag pa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'gal ba med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma bkag na thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma bkag pa 'gyur ro //
translated: If omniscience were not refuted because the cause is not contradictory, then the counter-position that omniscience exists would not be refuted.

original: 'di la spros pa dang rjes su spros pa ni le'u gnyis par bdag gis bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la spros pa dang rjes su spros pa ni le'u gnyis par bdag gis bshad zin to //
translated: Here, the elaboration and further elaboration have been explained by me in the second chapter.

original: des na de ltar tshig las lhan cig spyod pa'i chos rjes su dpog pa bkag nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar tshig las lhan cig spyod pa'i chos rjes su dpog pa bkag nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the inference of the concomitant property from the statement,

original: rjes su dpog par smra ba la bzhad gang du byed pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpog par smra ba la bzhad gang du byed pa ni /
translated: the proponent of inference is ridiculed:

original: bdag nyid nang gis zhes bya ba sems la yod pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid nang gis zhes bya ba sems la yod pas so //
translated: The self is internal because it exists in the mind.

original: gzhan gyis shes par bya bar mi nus pa @143a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis shes par bya bar mi nus pa @143a * //
translated: It is not possible for others to know it.

original: bltar mi rung ba'i chos dang ldan par mthong nas /🔽tshig tsam mtshungs par mthong ba'i phyir thams cad du chos de dag gi nye bar bsgrub pas de nye bar 'jog pas tha snyad du byed ba ste /
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba'i chos dang ldan par mthong nas / tshig tsam mtshungs par mthong ba'i phyir thams cad du chos de dag gi nye bar bsgrub pas de nye bar 'jog pas tha snyad du byed ba ste /
translated: Seeing that it is a quality that cannot be seen,🔽one is led to think that it is the same as mere words.🔽Thus, one is led to think that it is a quality that is established by mere words.

original: ci ltar smra ba po bdag chos de dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes smra ba'i skyes bu 'di rig pa'i yul la ngal ba'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa ste mthar phyin par grub po //
analyzed: ci ltar smra ba po bdag chos de dag dang ldan pa yin no zhes smra ba'i skyes bu 'di rig pa'i yul la ngal ba'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa ste mthar phyin par grub po //
translated: In this way, the result of the speaker’s effort to understand the object of knowledge is completely fulfilled.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar gang zhig bstan bcos yongs su shes pa dang bral ba bud med rnams dang / dmangs rigs rnams dang yang thun mong ba'i khyad par mi rtogs pa de ni 'jig pa'i 'bras bu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig bstan bcos yongs su shes pa dang bral ba bud med rnams dang / dmangs rigs rnams dang yang thun mong ba'i khyad par mi rtogs pa de ni 'jig pa'i 'bras bu grub pa yin no //
translated: Because the result of the destruction of the treatise is established for those who are devoid of the knowledge of the treatise, for women, and for those of the lowest caste, who do not understand the distinction.

original: de lta ma yin na de dag las de khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de dag las de khyad par du 'phags pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If it were not so, what would distinguish them from those who do understand the treatise?

original: de dag ni nga'i blo ci ltar lha sbyin ma yin no zhes smra ba mthong ba ma yin zhes bzhad gang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni nga'i blo ci ltar lha sbyin ma yin no zhes smra ba mthong ba ma yin zhes bzhad gang du byed pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, “I see that you are not a god-given mind.”

original: gang gi phyir mi shes pas kyang de ltar rtogs par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi shes pas kyang de ltar rtogs par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since even the ignorant cannot understand it in this way,

original: bdag la chos tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba tsam gyis ni de gzhan la tshig las nye bar sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la chos tshig dang lhan cig rgyu bar mthong ba tsam gyis ni de gzhan la tshig las nye bar sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not established that the one who sees the mere fact that the words are concomitant with the self is the one who establishes the words for others.

original: bdag la tshig dang lhan cig spyod par mthong bar de tsam gyis ni smra ba la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas khyab pa ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la tshig dang lhan cig spyod par mthong bar de tsam gyis ni smra ba la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas khyab pa ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not established that the one who sees the words as concomitant with the self is necessarily omniscient with respect to speech.

original: de de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa las tshig log pa ma yin 'gal ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: de de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa las tshig log pa ma yin 'gal ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Since it is not observed in that way, it is not the case that the words are excluded from omniscience.

original: 'gal bas khyab pa nyid las kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir ma nges par brjod /
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa nyid las kyang ma yin pa de'i phyir ma nges par brjod /
translated: It is not the case that it is excluded due to the pervasion of contradiction. Therefore, it is said to be indefinite.

original: sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid las kyang 'di 'dra ba'i sbyor ba byas pa dang byed par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan rnams the tshom gyi rgyu yin par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid las kyang 'di 'dra ba'i sbyor ba byas pa dang byed par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan rnams the tshom gyi rgyu yin par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The syllogisms that have been formulated and will be formulated in accordance with the definition of non-apprehension that was explained above, and the others, should be understood to be the causes of doubt.

original: mtshan nyid 'di tsam zhig ni brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di tsam zhig ni brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: This much is all that can be said about the definition.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /🔽de nyid bltar rung ba las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te / de nyid bltar rung ba las mi dmigs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Thus, this is the definition of non-apprehension:🔽it is the apprehension of the opposite of that which is suitable to appear,

original: de dang 'gal ba'am 'gal ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'am 'gal ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'am /
translated: or it is the apprehension of something that is contradictory with it, or of an effect that is contradictory with it, and so on,

original: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'i phyir cig shos 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa'i phyir cig shos 'gog pa'o //
translated: or it is the apprehension of something that is pervaded by a contradiction with it.

original: mtshan nyid de las sbyor ba thams cad the tshom gyi rgyur rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de las sbyor ba thams cad the tshom gyi rgyur rtogs par bya'o //
translated: From this definition, it should be understood that all syllogisms are the causes of doubt.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba las 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgrub par bya ba las 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In the same way, in order to prove that one possesses attachment and so on, it is not the case that the opposite of the discordant side is shown.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang don gzhan yin pa'i phyir tshig las @143b mi rtogs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang don gzhan yin pa'i phyir tshig las @143b mi rtogs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Desire and so on are also different objects, so it should be understood that they are not known from the words.

original: gal te tshig don gzhan yin mod /
analyzed: gal te tshig don gzhan yin mod /
translated: If desire and so on are different objects,

original: de ltar na yang ci ltar tshig las mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang ci ltar tshig las mi rtogs she na /
translated: then how are they not known from the words?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / tshig 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / tshig 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the words are not related to desire and so on.

original: 'brel ba med pa las kyang ci ltar mi ldog ce na /
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa las kyang ci ltar mi ldog ce na /
translated: If they are not related, then how are they not known?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis te /
translated: They are known through the characteristics of inference.

original: 'brel pa med par ci ltar go byed ma yin pa de ltar ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med par ci ltar go byed ma yin pa de ltar ni rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid las rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as they are not understood without being related, they are known through the characteristics of inference.

original: 'di snyam du 'dod chags yod na tshig yod la med na ni med pa de'i phyir tshig 'dod chags yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pas ci ltar de dang ma 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'dod chags yod na tshig yod la med na ni med pa de'i phyir tshig 'dod chags yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pas ci ltar de dang ma 'brel zhe na /
translated: If you think, “If desire exists, the words exist, and if it does not exist, they do not exist. Therefore, because the words follow the existence and nonexistence of desire, how are they not related?”

original: bshad pa / 'dod chags med na tshig med do zhes de ltar 'dod chags log na tshig ldog pa nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'dod chags med na tshig med do zhes de ltar 'dod chags log na tshig ldog pa nges pa ni med do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If there is no attachment, there is no speech. Thus, if attachment is refuted, it is not certain that speech is refuted.

original: ci ltar nges pa med /
analyzed: ci ltar nges pa med /
translated: How is it not certain?

original: gang gi phyir smra ba po chags pa na 'dod chags las tshig mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smra ba po chags pa na 'dod chags las tshig mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that when a speaker is attached, speech is seen to arise from attachment,

original: 'di ltar lus kyi g-yo ba dang ngag gi tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyi g-yo ba dang ngag gi tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: in that case, the movement of the body and the speech of the speaker and so on are not the effects of attachment and aversion and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i don bstan par 'dod pa tsam ma /
analyzed: bshad pa / brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i don bstan par 'dod pa tsam ma /
translated: We respond: The mere desire to teach the general meaning of what is to be expressed

original: sgra brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the cause of the mere desire to express the sound.

original: don dang ldan pa'i sgra la ni gnyi ga rgyu yin la don med pa la ni sgra brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin no //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i sgra la ni gnyi ga rgyu yin la don med pa la ni sgra brjod par 'dod pa tsam rgyu yin no //
translated: In the case of meaningful sounds, both are causes. In the case of meaningless sounds, the mere desire to express the sound is the cause.

original: 'dod chags yod kyang tshig de'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags yod kyang tshig de'i rjes su byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Even if attachment exists, the mere desire to express is not the effect of that speech.

original: 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang brjod par 'dod pa tsam gyi'o //
translated: However, the mere desire to express is the cause of that speech.

original: des na tshig ni brjod par 'dod pa'i spyi'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshig ni brjod par 'dod pa'i spyi'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, speech is not the effect of attachment, because it is the general cause of the desire to speak.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa lus kyi bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa lus kyi bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu yin gyi /
translated: Immoral conduct is the effect of attachment, but speech is not.

original: tshig ni 'ga' yang ma yin pa des na de nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i spyi'i rgyu can yin par brjod do //
analyzed: tshig ni 'ga' yang ma yin pa des na de nyid brjod par 'dod pa'i spyi'i rgyu can yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is the general cause of the desire to speak.

original: gal te 'dod chags ni zhen pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags ni zhen pa nyid yin la /
translated: If attachment is clinging,

original: sgra brjod pa dang don bstan par 'dod pa yang zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra brjod pa dang don bstan par 'dod pa yang zhen pa yin te /
translated: then speech is also clinging, because it is the desire to express and to teach the meaning.

original: des na de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is attachment.

original: 'dod chags yin mod /
analyzed: 'dod chags yin mod /
translated: It is attachment,

original: tshig brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig brjod par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: but it is asserted to be the effect of the desire to speak.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in this, because it is desired.

original: brjod par 'dod pa la ni 'dod chags su mi smra ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa la ni 'dod chags su mi smra ste /
translated: We do not say that the desire to speak is attachment,

original: 'on kyang rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas 'phangs ba la 'dod chags su brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas 'phangs ba la 'dod chags su brjod do //
translated: but we say that it is attachment because it is projected by the manifest clinging to permanence, pleasure, and the self.

original: 'di ltar bdag rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag gi bde ba'i rgyu nyid du sgro @144a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag gi bde ba'i rgyu nyid du sgro @144a * //
translated: In this way, the self is exaggerated to be permanent, blissful, and the cause of the bliss of the self.🔽

original: btags nas chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btags nas chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having superimposed the self as permanent, happy, and as the cause of its own happiness, one becomes attached.

original: 'dir ther zug tu gnas pa nyid ni rtag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ther zug tu gnas pa nyid ni rtag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, permanence is not just enduring.

original: tha na snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig gnyis gcig tu byed pa yang rtag par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: tha na snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig gnyis gcig tu byed pa yang rtag par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Even if one makes the two moments of past and future the same, it is still grasping permanence.

original: dar 'dzin pa bdag tu lta ba yang de'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: dar 'dzin pa bdag tu lta ba yang de'i yul can yin no //
translated: The view of the self as the appropriator is also the view of the self as the object of that.

original: 'dod chags can bdag bde bar 'dod pa ni ci ltar gzhan gyi don la mi 'jug pa de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa skad cig ma phyi ma rnams shin tu tha dad pa yin par mthong nas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags can bdag bde bar 'dod pa ni ci ltar gzhan gyi don la mi 'jug pa de bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bde ba dang ldan pa skad cig ma phyi ma rnams shin tu tha dad pa yin par mthong nas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the lustful one who desires his own happiness does not engage in the welfare of others, so too, seeing that the future moments endowed with happiness are completely different, one does not engage in the welfare of others.

original: de'i phyir sems yongs su bslang pa mi rtag pa dang bdag med par smra ba rnams kyang 'dod chags skyes pa'i dus na snga ma dang phyi ma skad cig ci tsam pa zhig gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems yongs su bslang pa mi rtag pa dang bdag med par smra ba rnams kyang 'dod chags skyes pa'i dus na snga ma dang phyi ma skad cig ci tsam pa zhig gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even those who advocate the impermanence and selflessness of the mind, when attachment arises, are attached to the mere moment of the prior and subsequent moments as being the same.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul yang de yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i yul yang de yin te /
translated: That is the object of the conception of self.

original: des na 'dod chags ni rtag pa dang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags ni rtag pa dang bdag dang bdag gir lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Therefore, attachment is not mistaken with regard to that which precedes the view of permanence and the view of mine.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi don du 'jug gi bdag gi don du mi 'jug pa ni bdag gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no zhes de ltar 'jug pas skad cig thams cad snga phyi gcig tu 'gyur ba la mi ltos te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi don du 'jug gi bdag gi don du mi 'jug pa ni bdag gzhan la phan 'dogs pa yin no zhes de ltar 'jug pas skad cig thams cad snga phyi gcig tu 'gyur ba la mi ltos te /
translated: One who engages for the sake of others, not for one’s own sake, is one who benefits others. Since one engages in this way, one does not rely on all the moments being the same in the past and future.

original: 'jug pa'i 'bras bu bdag gyur par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i 'bras bu bdag gyur par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one does not assert that the result of engagement becomes one’s own self.

original: rtag par 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dang 'dzin pa ni nyes pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi dang 'dzin pa ni nyes pa dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: The conception of permanence that precedes the conception of mine is faulty.

original: skad cig tsam la dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig tsam la dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not an object of mere moments,

original: de'i don ni gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa las ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don ni gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa las ldog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its meaning is to turn away from benefiting others.

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu bstan to //
translated: This shows the cause of passion.

original: nyon mongs pa zag pa dang lhan cig pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa dang rjes su 'brel pa sgro btags pa'i bdag dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zag pa dang lhan cig pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos ni bdag la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa dang rjes su 'brel pa sgro btags pa'i bdag dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: The object of passion is a defiled thing that is associated with the outflows, which is connected with the superimposition of a self, etc. , and has a nature that is in accord with the self that is superimposed.

original: de'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can yin no //
translated: It is the object of that.

original: 'dis ni yul brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni yul brjod do //
translated: This shows the object.

original: bdag dang bde ba'i rgyu mi bden pa la mngon par dga' ba ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bde ba'i rgyu mi bden pa la mngon par dga' ba ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Passion is the desire for what is unreal, which is the cause of a self and of pleasure.

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags kyi rnam pa brjod do /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags kyi rnam pa brjod do /
translated: This shows the form of passion.

original: bdag la sogs par lta ba can sgro btags pa la 'dzin pa mi bden pa'i yon tan la zhen pa'i rnam pa can ni 'dod chags yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag la sogs par lta ba can sgro btags pa la 'dzin pa mi bden pa'i yon tan la zhen pa'i rnam pa can ni 'dod chags yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Passion is the grasping of the superimposition that has the view of a self, etc. , which has the form of attachment to unreal good qualities. This is the meaning.

original: dga' ba de'i yul bdag dang bde ba dang bde ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang mi mthun pa la des zhes bya ba mi mthun pas byas pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba de'i yul bdag dang bde ba dang bde ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dang mi mthun pa la des zhes bya ba mi mthun pas byas pa ste /
translated: The object of that joy is the self, pleasure, and the cause of pleasure.

original: 'dis ni bdag la @144b sogs par lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i yul can du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag la @144b sogs par lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can dang zag pa dang bcas pa'i yul can du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it has as its object the self, etc., and that it is associated with the outflows.

original: 'di ltar bdag la sogs par lta ba yod na de dang mi mthun par mthun par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag la sogs par lta ba yod na de dang mi mthun par mthun par mthong ba yin no //
translated: For when there is the view of the self, etc., one sees what is not in accord with that as in accord with it.

original: bdag la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa yang sgro btags nyid de /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa yang sgro btags nyid de /
translated: And what is not in accord with the self, etc. is just a superimposition,

original: bdag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self, etc. do not exist.

original: 'khrul pa ni 'di ni bdag gi gzhom par bya ba yin no zhes gtong ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni 'di ni bdag gi gzhom par bya ba yin no zhes gtong ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Error is the aspect of giving up, thinking, “I will destroy that.”

original: 'di ni zhe sdang gi rnam pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhe sdang gi rnam pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the aspect of hatred.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyi ga'i rten rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log ni gti mug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyi ga'i rten rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log ni gti mug go //
translated: The error of permanence, etc. in regard to the support of both attachment and hatred is delusion.

original: sgro btags kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems kyi skyon yin pas 'ga' zhig 'di dag dang bral ba yang srid de /
analyzed: sgro btags kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de kho na nyid 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sems kyi skyon yin pas 'ga' zhig 'di dag dang bral ba yang srid de /
translated: Attachment and so on, which are the nature of superimposition, are faults of the mind that has the nature of apprehending reality. Therefore, it is possible that some are free from these,

original: de dag ni tshig gi rgyur ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni tshig gi rgyur ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not established as the cause of words.

original: gal te de ltar na brjod par 'dod pa dang / snying rje la sogs pa yang bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can dang / sgro btags pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na brjod par 'dod pa dang / snying rje la sogs pa yang bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can dang / sgro btags pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then compassion and so on, which are preceded by the view of self, would be the apprehension of superimposition.

original: bshad pa / snying rje la sogs pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / snying rje la sogs pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says, Compassion and so on are not like that, preceded by the superimposition of self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro //🔽bdag tu lta ba yod pa la mthong ba'i phyir ni bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro // bdag tu lta ba yod pa la mthong ba'i phyir ni bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin gyi /
translated: Because they exist elsewhere.🔽Compassion and so on are not preceded by the view of self because they exist even when the view of self does not exist.

original: 'on kyang de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not preceded by the view of self because they exist when the view of self does not exist and they do not exist when the view of self exists.

original: de yang ci ltar sngar sa bon yod na phyis myu gu yod pa ni sa bon yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can yin pa ltar snga ma dang phyi ma las ni ma yin gyi /🔽'on kyang bdag tu lta ba'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang ci ltar sngar sa bon yod na phyis myu gu yod pa ni sa bon yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can yin pa ltar snga ma dang phyi ma las ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang bdag tu lta ba'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, just as the existence of the sprout later on is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of the seed, it is not dependent on the prior or later,🔽but rather on the one part of the view of self, because when one sees the self, one sees the thing that is in conformity with the self or the other thing.

original: bdag nyid du mthong ba na bdag dang rjes su mthun ba'am cig shos kyi dngos po mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid du mthong ba na bdag dang rjes su mthun ba'am cig shos kyi dngos po mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the grasping of the inverted is preceded by the view of self.

original: snying rje la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Compassion, etc., are not like that.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni snying rje'o //🔽med pa'i phan pa mngon par 'dod pa ni byams ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni snying rje'o // med pa'i phan pa mngon par 'dod pa ni byams ba'o //
translated: Thus, the desire for the separation of the existent from suffering is compassion.🔽The desire for the nonexistence of benefit is love.

original: 'on par 'dod pa'i phan pas dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'on par 'dod pa'i phan pas dga' ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The joy in the benefit that is desired is joy.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba dang bde ba thob par 'dod pa'i 'og tu bde sdug btang snyoms pa ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba dang bde ba thob par 'dod pa'i 'og tu bde sdug btang snyoms pa ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Equanimity is the desire that sentient beings be free from suffering and obtain happiness.

original: brjod par 'dod pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su brjod do //
translated: The desire to speak is said to be of two kinds.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni bdag la dmigs nas 'jug @145a * //🔽pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni bdag la dmigs nas 'jug @145a * // pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, these are not engaged by observing the self.🔽And it is not the case that they are understood to be the nature of error in regard to another.

original: gzhan la phyin ci log gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes 'di thams cad ni rnam 'grel du bshad zin to //🔽'dod chags la sogs pa phyin ci log dang / brjod par 'dod pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par gyur pa de la ci ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa smra ba ltar te /
analyzed: gzhan la phyin ci log gi rang bzhin du rtogs pa yang ma yin no zhes 'di thams cad ni rnam 'grel du bshad zin to // 'dod chags la sogs pa phyin ci log dang / brjod par 'dod pa la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par gyur pa de la ci ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa smra ba ltar te /
translated: All of this has been explained in the Pramii(laviirttikam).🔽In regard to that, the error of attachment, etc., and the non-error of the desire to speak, etc.,

original: ci skad bshad pa'i 'dod chags dang 'brel par smra ba de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba yang brjod par 'dod pa nyid las smra'o //
analyzed: ci skad bshad pa'i 'dod chags dang 'brel par smra ba de ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba yang brjod par 'dod pa nyid las smra'o //
translated: just as one who is attached speaks, so also one who is free from attachment speaks, because of the desire to speak, just as it has been explained.

original: des na ldog pa med pas 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir tshig tsam las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi rtogs so //
analyzed: des na ldog pa med pas 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir tshig tsam las ni 'dod chags la sogs pa mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, since it is not a result, one does not understand desire, etc. from mere words.

original: ci ltar tshig tsam las ma yin pa de bzhin du tshig gi khyad par las kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar tshig tsam las ma yin pa de bzhin du tshig gi khyad par las kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as one does not understand from mere words, so also one does not understand from a particular word.

original: 'dod chags kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i tshig gi khyad par nyid ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'bras bur gyur pa'i tshig gi khyad par nyid ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a particular word that is the result of desire, etc. is not the result of aversion, etc.

original: gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi 'khrul pa'i tshig gi khyad par de ni yod pa mi yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi 'khrul pa'i tshig gi khyad par de ni yod pa mi yin no //
translated: That particular word which is not mistaken with regard to desire, etc. does not exist.

original: tshig thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid ma yin no //
translated: Because all words are mistaken with regard to desire, etc., they are not results.

original: 'khrul pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why are they mistaken?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i 'bras bur mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i 'bras bur mthong ba yin te /
translated: Because the convention of the result of desire, etc. is seen as the result of aversion, etc.

original: tha snyad 'chol ba des na 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad 'chol ba des na 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Because of that confused convention, there is error.

original: yang ci ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su chags pa'i yul tha snyad 'jug par byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su chags pa'i yul tha snyad 'jug par byed ce na /
translated: How can one who is free from passion engage in the conventional usage of terms that express passion?

original: bsam pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the intention is difficult to understand.

original: yul can bsam pas yul mngon par bsam pa'i don brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yul can bsam pas yul mngon par bsam pa'i don brjod pa yin te /
translated: The object is understood by the intention of the subject, and the meaning of the expression is understood.

original: tha snyad kyi dgos pa ni rnam pa du ma yod pa de bas na dgos pa gang yang bsams nas 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa lta bur spyod pa mngon par bsams pa'i don de ni shes par dka'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dgos pa ni rnam pa du ma yod pa de bas na dgos pa gang yang bsams nas 'dod chags dang bral ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa lta bur spyod pa mngon par bsams pa'i don de ni shes par dka'o //
translated: Since there are many purposes of conventional usage, when one engages in the conventional usage of terms that express passion, although one is free from passion, the meaning of the expression is difficult to understand, since the intention is not obvious.

original: 'chol ba yang mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'chol ba yang mthong ba yin te /
translated: One also sees confusion,

original: de bas 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas 'khrul pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid ma yin no //
translated: so it is not the case that there is no result.

original: gal te bdag mthong na don du gnyer bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te bdag mthong na don du gnyer bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one sees the self, one will strive for it.

original: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa la ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba spangs pa la ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad dgos pa dang ldan pas khyab pa mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is not tenable that the usage of the wise is necessarily purposeful, since there is no purpose in abandoning the view of the self.

original: des na tha snyad nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: des na tha snyad nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, we infer attachment, etc. from the conventional itself.

original: mi smra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi smra ba ma yin te /
translated: We do not remain silent,

original: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the sake of others.

original: bdag ma mthong ba ni bdag gi don du tha snyad byed par mi 'gyur gyi /🔽gzhan gyi don du ni @145b 'gyur ba nyid de bdag tu lta ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ma mthong ba ni bdag gi don du tha snyad byed par mi 'gyur gyi / gzhan gyi don du ni @145b 'gyur ba nyid de bdag tu lta ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who does not see the self does not make conventions for the sake of the self,🔽but does for the sake of others, because it does not depend on the view of self.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi tha snyad la yang don du gnyer ba nyid kyis khyab la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi tha snyad la yang don du gnyer ba nyid kyis khyab la /
translated: And in the case of conventions for the sake of others, it is not necessary that they be motivated by attachment,

original: don du gnyer ba yang 'dod chags yin no //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba yang 'dod chags yin no //
translated: because attachment is not the only motivation.

original: des na bdag med par rig pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: des na bdag med par rig pa 'dod chags dang bral ba la don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that one who knows selflessness is free from attachment, because there is no motivation.

original: mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not untenable,

original: snying rjes kyang tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rjes kyang tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one engages in conventions out of compassion.

original: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Engaging in the welfare of others is of two kinds:

original: bdag nyid bde ba don du gnyer ba dang / gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid bde ba don du gnyer ba dang / gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: One seeks one’s own happiness and one seeks the freedom from suffering of others.

original: de la bdag dang sred pa dang bral ba la bdag gi don med kyang gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba don du gnyer bas 'jug pa ni mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de la bdag dang sred pa dang bral ba la bdag gi don med kyang gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba don du gnyer bas 'jug pa ni mi 'gal lo //
translated: In this regard, although one who is free from self-love and craving has no self-interest, it is not contradictory that he engages in activity because he seeks the freedom from suffering of others.

original: gal te de ltar na don du gnyer ba'i rang bzhin can snying rje de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /🔽don du gnyer ba tsam la 'dod chags zhes khyed 'dod pa ni mi 'gog go //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na don du gnyer ba'i rang bzhin can snying rje de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na / don du gnyer ba tsam la 'dod chags zhes khyed 'dod pa ni mi 'gog go //
translated: If this is so, then compassion, which has the nature of seeking, is itself attachment.🔽We do not deny that mere seeking is called attachment.

original: kho bo cag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'dod chags dang ldan par thal ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba yang 'dod chags dang ldan par thal ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not follow that one who is free from attachment to sense objects is attached,

original: 'di ltar snying rje dang 'dod chags rang bzhin ni tha dad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rje dang 'dod chags rang bzhin ni tha dad do //
translated: because the nature of compassion is different from that of attachment.

original: gal te bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang mi 'dogs pa dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa de ltar na yang don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid 'khor bar gnas pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa dang mi 'dogs pa dag gi rang bzhin tha dad pa de ltar na yang don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid 'khor bar gnas pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: But if the essence of those who superimpose a self and those who do not superimpose a self are different, then the cause of abiding in samsara is precisely the one who is desirous.

original: srid pa yang 'byung ba can yang 'di nyid yin no /
analyzed: srid pa yang 'byung ba can yang 'di nyid yin no /
translated: And this is the one who comes into existence in samsara.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis 'khor bar gnas pa'i rgyu nyid du ni rang bzhin tha mi dad do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis 'khor bar gnas pa'i rgyu nyid du ni rang bzhin tha mi dad do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, these two are not essentially different in being the cause of abiding in samsara.

original: bshad pa / mi sdug pa sgro btags pa la mngon par dga' ba'i skyes bu gang yin pa de skye bar nying mtshams 'brel par byed pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid du yang rang bzhin tha dad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / mi sdug pa sgro btags pa la mngon par dga' ba'i skyes bu gang yin pa de skye bar nying mtshams 'brel par byed pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i rgyu nyid du yang rang bzhin tha dad do //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: The person who delights in superimposing the unattractive is essentially different in being the cause of samsara because he links with birth.

original: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba yong na bdag la chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu lta ba yong na bdag la chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: For if the view of the self exists, then attachment to the self arises.

original: bdag la chags pa la ni smag pa'i mngal gyi gnas sdug bsngal ba la bde bar phyin ci log pa las ni bdag gi bde pa don du gnyer zhing de las ni mngal yongs su 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: bdag la chags pa la ni smag pa'i mngal gyi gnas sdug bsngal ba la bde bar phyin ci log pa las ni bdag gi bde pa don du gnyer zhing de las ni mngal yongs su 'dzin par byed la /
translated: One who is attached to self, due to the error of taking as pleasant the painful state of the womb, seeks his own happiness and from that he takes up the womb.

original: mngal yongs su 'dzin pa dang mi mthun pa bdag gi bde ba don du gnyer ba'i las kyang byed do //
analyzed: mngal yongs su 'dzin pa dang mi mthun pa bdag gi bde ba don du gnyer ba'i las kyang byed do //
translated: And he also performs actions that seek his own happiness, which are incompatible with taking up the womb.

original: ci skad du rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: ci skad du rnam 'grel las /
translated: As the Pramii(laviirttikam) says:

original: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang // sred pa kun las 'ching ba'i rgyu //🔽skye bo gang la de med pa //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyin ci log blo dang // sred pa kun las 'ching ba'i rgyu // skye bo gang la de med pa //
translated: The cause of bondage to all craving and the mind of error about pain🔽is not found in the person

original: de yi skye bo mi 'byung ngo //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //🔽rang gi bdag la sred pa med pa ni bdag gi don du cung zhig len pa'am spong @146a * //
analyzed: de yi skye bo mi 'byung ngo // zhes bshad pa yin no // rang gi bdag la sred pa med pa ni bdag gi don du cung zhig len pa'am spong @146a * //
translated: who is free of that.🔽There is no taking up of the womb🔽for one who is free of craving for self.

original: ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: One who is free of craving for self does not have the slightest taking up or rejection for his own sake.

original: de gang las skye ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de gang las skye ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: From what would he take up birth?

original: gang gi phyir phyin ci log dang mngon par dga' ba dag skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba na snying rje ni skyon med do //🔽gal te snying rje yang skyon 'dzin par byed na ni phyin ci log las byung ba nyid ma yin yang skyon nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyin ci log dang mngon par dga' ba dag skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa de nyid kyi phyir phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba na snying rje ni skyon med do // gal te snying rje yang skyon 'dzin par byed na ni phyin ci log las byung ba nyid ma yin yang skyon nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the very thing that takes up the error and delight, therefore, compassion arises from non-error.🔽If compassion were to take up an error, then even though it did not arise from error, it would still be an error.

original: gal te snying rje yang phyin ci log las byung ba nyid ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te snying rje yang phyin ci log las byung ba nyid ma yin mod /
translated: Even though compassion does not arise from error,

original: bdag med pa mthong ba la ni de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bdag med pa mthong ba la ni de mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable in the vision of selflessness.

original: gang gi phyir snying rje la 'jug par 'gyur ba de bdag ma mthong ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying rje la 'jug par 'gyur ba de bdag ma mthong ba yin na /
translated: If compassion is the non-vision of self,

original: gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba gang gis byed ce na /
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba gang gis byed ce na /
translated: then by what is the suffering of others removed?

original: snying rje ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: snying rje ni zhes smos so //
translated: Compassion is said to be the non-vision of self.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang re zhig skad cig ma sdug bsngal tsam ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang re zhig skad cig ma sdug bsngal tsam ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: Even without the apprehension of self, the mere suffering of the moment is seen.

original: sngar sems can du 'dzin pa'i dus na yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can gyi snying rje goms pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar sems can du 'dzin pa'i dus na yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can gyi snying rje goms pa yin te /
translated: Previously, when you were still grasping at sentient beings, you cultivated compassion that has the cause of suffering.

original: des na sdug bsngal tsam mthong bas sngon goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin no ;
analyzed: des na sdug bsngal tsam mthong bas sngon goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin no ;
translated: Therefore, compassion arises from the power of previous habituation, seeing merely the suffering of others.

original: de'i phyir ci ltar bdag gi don la 'jug pa ltar skad cig snga phyi dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i byed pa por bsams nas 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar bdag gi don la 'jug pa ltar skad cig snga phyi dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir bdag nyid sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i byed pa por bsams nas 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that you engage in the welfare of others by thinking, I will be the agent who frees myself from suffering, just as I engage in my own welfare, because the earlier and later moments are the same.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i don du gnyer ba'i skad cig thams cad sngon goms pa las nga'o nga'o snyam pa de ltar skye'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i don du gnyer ba'i skad cig thams cad sngon goms pa las nga'o nga'o snyam pa de ltar skye'o //
translated: However, the thought I will be the one who strives for the purpose of freedom from suffering arises from previous habituation to all the moments that strive for freedom from suffering.

original: de la rang gi 'bras bu la sbyor bar byed pa ni 'ga' zhig kho na yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rang gi 'bras bu la sbyor bar byed pa ni 'ga' zhig kho na yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Some, but not all, moments connect with their own effect.

original: 'di rigs pa tsam gyis rang 'dod du smras pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rigs pa tsam gyis rang 'dod du smras pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not a personal opinion, but a mere logical principle.

original: 'di ltar mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las /
translated: A sutra declares:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems can la dmigs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa rig pa'i chos la dmigs pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba rnams kyis dmigs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi sems can la dmigs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa rig pa'i chos la dmigs pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba rnams kyis dmigs pa med par bstan to //
translated: The Lord has taught that love, compassion, and so on are focused on sentient beings by ordinary beings, focused on phenomena by those who know the selflessness of persons, and not focused at all by those who are free from the aspects of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gal te sems can la dmigs pa ni so so'i skye bos goms par byas pas yin na chos la dmigs pa goms pa med par ci ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems can la dmigs pa ni so so'i skye bos goms par byas pas yin na chos la dmigs pa goms pa med par ci ltar skye zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that the focus on sentient beings is due to the cultivation of ordinary beings, how does the focus on phenomena arise without the cultivation of that?

original: bshad pa / byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms de dag kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las 'jug pa gang dag la yod pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / byams pa dang snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms de dag kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las 'jug pa gang dag la yod pa'o //
translated: It is said that those who have the engagement of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity through the cultivation of those of a similar type have the focus on sentient beings.

original: khyad par ni 'di tsam du zad de /🔽ci srid sems can du mthong @146b ba de srid du ni sems can la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di tsam du zad de / ci srid sems can du mthong @146b ba de srid du ni sems can la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: This is the only difference.🔽For as long as one sees sentient beings, for that long there is the focus on sentient beings.

original: ci srid chos mthong ba de srid du ni chos la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci srid chos mthong ba de srid du ni chos la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: For as long as one sees phenomena, for that long there is the focus on phenomena.

original: 'di dag gi rigs mthun pa goms pa yod pa dang khyad par du gyur pa'i rjes su byed par ni mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rigs mthun pa goms pa yod pa dang khyad par du gyur pa'i rjes su byed par ni mthong ba nyid do //
translated: We see that they are similar in type and that they are subsequent to the cultivation of the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: 'o na bdag tu lta ba log kyang bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can dag las gzhan pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na bdag tu lta ba log kyang bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can dag las gzhan pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa goms pa las 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: But even if the view of the self is eliminated, attachment and so on arise from the cultivation of other states that are preceded by the view of the self.

original: snying rje la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: This is just like compassion and so on.

original: bshad pa / gang gis bdag tu lta ba log pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa goms pa la 'jug pa de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gis bdag tu lta ba log pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ba 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa goms pa la 'jug pa de ltar ma yin no //
translated: We reply: Attachment and so on do not arise from the cultivation of states that are similar in type to the view of the self, even if the view of the self is eliminated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist when there is no error.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa phyin ci log gi rjes su byed pa yang de ma thag tu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa phyin ci log gi rjes su byed pa yang de ma thag tu bshad pa yin no //
translated: We have just explained that attachment and so on are subsequent to error.
