translated: Because it includes all things that have the reason in doubt, and because there is no certainty about any of them.

original: de lam nges pa'i yan lag bye brag gi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de lam nges pa'i yan lag bye brag gi dngos po thams cad bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to show that the branches of the path include all specific things, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir gang la dngos po'i chos srog la sogs pa gnas par 'gyur ba tha dad pa'i phung po gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang la dngos po'i chos srog la sogs pa gnas par 'gyur ba tha dad pa'i phung po gzhan ni med do //
translated: Because there is no other separate aggregate in which the attributes of a real entity, such as life, etc., could be located.

original: gal te phung po gzhan yod na de'i tshe bdag med pa nyid med pa ni gdon mi za bar bdag dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te phung po gzhan yod na de'i tshe bdag med pa nyid med pa ni gdon mi za bar bdag dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were another aggregate, then it would not be certain that the absence of self is the absence of a real entity, and that the presence of self is the presence of a real entity.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is another possibility.

original: rnam grangs kyi gnyis las gcig la nges par mthong na the tshom du 'gyur gyi de lta ma yin na ni mi rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi gnyis las gcig la nges par mthong na the tshom du 'gyur gyi de lta ma yin na ni mi rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: When one sees the certainty of one of the two alternatives in a dichotomy, there is doubt about the other. But if there is no certainty of either, there is no doubt.

original: ci'i phyir phung po gzhan med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po gzhan med ce na /
translated: Why is there no other aggregate?

original: bdag yod pa dang med pa dag gis dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag yod pa dang med pa dag gis dngos po thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all entities are included in the presence or absence of self.

original: gal te dngos po la bdag med pa ni bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te dngos po la bdag med pa ni bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: If there is no self in an entity, it is without self.

original: de ste yod na ni bdag dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ste yod na ni bdag dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: If there is a self, it is with self.

original: des na bdag yod pa dang med pa dag gis thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag yod pa dang med pa dag gis thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, all entities are included in the presence or absence of self.

original: gcig la yang nges pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /🔽bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa 'di gnyis las gcig la gnas par te /
analyzed: gcig la yang nges pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa 'di gnyis las gcig la gnas par te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no certainty even in one, he says:

original: yod par nges pa med do //
analyzed: yod par nges pa med do //
translated: Between these two, with and without self, there is no certainty that one exists.

original: 'jug par nges pa shes na ni go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug par nges pa shes na ni go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were certainty in engagement, then it would be a proof.

original: @153a * // ma nges na ni ci rigs par mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba 'am /
analyzed: @153a * // ma nges na ni ci rigs par mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba 'am /
translated: If there is no certainty, then there is doubt as to whether there is a pervasion in the similar or dissimilar instances.

original: ldog pa ma grub pa'i ma nges pa dang / gnyis la ma nges par 'jug na thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa ma grub pa'i ma nges pa dang / gnyis la ma nges par 'jug na thun mong ma yin pa yin no //
translated: If there is no certainty in both, then it is not a unique property.

original: de'i phyir gcig la yang 'jug par ma nges par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la yang 'jug par ma nges par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is doubt as to whether there is a pervasion in one, it is not a unique property.

original: gal te dngos po gzhan med na srog la sogs pa de dag nyid 'ga' zhig la gdon mi za bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gzhan med na srog la sogs pa de dag nyid 'ga' zhig la gdon mi za bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir nges pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If there is no other entity, then there is certainty because those, such as life, definitely abide in something.

original: bden te / srog la sogs pa ni gdon mi za bar 'di dag gcig la gnas pa yin no //🔽'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba bdag dang bcas pa 'am bdag med pa nyid du grub pa ste /
analyzed: bden te / srog la sogs pa ni gdon mi za bar 'di dag gcig la gnas pa yin no // 'on kyang de'i bdag nyid du zhes bya ba bdag dang bcas pa 'am bdag med pa nyid du grub pa ste /
translated: True, but life force and so on must exist in one of these two.

original: nges pa'i dngos po la srog la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir nges pa med do //
analyzed: nges pa'i dngos po la srog la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir nges pa med do //
translated: But it is not ascertained whether they exist in the self or not, because it is not established that they exist in the nature of the self or in the absence of self.

original: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni phyis 'di nyid 'ga' zhig la gnas so zhes shes kyi /🔽bdag dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni phyis 'di nyid 'ga' zhig la gnas so zhes shes kyi / bdag dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: It is ascertained that life force and so on exist in this or that being because they are properties of real things.

original: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la gnas par ni mi shes pa'i phyir nges pa med do //
analyzed: bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la gnas par ni mi shes pa'i phyir nges pa med do //
translated: But it is not ascertained whether they exist in the self or not, because it is not known whether they exist in the self or not.

original: 'dis ni gnyis la rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnyis la rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za ba bshad do //
translated: This explains doubt regarding the two universals.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ldog pa la yang the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ldog pa la yang the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it also explains doubt regarding the two particulars.

original: gal te phung po gnyis yin na dngos po'i chos su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig las ldog na gdon mi za bar gzhan la gnas par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te phung po gnyis yin na dngos po'i chos su 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig las ldog na gdon mi za bar gzhan la gnas par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If life force and so on were the properties of real things, then if they were absent in one thing, they would definitely exist in another.

original: des na rnam pa 'dis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa 'dis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this shows that there is doubt about the concomitance and the reverse concomitance.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi the tshom za ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gtan tshigs kyi the tshom za ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba bstan nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Thus, since there is no third cause of doubt about the reason other than the two that have been stated, and since there is doubt about the uncommon cause, i.e., the concomitance and the reverse concomitance, he concludes by saying:

original: de bas na gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi srog la sogs pa ni zhes bya bas ni phyogs kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na gson po'i lus dang 'brel pa can gyi srog la sogs pa ni zhes bya bas ni phyogs kyi chos nyid de /
translated: Therefore, life force and so on that are related to a living body.

original: mig gis gzung ba nyid las ni sgra la rtag pa pa dang mi rtag pa'i dpyod pa mi 'jug go //
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba nyid las ni sgra la rtag pa pa dang mi rtag pa'i dpyod pa mi 'jug go //
translated: The analysis of whether sound is permanent or impermanent does not apply to what is perceived by the eye.

original: de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ni dpyod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos ni dpyod pa 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the property of the subject is the cause of the application of the analysis.

original: gnyis kyis bdag nyid las phyi rol du gyur ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir the tshom gyi gzhi de dag las ldog pa ma @153b yin no ;
analyzed: gnyis kyis bdag nyid las phyi rol du gyur ba'i dngos po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir the tshom gyi gzhi de dag las ldog pa ma @153b yin no ;
translated: Because there is no entity whatsoever that is external to the two, the basis of doubt is not the opposite of those.

original: 'dis ni rnam pa gnyis su nges pa'i phyir the tshom gyi rgyu nyid yin par mjug bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam pa gnyis su nges pa'i phyir the tshom gyi rgyu nyid yin par mjug bsdus pa ste /
translated: This concludes the demonstration that the reason for doubt is because of the ascertainment of the two.

original: gnyis su nges pa gang yin pa de nyid the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su nges pa gang yin pa de nyid the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: That which is ascertained as the two is the reason for doubt.

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: “ It is not concomitant” concludes the doubt about concomitance and reversal.

original: bdag dang bcas pa 'am bdag med pa'i bdag nyid gcig la yang ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa 'am bdag med pa'i bdag nyid gcig la yang ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med do /
translated: Because of the non-establishment of the cause in one who has a self or in one who is selfless, there is no concomitance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nges pa med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because there is no ascertainment of concomitance.

original: ldog pa nges na rjes su 'gro ba ma nges par ni mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa nges na rjes su 'gro ba ma nges par ni mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If there is ascertainment of reversal, it is not tenable that there is no ascertainment of concomitance. This is the explanation.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba la the tshom za par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is doubt about the pervasion.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba'i phyir dang / sdar bshad pa rnam pa gnyis nges pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges ba ste /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la the tshom za ba'i phyir dang / sdar bshad pa rnam pa gnyis nges pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ma nges ba ste /
translated: Thus, because there is doubt about the pervasion and the counter pervasion, and because the two explanations are contradictory, and because of the nature of the position, there is the fault of inconclusiveness.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: It is the cause of doubt.

original: gtan tshigs de las bsgrub par bya ba 'am cig shos dag tu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de las bsgrub par bya ba 'am cig shos dag tu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that reason, there is no certainty about the probandum or the other.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu the tshom za ba'i phyir 'di las 'dod pa 'am mi 'dod pa nges pa ma yin pa des na the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tu the tshom za ba'i phyir 'di las 'dod pa 'am mi 'dod pa nges pa ma yin pa des na the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Because there is doubt about the pervasion and the counter pervasion in the similar and dissimilar classes, there is no certainty about the desired or undesired conclusion. Therefore, it is the cause of doubt.

original: gal te de ltar na mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir mi rtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir mi rtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then because of not seeing the reason in the similar and dissimilar classes, there is the fault of inconclusiveness.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'di las mi rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa 'di las mi rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that this doubt does not arise with regard to the possession of life, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is related to something.

original: the tshom gyi gzung ba'i bye brag gang yang rung ba zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad ni de gnyis kyis bsdus la /
analyzed: the tshom gyi gzung ba'i bye brag gang yang rung ba zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad ni de gnyis kyis bsdus la /
translated: Because it is related to some particular object of doubt.

original: 'di yang dngos po'i chos yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang dngos po'i chos yin no //
translated: Because all things are included in those two, and this is a property of things.

original: bye brag gang rung dang 'brel pa yin yang chos chos can gang dang 'brel pa med pa'i chos can de la ni chos de las the tshom skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag gang rung dang 'brel pa yin yang chos chos can gang dang 'brel pa med pa'i chos can de la ni chos de las the tshom skye ba ma yin te /
translated: What is the property of something is related to some particular thing, but the property of something that is not related to some subject is not a cause of doubt with regard to that subject.

original: dper na mig gis gzung ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gang rung dang 'brel pa yin yang /
analyzed: dper na mig gis gzung ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gang rung dang 'brel pa yin yang /
translated: For example, being perceived by the eye is related to being either permanent or impermanent,

original: sgra dang ma 'brel pa las de la the tshom za ba'i rgyu ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra dang ma 'brel pa las de la the tshom za ba'i rgyu ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but it is not a cause of doubt with regard to sound, because it is not related to sound.

original: srog la sogs pa'i chos las ni chos can 'di bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i chos gnyis las gang dang 'brel par gnas zhes ci ltar the tshom @154a * //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa'i chos las ni chos can 'di bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa'i chos gnyis las gang dang 'brel par gnas zhes ci ltar the tshom @154a * //
translated: How could one not doubt whether this subject is related to the self or to a non-self?

original: mi byed / ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: mi byed / ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dper na skyes bu gcig dang 'brel pa yongs su shes pa med pa'i mngal chags pa las rtogs pa'i bud med las skyes bu'i khyad par dang 'brel par the tshom za ste /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu gcig dang 'brel pa yongs su shes pa med pa'i mngal chags pa las rtogs pa'i bud med las skyes bu'i khyad par dang 'brel par the tshom za ste /
translated: For example, a woman who has no knowledge of her relationship with a certain man doubts whether she is related to a particular man because of the conception of pregnancy.

original: ma 'brel par mngal chags pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'brel par mngal chags pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for a woman to become pregnant without a relationship.

original: srog chags gang la mngal chags par ni mthong la skyes bu gcig dang 'brel par ma nges pa de la /
analyzed: srog chags gang la mngal chags par ni mthong la skyes bu gcig dang 'brel par ma nges pa de la /
translated: When a woman sees that she is pregnant, but does not know for certain that she is related to a certain man,

original: srid pa'i skyes bu dag dang 'brel bar rtogs pa po de the tshom skyed par byed do //
analyzed: srid pa'i skyes bu dag dang 'brel bar rtogs pa po de the tshom skyed par byed do //
translated: she doubts whether she is related to the man who is the father of the child.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po thams cad dang bdag ngang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa'i nang du ma 'dus pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang dngos po thams cad dang bdag ngang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa'i nang du ma 'dus pa mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: In the same way, here, because it is not possible that all things are not included in the self or in a non-self,

original: nang du 'dus pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos srog la sogs pa las the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: nang du 'dus pa'i phyir dngos po'i chos srog la sogs pa las the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Because it is included within the two, one doubts whether the phenomena of entities such as life force exist or not.

original: 'on mi rtogs par ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'on mi rtogs par ci ste mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why not assert that it is non-comprehension?

original: gang gi phyir ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba bdag yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar rtogs pa dang the tshom za ba de gnyis med pas gnyi gar rtogs pa dang the tshom med pa de'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa de 'dra ba'i mi rtogs pa ni
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba bdag yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar rtogs pa dang the tshom za ba de gnyis med pas gnyi gar rtogs pa dang the tshom med pa de'i rang bzhin can gang yin pa de 'dra ba'i mi rtogs pa ni
translated: Because it is non-comprehension, it is the nature of both comprehension and non-comprehension, and it is the nature of both doubt and non-doubt.

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don 'ga' zhig yod na 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa'i don 'ga' zhig yod na 'gyur gyi /
translated: If there were some object external to both existence and non-existence, it would be so.

original: dngos po thams cad bye brag gnyis kyi nang du 'dus na ci ltar mi rtogs pa nges pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad bye brag gnyis kyi nang du 'dus na ci ltar mi rtogs pa nges pa med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: But if all things are included within the two, how could non-comprehension be the nature of indecision?

original: the tshom za bar ni rigs so //
analyzed: the tshom za bar ni rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to doubt.

original: srog la sogs pa 'di ni bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa 'di ni bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: This life force and so on would be either with a self or without a self.

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other alternative.

original: gal te thams cad nang du 'dus pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gal te thams cad nang du 'dus pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: If life, etc., are causes of doubt because they are included in the two,

original: de lta na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las phyi rol du gyur ba med pa'i phyir mig gis gzung ba nyid las kyang the tshom za bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa las phyi rol du gyur ba med pa'i phyir mig gis gzung ba nyid las kyang the tshom za bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then, since the permanent and the impermanent are not excluded, there would be doubt even with respect to what is perceived by the eye.

original: gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa nyid 'dis the tshom gyi rgyur brjod pa yin no zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa nyid 'dis the tshom gyi rgyur brjod pa yin no zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: The point is that this very non-exclusion from the two is stated to be a cause of doubt.

original: ma yin te ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //🔽gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa ci snyed pa de thams cad du the tshom gyi rgyu ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma yin te ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to // gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa ci snyed pa de thams cad du the tshom gyi rgyu ni ma yin gyi /
translated: No, because it is not related. This has already been explained.🔽Not all that is not excluded from the two is a cause of doubt.

original: 'on kyang dngos po'i chos can gang la yod pa de nyid la de gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa'i phyir the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po'i chos can gang la yod pa de nyid la de gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa'i phyir the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Rather, it is only that which is a property of an entity, and that very thing is a cause of doubt because it is not excluded from the two.

original: mig gis gzung ba nyid ni gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med kyang @154b sgra dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba nyid ni gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med kyang @154b sgra dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir the tshom gyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The eye is not a cause of doubt because it is not related to the word.

original: gang gi phyir bye brag gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa dang / bye brag dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par the tshom za ba de'i phyir rang gi gzhi nyid la yod pa thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bye brag gnyis las phyi rol du gyur pa med pa dang / bye brag dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par the tshom za ba de'i phyir rang gi gzhi nyid la yod pa thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Since there is no third possibility apart from the two, particular and general, and since one doubts whether the particular follows or does not follow the general, the uncommon property that exists in the basis itself is the cause of doubt.

original: srog la sogs pa ni khyad par du the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni khyad par du the tshom gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Life force and so on are causes of doubt in particular.

original: 'di ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag tu rab tu grub pa bum pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa las ldog par nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag tu rab tu grub pa bum pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa las ldog par nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus the property of being audible is ascertained as the opposite of the permanent and the impermanent, which are established in a vase and space and so on.

original: bdag ni rang bzhin gyis bskal bas bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la yang yod pa dang med par ma grub par rgyu'i phyir srog la sogs pa yang de la 'jug pa dang ldog par ma grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa khyad par du the tshom🔽za ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni rang bzhin gyis bskal bas bum pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig la yang yod pa dang med par ma grub par rgyu'i phyir srog la sogs pa yang de la 'jug pa dang ldog par ma grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa khyad par du the tshom za ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Since I am naturally excluded, it is not established that anything, such as a pot, exists or does not exist. Since it is not established that life force, etc. engage or disengage from that, life force, etc. are the cause of doubt about the distinction.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa nyid du ma nges pas de las ldog kyang bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa gcig las kyang ldog par nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa nyid du ma nges pas de las ldog kyang bdag dang bcas pa'am bdag med pa gcig las kyang ldog par nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is not ascertained that a pot, etc. are with a self or without a self, even though it is excluded from that, it is not ascertained that it is excluded from either with a self or without a self. This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni don 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni don 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: This expresses the meaning:

original: thun mong ma yin pa ci srid pa ni 'ga' zhig las log par nges kyang ma yin na srog la sogs ba 'ga' las kyang ldog par ma nges pa gang yin pa ci ltar ma nges pa ma yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ci srid pa ni 'ga' zhig las log par nges kyang ma yin na srog la sogs ba 'ga' las kyang ldog par ma nges pa gang yin pa ci ltar ma nges pa ma yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since it is not ascertained that life force, etc. disengage from anything, how is it not ascertained that it is excluded from anything?

original: don gzhan 'bras bu ma yin pa las don gzhan mi 'grub pa'i yang phyir the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: don gzhan 'bras bu ma yin pa las don gzhan mi 'grub pa'i yang phyir the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do //
translated: and because something that is not an effect cannot be established as something different from that.

original: go bar byed pa srog la sogs pa ni bdag las tha dad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: go bar byed pa srog la sogs pa ni bdag las tha dad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa med do //
translated: The life force and so on, which are the means of understanding, are not related to the self by the relation of being the same nature because they are different from the self.

original: 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: They are not even effects.

original: ci ltar 'bras bu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'bras bu ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are they not effects?

original: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa dang / bdag ni lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'grub po ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa dang / bdag ni lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'grub po ci ltar zhe na /
translated: The life force and so on and the self are not established as having the relation of cause and effect.

original: rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po de ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po de ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because the relation of cause and effect is based on the observation and nonobservation of something.

original: gang la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa yod par 'gyur ba bdag ni bltar rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa yod par 'gyur ba bdag ni bltar rung ba ma yin no //
translated: The self is not suitable to be observed, because the reason for establishing the relation of cause and effect is the observation and nonobservation of something.

original: 'di snyam du rang bzhin 'brel pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rang bzhin 'brel pas ci zhig bya snyam na /
translated: If you think, “What is the use of a relation by nature?”

original: bshad pa / 'brel pa med pa 'ga' zhig yod na de las gzhan yod par nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'brel pa med pa 'ga' zhig yod na de las gzhan yod par nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: If something unrelated exists, then it is not ascertained that something else exists.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i @155a * //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de'i @155a * //
translated: Because it would follow that anything could arise from anything.

original: phyir the tshom za ba'i rgyu nyid do //🔽gzhan dag srog la sogs pa ni bdag go bar byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyir the tshom za ba'i rgyu nyid do // gzhan dag srog la sogs pa ni bdag go bar byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is the cause of doubt.🔽Others say: Life force and so on are the self because they are the reverse of that which is not life force and so on.

original: srog la sogs pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i ldog pa na gcig tu nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i ldog pa na gcig tu nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are ascertained to be one.

original: nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because they are ascertained.

original: ci ltar gcig tu nges she na ;
analyzed: ci ltar gcig tu nges she na ;
translated: How are they ascertained to be one?

original: gang gi srog la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa kho na las ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi srog la sogs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag med pa kho na las ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: Because life force and so on are the reverse of that which is not life force and so on,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin pa de'i phyir nges pa yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la ni ma yin pa de'i phyir nges pa yin no //
translated: but they are not the reverse of that which is life force and so on. Therefore they are ascertained.

original: ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs las mi ldog ce na /
translated: How are they not the reverse of that which is life force and so on?

original: med pa las ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa las ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that they are the reverse of that which does not exist.

original: yod pa gang yin pa de ni byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ldog mtshams su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yod pa gang yin pa de ni byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ldog mtshams su 'gyur gyi /
translated: That which exists is a limit because it has the capacity to function.

original: bdag ni pha rol po la med pa'i phyir med pa de ci ltar ldog mtshams yin /
analyzed: bdag ni pha rol po la med pa'i phyir med pa de ci ltar ldog mtshams yin /
translated: But since the self does not exist for the opponent, how can that which does not exist be a limit?

original: byed pa'i nus ba dang bral bas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin la /
analyzed: byed pa'i nus ba dang bral bas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin la /
translated: Since it lacks the capacity to function, it is not an object of perception or inference.

original: gang zhig tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa ma nges pa de la ni 'ga' yang yod pa dang med par nges par byar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig tshad ma'i yul ma yin pa ma nges pa de la ni 'ga' yang yod pa dang med par nges par byar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is not an object of a means of valid knowledge cannot be ascertained.

original: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yin pa de bas na ci ltar gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba gcig tu nges pa ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yang go bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yin pa de bas na ci ltar gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba gcig tu nges pa ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yang go bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: And since life force, etc., are ascertained as a single class, they are a reason for ascertaining the pervasion that whatever is an object of comprehension is necessarily a product, just as they are a reason for ascertaining the pervasion that whatever is a sound is necessarily impermanent.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa go bar byed pa yin na 'o na ci ltar mnyan bya nyid go bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa go bar byed pa yin na 'o na ci ltar mnyan bya nyid go bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If life force, etc., are a reason for ascertaining the pervasion, then why are objects of comprehension not a reason for ascertaining the pervasion that whatever is a sound is necessarily an object of comprehension?

original: gang gi phyir gang las go byed du 'gyur ba mnyan bya nyid ni de ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang las go byed du 'gyur ba mnyan bya nyid ni de ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the quality of being a sound that is heard is not ascertained in the same way in regard to that from which there is an understanding.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is excluded from both the similar and the dissimilar instances.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga las ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yongs su rdzogs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga las ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma yongs su rdzogs par gnas pa'o //
translated: This completes the opponent’s position.

original: slob dpon gyis bshad pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la nges pa ldog pa'i rnam pa de lta bu smra ba pha rol po des mi bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bshad pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la nges pa ldog pa'i rnam pa de lta bu smra ba pha rol po des mi bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The master [Nāgārjuna] explains: The opponent who speaks in this way, in the form of an exclusion that is ascertained in regard to the dissimilar instances, does not establish the relation of invariable concomitance.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir bdag med pa nyid la med pa yin gyi bdag la ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag med pa nyid la med pa yin gyi bdag la ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: Because selflessness does not exist, but a self does not not exist.

original: de la yang med pa nyid yin gyi yod pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar bdag med pa la nges pa dang ldan pa'i dgag pa gnyis brjod pa'i shugs kyis bdag la gnas pa ste yod pa'i //
analyzed: de la yang med pa nyid yin gyi yod pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar bdag med pa la nges pa dang ldan pa'i dgag pa gnyis brjod pa'i shugs kyis bdag la gnas pa ste yod pa'i //
translated: Thus, the two negations, “non-existence” and “not existent,” are expressed by the force of the ascertainment of selflessness.

original: @155b ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: @155b ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the nature of the self that is not existent?

original: gnas pa las gzhan bdag de nyid la med pa dang / gzhan la yod pa gzhan de gnyis dang ma 'brel par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa las gzhan bdag de nyid la med pa dang / gzhan la yod pa gzhan de gnyis dang ma 'brel par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said that the self is not existent in itself, nor is it existent in another.

original: 'di ltar bdag med pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag med pa la dgag pa nges pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag med pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di ni bdag med pa la dgag pa nges pa yin te /
translated: Thus, “in selflessness” is the ascertainment of the negation in selflessness.

original: de nyid la med pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid la med pa yin te /
translated: It is not existent in itself.

original: bdag la yang med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la yang med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-existent in the self.

original: med pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag med pa la med pa kho na'i /
analyzed: med pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag med pa la med pa kho na'i /
translated: “Non-existence” indicates that in selflessness, there is only non-existence.

original: yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not existent.

original: srog la sogs pa med pa la bdag med pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pa la bdag med pa nges pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of selflessness is in the non-existence of life-force, etc.

original: bdag la srog la sogs pa'i gnas pa de 'dra ba ni bdag med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag la srog la sogs pa'i gnas pa de 'dra ba ni bdag med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Such an existence of life-force, etc. in the self does not occur without the self.

original: med na mi 'byung ba yin pa de nyid kyis na rjes su 'gro ba grub pa'i 'ga' yang ldog pa yan 'gar bas ldog pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba yin pa de nyid kyis na rjes su 'gro ba grub pa'i 'ga' yang ldog pa yan 'gar bas ldog pa can ma yin no //
translated: But because of the fact that it is not possible without it, there is no reversal of the pervasion by the reversal of the anvaya.

original: med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur mod nged la ci chad ce na /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur mod nged la ci chad ce na /
translated: If it is not possible without it, what is the harm to us?

original: gal te 'gyur na cung zad kyang med mod kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na cung zad kyang med mod kyi yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were, there would be nothing at all, but it is not.

original: gang gi phyir med na mi 'byung ba ni 'brel pa yin no /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med na mi 'byung ba ni 'brel pa yin no /
translated: Because the non-possibility without it is the relation.

original: de yang bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is a relation by its own nature, not by another.

original: de ltar yin dang bdag nyid 'brel pa de ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las gzhan med do zhes le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang bdag nyid 'brel pa de ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las gzhan med do zhes le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
translated: That being so, that relation by its own nature is not other than identity and origination, as has been explained in Chapter Two.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las 'byung ba de dag kyang gang la mthong ba yod pa de nyid la 'grub la /
analyzed: des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las 'byung ba de dag kyang gang la mthong ba yod pa de nyid la 'grub la /
translated: Therefore, those identities and origins are established only where seeing exists.

original: bdag ni mthong ba med pa de'i phyir srog la sogs pa bdag med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni mthong ba med pa de'i phyir srog la sogs pa bdag med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: I am not seen. Therefore, life force and so on are not established as not arising without a self.🔽If there is no certainty of a single relation, then there is no arising without it. Since that does not exist, how can there be certainty of a single relation?

original: ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ni med na mi 'byung ba yin na de ni med pa'i phyir de ji ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yin zhes gang bshad pa ni bdag dang med na mi 'byung ba med pa de snyid kyi phyir rgyu gang las 'di
analyzed: ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ni med na mi 'byung ba yin na de ni med pa'i phyir de ji ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yin zhes gang bshad pa ni bdag dang med na mi 'byung ba med pa de snyid kyi phyir rgyu gang las 'di
translated: Whatever is said is just that: the self and the absence of arising without it do not exist. Therefore, from what cause

original: ldog pa can zhes brjod pas bdag ldog kyang srog la sogs pa 'di ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa can zhes brjod pas bdag ldog kyang srog la sogs pa 'di ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: is it said to be a single relation? Even if the self is eliminated, this life force and so on are not eliminated.

original: ci ltar 'brel pa med pa gzhan log na ldog par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'brel pa med pa gzhan log na ldog par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that something unrelated is not eliminated when something else is eliminated?

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig dang 'brel pa med pa de ni de'i 'brel pa'i yul ma yin pa 'ga' zhig ldog na nges par ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig dang 'brel pa med pa de ni de'i 'brel pa'i yul ma yin pa 'ga' zhig ldog na nges par ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that which is unrelated is not related to that, it is not the case that when something is eliminated, it is definitely eliminated.

original: de de ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ni 'brel par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de de ltar ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ni 'brel par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If it were like that, then there would be certainty of a single relation.

original: 'brel yang / rjes su 'gro ba yin pa des na rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ni 'ga' @156a * //🔽yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel yang / rjes su 'gro ba yin pa des na rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa gcig tu nges pa ni 'ga' @156a * // yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But even though there is a relation, it is a relation of pervasion. Therefore, there is no invariable concomitance without pervasion.🔽And there is no invariable concomitance with pervasion.

original: khyad par la ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par la ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a pervasion in the case of a distinction.

original: de bas na ldog pa nges pa med pa dang rjes su 'gro ba yang nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa nges pa med pa dang rjes su 'gro ba yang nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no invariable concomitance without pervasion, nor is there a pervasion without invariable concomitance.

original: 'o na ci ltar slob dpon gyis mnyan bya nyid ldog pa can du bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar slob dpon gyis mnyan bya nyid ldog pa can du bshad ce na /
translated: But how is it that the master [Dignāga] explained that the object of hearing is a negative phenomenon?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pa gzung nas slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan bya nyid ldog pa can du bshad do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la ma mthong ba tsam tshad ma ma yin pa gzung nas slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan bya nyid ldog pa can du bshad do //
translated: The master Dignāga explained that the object of hearing is a negative phenomenon, having understood that mere non-perception in the similar and dissimilar classes is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: mnyan bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang mthong ba med do //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang mthong ba med do //
translated: The object of hearing is not seen in the similar class, nor is it seen in the dissimilar class.

original: mthong ba med pa de tsam gyis med par nges pa yang med do zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa de tsam gyis med par nges pa yang med do zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained more than once that the mere fact that something is not seen does not mean that it is ascertained not to exist.

original: gal te mthong ba med pa las med pa rtogs par 'gyur na the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba med pa las med pa rtogs par 'gyur na the tshom gyi rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If nonexistence were understood on the basis of nonseeing, then nonseeing would not be the cause of doubt.

original: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would it not be the cause of doubt?

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig la gang med do zhes de ltar nges par de dmigs par 'gyur ba na mi srid pa'i yul de la the tshom za bar ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig la gang med do zhes de ltar nges par de dmigs par 'gyur ba na mi srid pa'i yul de la the tshom za bar ni mi rigs so //
translated: Because when one ascertains that something does not exist in a certain place, it is not possible to doubt whether that object exists in that place.

original: 'di de la med pa nyid do zhes nges pa dang / yod dam zhes the tshom za ba cig car du ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di de la med pa nyid do zhes nges pa dang / yod dam zhes the tshom za ba cig car du ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not possible to ascertain that something is absent in a certain place and to doubt whether it is absent at the same time.

original: des na mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dag dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par the tshom za ba nyid do //
analyzed: des na mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs dag dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par the tshom za ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, audibility, etc., are causes of doubt as to whether the property of the subject is present or absent in similar and dissimilar cases.

original: pha rol po dag la yang srog la sogs pa go bar byed pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: pha rol po dag la yang srog la sogs pa go bar byed pa nyid du sgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To prove that life, etc., are the reason for the existence of a self, the opponent says:

original: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la bdag ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i phyir gson po'i lus la bdag ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Since life force and so on do not exist, the self would be refuted in the living body, because the self is pervaded by the absence of life force and so on.

original: khyab bya bdag med pa yod na khyab byed srog la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba yin na khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa yang 'di la yod do //
analyzed: khyab bya bdag med pa yod na khyab byed srog la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba yin na khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa yang 'di la yod do //
translated: If the pervaded, the self, exists, the pervader, life force and so on, would not exist.

original: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pas khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ldog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba dmigs pas khyab par byed pa med pa'i phyir khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ldog go //
translated: Therefore, because of the observation of something contradictory with the pervader, the pervader does not exist. Therefore the pervaded, the self, is refuted.

original: des na rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas par 'grub po zhes dogs pa la bshad pa /
analyzed: des na rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas par 'grub po zhes dogs pa la bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, because another possibility is impossible, the living body is established as possessing a self.

original: bdag ldog na srog la sogs pa ldog par thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ldog na srog la sogs pa ldog par thal ba ma yin no //
translated: If the self is refuted, it is not the case that life force and so on are refuted.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag dang ma 'brel pa srog la sogs pa 'brel pa med la nye bar mi sbyor ba'i don gyi med pa gang yin pa de la khyab pa ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang ma 'brel pa srog la sogs pa 'brel pa med la nye bar mi sbyor ba'i don gyi med pa gang yin pa de la khyab pa ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason for the nonestablishment of the pervasion is that life force and so on, which are not related to the self, are not related to it and do not apply to it.

original: me dang 'brel bas na @156b du ba ni de med na med pa'i phyir bdag nyid med pas me med pa la khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: me dang 'brel bas na @156b du ba ni de med na med pa'i phyir bdag nyid med pas me med pa la khyab pa yin no //
translated: Since smoke is related to fire, it is pervaded by the absence of fire, because it does not exist when the latter is absent.

original: de bzhin du srog la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung bas bdag dang 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung bas bdag dang 'brel ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, life force and so on are related to the self because they are of the nature of the self or arise from it.

original: 'brel pa'i yul nye bar sbyor ba de ldog na ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i yul nye bar sbyor ba de ldog na ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the object of the relation is applied, it ceases.

original: de ltar na yang srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since life force and so on do not exist, the absence of the self is pervaded by the absence of life force and so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir bdag dang 'brel ba grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa med pa bdag med pa la khyab kyi /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bdag dang 'brel ba grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa med pa bdag med pa la khyab kyi /
translated: But why is the absence of life force and so on pervaded by the absence of the self because the relation to the self is established?

original: de ltar ma yin par ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin par ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not so, then what?

original: gang gi srog la sogs pa med pa de med de srog la sogs pa yod na khyab par bya ba bdag med pa med par te /
analyzed: gang gi srog la sogs pa med pa de med de srog la sogs pa yod na khyab par bya ba bdag med pa med par te /
translated: If life force and so on do not exist, the self does not exist. If life force and so on exist, the pervaded object, the absence of the self, does not exist.

original: bdag grub pa'i rgyus srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir khyab pa de yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: bdag grub pa'i rgyus srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa la khyab pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir khyab pa de yang mi 'grub po //
translated: Since the self is not established by the cause of the self, the pervasion is not established because of the logical argument that the self is nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag med pa bzlog pa bdag dang srog la sogs pa la 'grel pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa bzlog pa bdag dang srog la sogs pa la 'grel pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opposite of the self’s nonexistence, the self, life-force, and so on, are established.

original: 'brel pa yod na ni srog la sogs pa med pa med de srog la sogs pa yod na bdag med pa bdag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na ni srog la sogs pa med pa med de srog la sogs pa yod na bdag med pa bdag 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is a connection, the life-force and so on are not nonexistent. If the life-force and so on exist, the self’s nonexistence is established as the self.

original: de bas na bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i phyir grub pa'i yul 'brel pa yin na med pa dag khyab par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa'i phyir grub pa'i yul 'brel pa yin na med pa dag khyab par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the self’s nonexistence is pervaded by the life-force and so on, if the established object is connected, the nonexistent is pervaded.

original: ci'i phyir 'brel pa ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'brel pa ma grub ce na /
translated: Why is the connection not established?

original: gang gi phyir bdag dang srog la sogs pa de dag gi 'brel ba ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag dang srog la sogs pa de dag gi 'brel ba ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag las shes pa yin no //
translated: Because the connection between the self and the life-force and so on is known from the observed and the unobserved.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the point of that?

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa de dag ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa de dag ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'grub bo //
translated: But that is not established in the case of a very hidden object.

original: dmigs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'grub mod /
analyzed: dmigs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'grub mod /
translated: Granted that non-apprehension is not established in the case of a very hidden object,

original: mi dmigs pa go ci ltar med ce na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa go ci ltar med ce na /
translated: but why is non-apprehension not non-existent?

original: rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po la ni snang ba mi dmigs pa dbang du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po la ni snang ba mi dmigs pa dbang du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the non-apprehension of appearance is controlled in the case of the entity of cause and effect.

original: de nyid ni med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid ni med do zhes brjod do //
translated: That itself is said to be non-existent.

original: de de ltar gal te bdag med pa 'ga' zhig srog la sogs pa med pa dang ldan par mthong ba de ltar na yang khyab par med do zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: de de ltar gal te bdag med pa 'ga' zhig srog la sogs pa med pa dang ldan par mthong ba de ltar na yang khyab par med do zhes brjod nas /
translated: If one sees that some non-self is endowed with the absence of life-force, etc., then, even so, one should say that there is no pervasion.

original: da ni bdag med pa nyid ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang srog la sogs pa med pas khyab par mthong ba'i bdag med pa yang gang yin /
analyzed: da ni bdag med pa nyid ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang srog la sogs pa med pas khyab par mthong ba'i bdag med pa yang gang yin /
translated: Now, when it is said that selflessness is not established, one should say: Moreover, what is that selflessness which is seen to be pervaded by the absence of life-force, etc.?

original: bum pa la sogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is a pot, etc.

original: yul tha dad pa gzhan du mthong ba med pa'i bdag gang yin @157a * //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa gzhan du mthong ba med pa'i bdag gang yin @157a * //
translated: What is that self which is seen to be different from the various objects?

original: pa de bum pa la sogs pa snang ba la med do zhes ga las shes pa yin /
analyzed: pa de bum pa la sogs pa snang ba la med do zhes ga las shes pa yin /
translated: How do you know that the object of the eye consciousness that appears as a pot does not exist in a pot?

original: don gzhan la bltar rung ba'i don ni shes pa gcig la 'brel pa can gzung ba na med par nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan la bltar rung ba'i don ni shes pa gcig la 'brel pa can gzung ba na med par nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When the object that is suitable to be seen by another sense consciousness is related to one consciousness, it is ascertained as not existing.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa la ldog pa shes pa med pa bdag gi ldog pa'i ste /
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa la ldog pa shes pa med pa bdag gi ldog pa'i ste /
translated: Therefore, the non-existence of a pot, etc. is the non-existence of the object of the consciousness that is the opposite of the object of the eye consciousness.

original: med pa'i srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: med pa'i srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: The non-existence of the life-force, etc. is not necessarily the opposite of the object of the eye consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa yang mthong ba nyid las la lar yod pa'am med par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa yang mthong ba nyid las la lar yod pa'am med par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because the life-force, etc. are also understood as existing or not existing in some places through seeing.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig na yod par rtogs pa ni mthong ba nyid las yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i dngos po 'ga' zhig na yod par rtogs pa ni mthong ba nyid las yin no //
translated: Because the existence of some seen thing is understood through seeing.

original: shes pa gcig las 'dre ba can rtogs na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba rtogs pa'i dus su med pa rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: shes pa gcig las 'dre ba can rtogs na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba rtogs pa'i dus su med pa rtogs par byed do //
translated: When the object related to one consciousness is understood, the non-existence of the object related to one consciousness is understood.

original: gang zhig la lar mthong bas yod par rtogs pa dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba rtogs pas med par rtogs par 'gyur ba bdag ni bltar rung ba de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig la lar mthong bas yod par rtogs pa dang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba rtogs pas med par rtogs par 'gyur ba bdag ni bltar rung ba de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the self is not like that, because it is not seen in some places and not seen as mixed with consciousness in one place.

original: de'i phyir bdag de yod pa dang med par mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag de yod pa dang med par mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, the self is not understood to exist or not exist.

original: de bas na srog la sogs pa dang bral ba'i bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med par ma grub ste /
analyzed: de bas na srog la sogs pa dang bral ba'i bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med par ma grub ste /
translated: Therefore, a pot, etc., which is devoid of life, etc., is not established as selfless.

original: des na bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pas khyab par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pas khyab par ga la 'gyur /
translated: So how could the absence of self entail the absence of life, etc.?

original: gang yang gal te gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas pa ma yin na de srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang gal te gson po'i lus bdag dang bcas pa ma yin na de srog la sogs pa dang mi ldan par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the living body does not have a self, it follows that it does not have life, etc.,

original: bdag med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes pha rol pos brjod pa de yang srog la sogs pa dang bdag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes pha rol pos brjod pa de yang srog la sogs pa dang bdag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med par mi 'grub po //
translated: because it would be without a self, like a pot, etc. But the opponent cannot establish that the self and life, etc. are not related as cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma gyur mod /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma gyur mod /
translated: They are not related as cause and effect.

original: bdag ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par go ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ldog pa na srog la sogs pa ldog par go ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the self is refuted, how could it be understood that life force, etc. are refuted?

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa gzhan bkag pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes mi dmigs par te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa gzhan bkag pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes mi dmigs par te /
translated: Because the nonexistence of something that is neither cause nor effect is not established by nonapprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnams su sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnams su sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained previously in the syllogisms of nonapprehension.

original: tha dad pa med pa yin na ni khyab par byed pa bkag pa go bar byed pa yin no //🔽tha dad bas ni 'bras bu bkag pa rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa bkag pa'i go bar byed pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa yin na ni khyab par byed pa bkag pa go bar byed pa yin no // tha dad bas ni 'bras bu bkag pa rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa bkag pa'i go bar byed pa yin pa'am /
translated: If they are not different, the negation of the pervader is established by the negation of the pervaded.

original: rgyu bkag pas 'bras bu bkag pa'i go byed yin no //
analyzed: rgyu bkag pas 'bras bu bkag pa'i go byed yin no //
translated: If they are different, the negation of the effect is established by the negation of the unobstructedly powerful cause, or the negation of the cause is established by the negation of the effect.

original: 'dis ni srog la sogs pa dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir @157b rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po btsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni srog la sogs pa dang bdag nyid gcig pa nyid med pa'i phyir @157b rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po btsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This shows that since the self is not identical with life force, etc., their causal relationship must be sought.

original: bdag 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag 'bras bu ni ma yin te /
translated: The self is not the effect of life force, etc.

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent.

original: lhag mar gyur pas rgyu nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pas rgyu nyid yin grang na /
translated: If it is the remainder, it is the cause.

original: rgyu'i dngos po de bdag bltar mi rung ba'i phyir mi 'grub po zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po de bdag bltar mi rung ba'i phyir mi 'grub po zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained more than once that the self is not established as the basis of seeing because it is not suitable to be seen.

original: bdas mthong ba yin du chug pa de lta na yang ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'grub po /
analyzed: bdas mthong ba yin du chug pa de lta na yang ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'grub po /
translated: Even if it were the case that the self is seen, the state of being a cause and effect is not established because the reversal is not established.

original: gang zhig mthong na gang mthong zhing /
analyzed: gang zhig mthong na gang mthong zhing /
translated: When one sees something, what is seen?

original: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan dag yod kyang de med par mthong ba de ni de'i 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan dag yod kyang de med par mthong ba de ni de'i 'bras bu yin na /
translated: If the effect of a cause is that which is seen when the cause is seen, and that which is not seen when the cause is not seen, even though other causes that have the ability to produce it exist, then the effect is that which is seen when that cause is seen, and that which is not seen when that cause is not seen.

original: bdag med pa ni 'gar yang mthong ba med de rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni 'gar yang mthong ba med de rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the self is never seen because it is permanent.

original: des na bdag ldog pa med pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag ldog pa med pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the self does not reverse, it is not the basis of a cause.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa nyid ldog pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba de'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa nyid ldog pa'i yul yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because life and so on are not seen in the self, which is without life and so on, the reversal is the object of the self,

original: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan nye ba med pa can rnam pa de lta bu'i ldog pa la ni rgyu'i nus pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan nye ba med pa can rnam pa de lta bu'i ldog pa la ni rgyu'i nus pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: then the ability of the cause to produce the effect is not established in that kind of reversal, which is the absence of other causes that have the ability to produce it.

original: 'di ltar nus pa gzhan med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu ma skyes sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa gzhan med pa nyid kyis 'bras bu ma skyes sam /
translated: Thus, because of the absence of any other potential, the effect is not produced.

original: 'on te mngon par 'dod pa de med pas zhes the tshom za ba'i phyir nus pa mi 'grub po //
analyzed: 'on te mngon par 'dod pa de med pas zhes the tshom za ba'i phyir nus pa mi 'grub po //
translated: Or, if you doubt that the effect is not produced because the desired effect is absent, then the potential is not established.

original: 'o na gang las nus pa 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang las nus pa 'grub ce na /
translated: Well then, from what is the potential established?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las nus pa shes pa'i nus pa gzhan dag kyang yod kyang 'bras bu mi skye bas rgyu gzhan yod par ston par byed do zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las nus pa shes pa'i nus pa gzhan dag kyang yod kyang 'bras bu mi skye bas rgyu gzhan yod par ston par byed do zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained more than once that the potential is known from positive and negative concomitance, and that the existence of other causes is indicated because the effect is not produced even though the potential exists.

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de lta na yang ci ltar bdag ldog pa nus pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de lta na yang ci ltar bdag ldog pa nus pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, how can the absence of the self be established?

original: gang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pa la ni srog la sogs pa'i rgyu blo la sogs pa yang med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pa la ni srog la sogs pa'i rgyu blo la sogs pa yang med la /
translated: Because in a pot, etc., there is no cause of life, etc., such as mind, etc.,

original: khyed mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag kyang med do //
analyzed: khyed mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag kyang med do //
translated: and there is no self as you desire.

original: de la ci bdag med pas srog la sogs pa med dam /
analyzed: de la ci bdag med pas srog la sogs pa med dam /
translated: In that case, is life, etc., absent because the self is absent?

original: 'o na te blo la sogs pa med pas zhes the tshom za ste /
analyzed: 'o na te blo la sogs pa med pas zhes the tshom za ste /
translated: Or, do you doubt that life, etc., is absent because mind, etc., is absent?

original: de bas na ldog pa nus par the tshom za ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ldog pa nus par the tshom za ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no doubt that the reversal of the self is possible.

original: srog la sogs pa la blo la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa la blo la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the power of the intellect, etc., over life, etc., the power of the self?

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir blo la sogs pa dag kyang bdag med pa la mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid kyi phyir blo la sogs pa dag kyang bdag med pa la mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the intellect, etc., would not be non-self, because they are effects.

original: de'i phyir brgyud pas bdag ldog pa yang nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyud pas bdag ldog pa yang nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the reversal of the self is not possible even indirectly.

original: dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To refute this, we say:

original: blo la sogs pa ni bdag dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa ni bdag dang 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: The intellect, etc., are not related to the self.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why?

original: @158a * // blo la sogs pa de la ni bdag las gzhan nyid kyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @158a * // blo la sogs pa de la ni bdag las gzhan nyid kyi nus pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of the intellect, etc., is seen to be different from the self.

original: re zhig blo ni dbang po la brten pa dang yid la brten pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig blo ni dbang po la brten pa dang yid la brten pa'o //
translated: First, the intellect is based on the sense faculties and the mind.

original: de la mig la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu ni gang gi bdag nyid kyi dbang po'am yul yin te /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa'i blo'i rgyu ni gang gi bdag nyid kyi dbang po'am yul yin te /
translated: The cause of the intellect of the eye, etc., is either the sense faculty or the object that is its nature,

original: de dag gi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows the presence and absence of those.

original: nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yang rgyu yin no //
translated: The prior consciousness, which is not impaired in its capacity, is also a cause.

original: ci ste gtan du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ci ltar shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu'i dngos po yin zhe na /🔽rnam par shes pa snga ma de rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i gzung ba las yul gzhan la yengs te chags sam /
analyzed: ci ste gtan du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i ldog pa mthong ba med pa'i phyir ci ltar shes pa phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu'i dngos po yin zhe na / rnam par shes pa snga ma de rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i gzung ba las yul gzhan la yengs te chags sam /
translated: If you ask, “How can the prior consciousness be the cause of the subsequent consciousness, since the cessation of consciousness that endures for a while is not seen?,”🔽the answer is that the prior consciousness is the cause of the subsequent consciousness because the latter is seen to arise from the former.

original: 'khams pa ni sdang ba ste de dag la sogs pa gnyid log pa dang smyo ba dang rmugs pa la sogs pa gang yin par gyur na /
analyzed: 'khams pa ni sdang ba ste de dag la sogs pa gnyid log pa dang smyo ba dang rmugs pa la sogs pa gang yin par gyur na /
translated: If the prior consciousness is distracted to another object, either through attachment or aversion, and so on, and then falls asleep, becomes intoxicated, or falls into a coma,🔽then the subsequent consciousness is not produced, or it is produced in a discontinuous and confused manner, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa phyi ma gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba dang / mdo mdor rnam par chad par 'chol ba nyid dang / sogs pa smos pas mi gsal ba nyid de de ltar mthong ba'i phyir snga ma rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi ma gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba dang / mdo mdor rnam par chad par 'chol ba nyid dang / sogs pa smos pas mi gsal ba nyid de de ltar mthong ba'i phyir snga ma rgyu yin no //
translated: Since this is seen, the prior consciousness is the cause of the subsequent consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma nus pa nyams na don gzhan gyi yul can phyi ma mi skye ba nyid dam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma nus pa nyams na don gzhan gyi yul can phyi ma mi skye ba nyid dam /
translated: If the potency of the former consciousness declines, the latter consciousness, which has a different object, does not arise.

original: bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa 'chol ba dang / mi gsal bar snang ba skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa 'chol ba dang / mi gsal bar snang ba skye ba yin no //
translated: Or, it arises in a confused manner, sometimes with an interval, sometimes without an interval, and it appears unclearly.

original: 'di ltar yid gzhan la chags pa na mig dang rna ba gtad kyang yul gang na gnas pa'i gzugs dang sgra ci 'dra ba zhig lan cig ma yin par rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung bar mthong ba'i yul de na gnas pa de dag nyid
analyzed: 'di ltar yid gzhan la chags pa na mig dang rna ba gtad kyang yul gang na gnas pa'i gzugs dang sgra ci 'dra ba zhig lan cig ma yin par rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par rung bar mthong ba'i yul de na gnas pa de dag nyid
translated: Thus, when the mind is attached to another object, even though the eye and ear are directed toward their objects, the form and sound that exist in that place and are suitable to generate one’s consciousness are not seen.

original: rnam par shes pa mi skyed de //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi skyed de //
translated: The consciousness does not arise.

original: don gzhan la yid chags pa dang nyams par gyur na ro dang dri dang reg bya dag gi dbang po dang phrad nas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi gsal bar 'dzin to //
analyzed: don gzhan la yid chags pa dang nyams par gyur na ro dang dri dang reg bya dag gi dbang po dang phrad nas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir mi gsal bar 'dzin to //
translated: If the mind is attached to another object and declines, it apprehends unclearly because it is to be grasped by the sense faculties of taste, smell, and tactility.

original: khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin te /
translated: It is a causal process because it follows the specific characteristics of the cause.

original: zhing dang myu gu gnyis lta bu'am /
analyzed: zhing dang myu gu gnyis lta bu'am /
translated: For example, like a field and a sprout.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu gnyis bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sa bon dang myu gu gnyis bzhin no //
translated: Or, like a seed and a sprout, because they are subsequent to existence and non-existence.

original: gnyi ga gzung ba'i phyir mi skye ba dang 'chol ba smos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga gzung ba'i phyir mi skye ba dang 'chol ba smos so //
translated: Both are mentioned in order to avoid grasping.

original: gang gi tshe de dag kyang shin tu nye ba na 'dug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe sngar mthong ba'i dus bzhin du mi gsal bar @158b myong bar byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag kyang shin tu nye ba na 'dug par 'gyur ba de'i tshe sngar mthong ba'i dus bzhin du mi gsal bar @158b myong bar byed do //
translated: When they are very close, one experiences them as unclear, as at the time of seeing them before.

original: mi gsal bar myong ba ni rnam par phye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir yin na bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa go ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: mi gsal bar myong ba ni rnam par phye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir yin na bar dang bcas pa dang bar med pa go ci ltar zhe na /
translated: When one experiences them as unclear, it is because there is no certainty in the distinction. But how can there be a distinction between with interval and without interval?

original: yod pa'i dngos po nye bar gnas pa nyid la yid gzhan la chags pa'am /
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po nye bar gnas pa nyid la yid gzhan la chags pa'am /
translated: When an existent thing is present, the mind is attached to something else,

original: yid nyams pa med de mdor rnam par phye pa'i nges pa skye ba ste gtan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid nyams pa med de mdor rnam par phye pa'i nges pa skye ba ste gtan du ni ma yin no //
translated: or the mind is impaired. In brief, the certainty of the distinction arises, but not permanently.

original: 'di ltar dgos pa gang zhig gi dbang gis rings par 'gro ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgos pa gang zhig gi dbang gis rings par 'gro ba /
translated: Thus, by the power of what need does one go quickly?

original: gzugs la sogs pa mig la sogs pa la snang bar gyur kyang rnam par phyed pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mig la sogs pa la snang bar gyur kyang rnam par phyed pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if form and so on appear to the eye and so on, there would be no discrimination.

original: 'di ltar bdag gis ci zhig cig mthong yang de ci yin zhes rnam par phye ba ni med do zhes smra bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis ci zhig cig mthong yang de ci yin zhes rnam par phye ba ni med do zhes smra bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even though I see something, I do not discriminate what it is.

original: de bzhin du gnyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yul nye yang rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su yul nye yang rnam par shes pa mi skye ste /
translated: In the same way, consciousness does not arise in the presence of an object during sleep and so on.

original: 'di ltar gnyid log na mig phye zhing gzugs kyang mig la mngon du phyogs pa dang / rna ba la sgra nye bar 'gyur ba dang / shin tu bsung ba'i dri sna la bdug pa dang / reg bya nye bar gnas pa dang / ro khar bcug pa yin yang ci lta ci lta bu'i de la dmigs pa'i shes pa gnyid log pa la mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyid log na mig phye zhing gzugs kyang mig la mngon du phyogs pa dang / rna ba la sgra nye bar 'gyur ba dang / shin tu bsung ba'i dri sna la bdug pa dang / reg bya nye bar gnas pa dang / ro khar bcug pa yin yang ci lta ci lta bu'i de la dmigs pa'i shes pa gnyid log pa la mi skye'o //
translated: Thus, when one is asleep, even though the eyes are open and form is present before the eyes, even though sound is present before the ears, even though extremely fragrant incense is burned before the nose, even though a tactile object is present, even though a flavor is in the mouth, consciousness that observes those objects does not arise in one who is asleep.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rjes su 'gro par rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rjes su 'gro par rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the eye consciousness and so on are the continuation of the previous consciousness, which is not a deteriorated potentiality.
