original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yang nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yang nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yin te /
translated: The cause of the mental consciousness is the previous consciousness, which is not a deteriorated potentiality.

original: de'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the special effect of that.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa du ma ste /🔽nyams su myong ba tsam la rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin dang / la la ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa du ma ste / nyams su myong ba tsam la rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin dang / la la ni mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin /
translated: Thus the mental consciousness is of many types.

original: la la ni bstan bcos kyi don sems pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: la la ni bstan bcos kyi don sems pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Some are of the nature of conceptualization, which is mere experience, some are of the nature of desire, and some are of the nature of reflection on the meaning of a treatise and so on.

original: de la nyams su myong ba rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las dngos su rnam pa blangs par mthong ba yin pas de'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can ni /
analyzed: de la nyams su myong ba rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag la nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las dngos su rnam pa blangs par mthong ba yin pas de'i 'bras bu yin no // mngon par 'dod pa'i bdag nyid can ni /
translated: The experience of conceptualization is the result of the experience of the forward and reverse order of the process, since it is seen that the conceptualization is directly derived from the experience.

original: phal cher 'bad rtsol can las byung bar mthong bas 'bad rtsol gyi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa can de'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽bstan bcos la sogs @159a * //
analyzed: phal cher 'bad rtsol can las byung bar mthong bas 'bad rtsol gyi rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa can de'i 'bras bu yin no // bstan bcos la sogs @159a * //
translated: The experience of the desired is the result of the experience of the forward and reverse order of the process, since it is seen that it arises from the exertion of effort.

original: pa sems pa'i shes pa ni 'dod pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang ldog pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang ldog pa la 'dod pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: pa sems pa'i shes pa ni 'dod pas skye ba dang gnas pa dang ldog pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang ldog pa la 'dod pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa can de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The experience of the thought of treatises, etc. is the result of the experience of the forward and reverse order of the process, since it arises, abides, and ceases through desire, and it follows the presence and absence of desire.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni gnyid log pa dang / sad pa'i gnas skabs su dngos sam brgyud nas nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i rjes su byed pa can no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni gnyid log pa dang / sad pa'i gnas skabs su dngos sam brgyud nas nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i rjes su byed pa can no //
translated: The aspect of conceptualization is that which conforms to the experience of consciousness, either directly or indirectly, in the states of sleep and waking.

original: de bzhin du bstan bcos kyi don rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams kyang sngar goms pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan bcos kyi don rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams kyang sngar goms pa'i shes pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
translated: In the same way, the meaning of the treatise, conceptualization, etc., are clearly manifest because they conform to the occurrence and cessation of the consciousness that is previously familiar.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'phel ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'phel ba yang goms pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'phel ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang 'phel ba yang goms pa nyid las yin no //
translated: The increase of desirable and undesirable conceptualization and the increase of attachment and aversion also occur due to habituation.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad ni nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma snga ma la rag las te skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad ni nus pa nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma snga ma la rag las te skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, all mental consciousnesses arise in dependence on a prior consciousness that has not lost its potency.

original: de bzhin du dbang po la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yang skal ba mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu yang skal ba mnyam pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the homogeneous cause of the sense faculties, etc., is also the same.

original: 'dra ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par snga ma snga ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par snga ma snga ma yin no //
translated: the difference of the previous state of similarity.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig las ni nye bar len pa las byung ba rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa skye ba med do zhes /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig las ni nye bar len pa las byung ba rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa skye ba med do zhes /
translated: From one consciousness, there is no arising of a nature that is appropriated and a nature that is not appropriated.

original: de dang de min rang bzhin dngos zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dang de min rang bzhin dngos zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained in the verse, “The nature of that and not that.

original: de bas na mngal yongs su bzung ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bas na mngal yongs su bzung ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ” Therefore, beginning with the conception in the womb,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: the difference of conformity is the cause of appropriation,

original: blo ni rkyen yin no //
analyzed: blo ni rkyen yin no //
translated: and the mind is the condition.

original: ci ltar blo rkyen yin /
analyzed: ci ltar blo rkyen yin /
translated: How is the mind a condition?

original: gang gi phyir blo ldog ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo ldog ste /
translated: Because the mind turns back,

original: blo med na lus med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo med na lus med pa ma yin no //
translated: and without the mind, the body does not exist.

original: rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig gis ni rgyu 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba 'ba' zhig gis ni rgyu 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that mere conformity is not the cause and effect,

original: brjod pa / lus kyi byed pa ni rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa / lus kyi byed pa ni rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no //
translated: we reply: The activity of the body is engaged in and turns back in connection with consciousness.

original: blos byas pa'i g-yo ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig dang bral ba'i lus ni nam yang med do //
analyzed: blos byas pa'i g-yo ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig dang bral ba'i lus ni nam yang med do //
translated: But a body that is free from some mental fabrication of movement never exists.

original: des na byed pa'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i lus ni blos byas pa'i spyod pa 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na byed pa'i tshogs dang bcas pa'i lus ni blos byas pa'i spyod pa 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a body that is accompanied by a collection of agents is accompanied by some mental fabrication of activity.

original: de yang blo'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir blo can yin par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de yang blo'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir blo can yin par 'grub bo //
translated: And that is established as having a mind because it follows and reverses in accordance with the mind.

original: byed pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i lus ni yid kyi @159b rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i lus ni yid kyi @159b rnam par shes pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: A body that is accompanied by a collection of agents is not a condition of the mental consciousness,

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa ni lus kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because consciousness does not follow and reverse in accordance with the body.

original: ci ltar rjes su byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar rjes su byed pa ma yin te /
translated: How does it not follow?

original: gang gi tshe lus med pa rtsig pa la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus med pa rtsig pa la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa med do zhe na /
translated: When there is no body, consciousness does not exist in a wall, etc.

original: de la yang rnam par shes pa the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de la yang rnam par shes pa the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is there not doubt about consciousness in that case?

original: rnam par shes pa yod na ci ltar rtsig pa yongs su g-yo bar mi byed ce na /🔽mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yod na ci ltar rtsig pa yongs su g-yo bar mi byed ce na / mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: If consciousness exists, why doesn’t it go through a wall?

original: med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it cannot, not because it does not exist.

original: de bas na rtsig pa la sogs pa la blo ldog par the tshom za'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtsig pa la sogs pa la blo ldog par the tshom za'o //
translated: Therefore, we doubt that the mind turns away from a wall, etc.

original: de zhing la sa bon ltar lus kyi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de zhing la sa bon ltar lus kyi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that the mind follows the special qualities of the body, as a seed does the field.

original: gal te lus rgyas pa la sogs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel bar mthong ba'i phyir yid kyi blo de'i khyad par rjes su byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus rgyas pa la sogs pas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel bar mthong ba'i phyir yid kyi blo de'i khyad par rjes su byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say that the mind follows the special qualities of the body, because it is seen that desire, etc., increase when the body grows, etc.,

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang sdang ba ni yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba med par ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang sdang ba ni yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba med par ma yin no //
translated: Because desire and hatred do not occur without satisfaction and dissatisfaction.

original: de gnyis kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa med par mi 'gyur la /
translated: And those two do not occur without the conceptions of pleasure and pain.

original: de yang lus kyis byas pa lus kyis myong ba med par ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang lus kyis byas pa lus kyis myong ba med par ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the experience of the body is not without the experience of the body.

original: des na nang gi reg pa'i khyad par nyams su myong ba las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: des na nang gi reg pa'i khyad par nyams su myong ba las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the experience of the specific internal contact is the conception of the experience of pleasure.

original: de las kyang yid bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang yid bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And from that, attachment and so on arise, because they are associated with mental satisfaction and so on.

original: de bas na lus nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i yul du gyur pa na bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na lus nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i yul du gyur pa na bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, when the body is the object of the experience of consciousness, it is the cause of the activation of the latent propensities.

original: dngos su yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the direct cause of the mental consciousness.

original: mig bzhin du gzhan du mi 'thad pas kyang lus rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: mig bzhin du gzhan du mi 'thad pas kyang lus rgyu ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the cause of the body, because it is not tenable that it is different from the eye.

original: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gi nyams su myong ba las yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gi nyams su myong ba las yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is from the experience of the specific aspects of the mental consciousness.

original: gsal ba nyid dang / 'dod pa nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ni goms pa las yin zhing rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen las yin na /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid dang / 'dod pa nyid dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ni goms pa las yin zhing rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen las yin na /
translated: The nature of the body is clear, desirable, and the cause of attachment, etc. It is the nature of the realization of the immediately preceding condition.

original: de las khyad par gang zhig sgrub pas lus rgyu yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de las khyad par gang zhig sgrub pas lus rgyu yin par 'gyur //
translated: What is the special cause of the body?

original: de ltar na dbang po ma yin pa'i lus ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po ma yin pa'i lus ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the body is not the cause of the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i tshogs kyang yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin @160a * //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs kyang yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin @160a * //
translated: The collection of sense faculties is not the cause of consciousness,

original: te ; gsal bar snang ba nyid dang / yul can nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; gsal bar snang ba nyid dang / yul can nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the object of consciousness would appear clearly and would be the possessor of the object.

original: dbang bo thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa re re'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: dbang bo thams cad yid kyi rnam par shes pa re re'i rgyu yin na /
translated: If all the sense faculties are the cause of each mental consciousness,

original: nges pa med par 'gyur na gsal bar snang ba go ci ltar yin //
analyzed: nges pa med par 'gyur na gsal bar snang ba go ci ltar yin //
translated: there would be no certainty, and how could it appear clearly?

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i shes pa dbang po re res byed nus na dbang po lngar rtog pa don med do //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i shes pa dbang po re res byed nus na dbang po lngar rtog pa don med do //
translated: If a consciousness endowed with all aspects is able to be produced by each sense faculty, it is pointless to imagine five sense faculties.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi blo nyid lus kyi rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi blo nyid lus kyi rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the mental cognition alone is the cause of the body.

original: lus ni yid kyi blo'i ma yin no //🔽rgyu'i tshogs de tsam dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten pa yin pa de'i phyir de'i phyir de nyid grub pa'i rgyu yin gyi bdag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lus ni yid kyi blo'i ma yin no // rgyu'i tshogs de tsam dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten pa yin pa de'i phyir de'i phyir de nyid grub pa'i rgyu yin gyi bdag ni ma yin te /
translated: The body is not the mind’s object.🔽The collection of causes is the basis of the forward and reverse processes. Therefore, the collection of causes is the cause of the body’s production, not the self.🔽If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the collection of causes, and the self would be permanent. But if the self were other than the collection of causes, then the self would be the cause of the body even when it is not accompanied by the collection of causes.🔽If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the collection of causes, and the self would be permanent. But if the self were other than the collection of causes, then the self would be the cause of the body even when it is not accompanied by the collection of causes.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su byas pa'i rgyu'i tshogs las gzhan rtag na ni de las rgyu gzhan brtag par bya zhing de las kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽bshad zin pa'i don sdud pa ni rgyu'i tshogs gang zhig yod na gang 'gyur nyid de /🔽nam yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i rgyu'i tshogs de las gzhan pa yang de'i rgyur rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rjes su byas pa'i rgyu'i tshogs las gzhan rtag na ni de las rgyu gzhan brtag par bya zhing de las kyang gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro // bshad zin pa'i don sdud pa ni rgyu'i tshogs gang zhig yod na gang 'gyur nyid de / nam yang mi 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i rgyu'i tshogs de las gzhan pa yang de'i rgyur rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the collection of causes, and the self would be permanent. But if the self were other than the collection of causes, then the self would be the cause of the body even when it is not accompanied by the collection of causes.🔽If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the collection of causes, and the self would be permanent. But if the self were other than the collection of causes, then the self would be the cause of the body even when it is not accompanied by the collection of causes.🔽If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the collection of causes, and the self would be permanent. But if the self were other than the collection of causes, then the self would be the cause of the body even when it is not accompanied by the collection of causes.🔽If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the collection of causes, and the self would be permanent. But if the self were other than the collection of causes, then the self would be the cause of the body even when it is not accompanied by the collection of causes.

original: bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad la rgyu rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad la rgyu rnams thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the collection of causes, and the self would be permanent. But if the self were other than the collection of causes, then the self would be the cause of the body even when it is not accompanied by the collection of causes.🔽If the self were the cause of the body, then the self would be other than the

original: gzhan yang khyod kyis mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa khyad par du 'gyur ba la brten nas ldog pa 'khrul pa med pa can du brjod pa yin na mnyan bya nyid las 'di khyad par ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod kyis mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa khyad par du 'gyur ba la brten nas ldog pa 'khrul pa med pa can du brjod pa yin na mnyan bya nyid las 'di khyad par ni ci yang med do //
translated: Moreover, if you say that the exclusion is non-erroneous in dependence on the distinction that possesses the quality of being audible, etc., then there is no distinction at all from the quality of being audible.

original: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa mnyan bya nyid dang 'khrul bar yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa mnyan bya nyid dang 'khrul bar yang mtshungs so //
translated: Because life, etc., are similar to the quality of being audible in being erroneous.

original: ci ltar na mnyan bya nyid mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yod pas 'khrul ba de bzhin du srog la sogs pa'i ldog pa yang mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar na mnyan bya nyid mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yod pas 'khrul ba de bzhin du srog la sogs pa'i ldog pa yang mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pas 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: Just as the quality of being audible is erroneous because the exclusion exists in the similar instance, in the same way, the exclusion of life, etc., is erroneous because it occurs in the similar instance.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not similar.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mnyan bya nyid de'i ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid de'i ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the exclusion of the quality of being audible is erroneous.

original: khyad ma mthong nas ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad ma mthong nas ci ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: How can there be an exclusion of what is not seen?

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gang gi phyir mnyan bya nyid de ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyan bya nyid de ni mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa kho na las ldog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because that which is to be heard is not the mere absence of the presence of the reason in what is not similar,

original: 'on kyang bum pa la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang yin pa de'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pa la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang yin pa de'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: but also in a pot, etc., which are similar. Therefore, it is mistaken.

original: don 'di nyid khas blangs nas bshad pa /
analyzed: don 'di nyid khas blangs nas bshad pa /
translated: Having accepted this very point, it is explained:

original: khyad kyis da skad brjod pa de ni mnyan bya nyid 'di @160b mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa yod pa med par brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: khyad kyis da skad brjod pa de ni mnyan bya nyid 'di @160b mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa yod pa med par brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not said that this very reason, being that which is to be heard, is the absence of the presence of the reason in what is not similar?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa de ni gzhan srog la sogs pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ci ltar grog la sogs pa mnyan bya nyid dang mi mtshungs /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pa de ni gzhan srog la sogs pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ci ltar grog la sogs pa mnyan bya nyid dang mi mtshungs /
translated: Since the absence of the presence of the reason in what is similar is the same for other things such as life, how is it not similar to a pot, etc. being that which is to be heard?

original: gnyi ga yang mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa med pas ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: Since both are the absence of the presence of the reason in what is similar, the contraposition is mistaken, so they are similar.

original: gzhan yang srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid med do zhes brjod pas ni srog la sogs pa 'di mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid med do zhes brjod pas ni srog la sogs pa 'di mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, when one says that life force, etc. do not exist as discordant factors, one is saying that life force, etc. exist as concordant factors.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgag pa gnyis kyi rnam la ste /
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyi rnam la ste /
translated: Because of the two negations.

original: dgag pa dang po'i bsgrub pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa dang po'i bsgrub pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the affirmation of the first negation is understood.

original: 'di la med do zhes dang pos yod pa dgag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la med do zhes dang pos yod pa dgag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, the first negation is the negation of existence.

original: dgag pa de mthun pa'i phyogs la yang thal bas mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i tshig gis yang 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa de mthun pa'i phyogs la yang thal bas mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa'i tshig gis yang 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Since that negation is also entailed in the concordant factor, the discordant factor is again negated by the word “not.”

original: dgag pa bkag na ni rnal ma yod pa nyid go bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgag pa bkag na ni rnal ma yod pa nyid go bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the negation is negated, the existence of the positive factor is understood.

original: 'di ni lha sbyin ma yin pa ma yin no zhes brjod na lta sbyin rnal ma rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lha sbyin ma yin pa ma yin no zhes brjod na lta sbyin rnal ma rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of saying, “This is not Devadatta,” where Devadatta is understood.

original: gal te 'dir mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la yod pa dgag pa sgrub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dir mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la yod pa dgag pa sgrub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If one says that the negation of existence in the absence of a concordant factor is not an affirmation,

original: de ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could it be an affirmation in the presence of a concordant factor?

original: bshad pa / de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / de lta ma yin te /
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: That is not so.

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa sgrub par mi 'dod na de'i tshe rnam par bcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med pa zhes nyid kyis sgra nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu cir 'gyur te cir yang mi 'gyur
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa sgrub par mi 'dod na de'i tshe rnam par bcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid la med pa zhes nyid kyis sgra nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu cir 'gyur te cir yang mi 'gyur
translated: If you do not assert that the property of the position exists, then at that time, because there is no object of exclusion, what would be the point of the term “nonexistent” that definitely includes the non-position? It would be pointless.

original: ro // 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ro // 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis mthun pa'i phyogs la yod bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis mthun pa'i phyogs la yod bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only that the property of the position exists through the two negations.

original: 'on kyang nges par gzung ba dang bcas pas kyang yin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'on kyang nges par gzung ba dang bcas pas kyang yin no zhes so //
translated: Moreover, it is also because of the inclusion.

original: 'o na nges par gzung bar mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nges par gzung bar mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Well then, don’t include it.

original: bshad pa / nges par gzung ba med na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ma brjod par ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ldog pa mi 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar nges par gzung bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: bshad pa / nges par gzung ba med na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par ma brjod par ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i ldog pa mi 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gdon mi za bar nges par gzung bar bya dgos so //
translated: If you do not include it, because it is not stated that it does not exist in the discordant class, the exclusion that is doubtful about the reverse is not unmistaken. Therefore you must definitely include it.

original: de lta yin dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: In that case, it is said to exist in the similar class.

original: gang gi phyir nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu rnam par bcad pa yin pa de nyid @161a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges par gzung ba'i 'bras bu rnam par bcad pa yin pa de nyid @161a * //
translated: Because it is a negation of the effect that is ascertained,

original: kyi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa /
analyzed: kyi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa /
translated: it exists in the similar class itself.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin ba nyid la med pa zhes ngag gi don dpe dag gis rtogs par bya ba yin pas chos mthun ba dang chos mi mthun ba'i dpe 'di gnyis las gang yang rung bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyi ga bstan par slob🔽dpon phyogs kyi glang bos brjod do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin ba nyid la med pa zhes ngag gi don dpe dag gis rtogs par bya ba yin pas chos mthun ba dang chos mi mthun ba'i dpe 'di gnyis las gang yang rung bas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyi ga bstan par slob dpon phyogs kyi glang bos brjod do //
translated: Since the meaning of the statement “It does not exist in the dissimilar class” is to be understood by means of examples, the master Dignāga says that either of these two, the example of the similar class and the example of the dissimilar class, can demonstrate both the positive and negative concomitance.

original: bsgrub pa la nges par gzung bas dgag pa 'phen la dgag pa nges par gzung bas kyang sgrub pa 'phen te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa la nges par gzung bas dgag pa 'phen la dgag pa nges par gzung bas kyang sgrub pa 'phen te /
translated: The master Dignāga says that the affirmation of the probandum implies the negation, and the affirmation of the negation implies the probandum.

original: nges bar gzung ba ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges bar gzung ba ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the affirmation is the nature of both.

original: gang gi phyir nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i ldog bas sgrub pa 'phen pa de'i phyir ldog pa mi 'khrul pa 'di 'dra ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med bar mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i ldog bas sgrub pa 'phen pa de'i phyir ldog pa mi 'khrul pa 'di 'dra ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med bar mi 'grub bo //
translated: Because the proof is projected by the negation that is qualified by the qualifier, therefore, such a nonerroneous negation is not established without the positive concomitance.

original: gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin pa de ni mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ma yin pa de ni mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yin te /
translated: That which does not exist in the similar class is the negation of the similar class,

original: yod ba bkag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod ba bkag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of the negation of existence.

original: des na ci ltar mthun ba'i med pa la nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ci ltar mthun ba'i med pa la nges par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can there be ascertainment of the absence in the similar class?

original: des na 'khrul pa med pa 'di 'dra ba grub na ni don gyi shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba sgrub bar byed do //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa med pa 'di 'dra ba grub na ni don gyi shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba sgrub bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, if such a nonerroneous negation is established, then by the force of the meaning, the positive concomitance is established.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dgag pa ni ldog pa yin la dgag pa de bkag pa ni sgrub pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa ni ldog pa yin la dgag pa de bkag pa ni sgrub pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The negation is the negation, and the negation of that negation has the nature of the affirmation.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir ldog pa bkag pa na mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir ldog pa bkag pa na mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba 'gugs par byed do //
translated: Therefore, when the negation is negated, the positive concomitance in the similar class is drawn.

original: 'di snyam du mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las gtan tshigs ldog pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las gtan tshigs ldog pa ni med de /
translated: In this regard, it is not the case that the reason is not reversed in the absence of a similar instance.

original: med pa la ni 'byung khungs la sogs pa'i nus ba med do zhes lan cig ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: med pa la ni 'byung khungs la sogs pa'i nus ba med do zhes lan cig ma yin par brjod do //
translated: We have said more than once that nonexistents do not have the capacity to originate, etc.

original: de'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni mthun ba'i phyogs ma yin pa bdag med pa yod ba nyid la med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni mthun ba'i phyogs ma yin pa bdag med pa yod ba nyid la med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, life force, etc., are not similar instances in the existence of selflessness.

original: gzhan gyis ni bdag dang bcas pa 'ga' yang mi 'dod pa des na mthun pa'i phyogs med pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni bdag dang bcas pa 'ga' yang mi 'dod pa des na mthun pa'i phyogs med pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the reason is not reversed in the absence of a similar instance, because no one accepts that anything has a self,

original: gal te de lta na med pa las ldog pa med ces smras na ldog pa de nyid med pa las ldog par ci ltar 'dod //
analyzed: gal te de lta na med pa las ldog pa med ces smras na ldog pa de nyid med pa las ldog par ci ltar 'dod //
translated: then if you say that the reason is not reversed in the absence of an existent, how could you maintain that the reversal itself is a reversal of an existent?

original: ci ltar ldog pa'i mtshams ma yin pa bzhin du ldog pa'i ldog pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar ldog pa'i mtshams ma yin pa bzhin du ldog pa'i ldog pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Just as the reversal is not a boundary, the reversal of the reversal is not a reversal.

original: gzhan yang gang gi phyir med ba bkag pa yod pa de ni dngos bo med pa'i med pa la yang yod la dngos po bkag pa ldog pa tsam ni med do zhes brjod pa ni lha rnams dga' ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi phyir med ba bkag pa yod pa de ni dngos bo med pa'i med pa la yang yod la dngos po bkag pa ldog pa tsam ni med do zhes brjod pa ni lha rnams dga' ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the gods rejoice in the statement, “The existence of the negation of non-existence exists in the non-existence of an existent non-thing, but the mere negation of an existent thing does not exist.”

original: @161b rmongs pa rnams dga' ba khyed shes rab 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: @161b rmongs pa rnams dga' ba khyed shes rab 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
translated: You fools rejoice in error!

original: 'di ni de'i shes rab 'khrul pa med pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i shes rab 'khrul pa med pa gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another of his non-erroneous insights.

original: yul de la dgag pa mi 'dod ba dang / yod pa ma yin pa dang dngos po med ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de'i yul can gyi sgra yang sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul de la dgag pa mi 'dod ba dang / yod pa ma yin pa dang dngos po med ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de'i yul can gyi sgra yang sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the application of terms such as “non-existent” and “non-thing” to the object, which is not asserted to be a negation.

original: gang zhig blos brtags par nus pa de ni sgras brjod bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig blos brtags par nus pa de ni sgras brjod bar bya ba yin la /
translated: That which can be imagined by the mind is to be expressed by words.

original: brjod par bya ba gang yin ba de ni sgra'i tha snyad kyis zin pa 'byung khungs la sogs pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ci ltar de la sgra yang sbyor ba dang 'byung khungs la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir de la med pa🔽nyid kyang zlog par byed /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba gang yin ba de ni sgra'i tha snyad kyis zin pa 'byung khungs la sogs pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ci ltar de la sgra yang sbyor ba dang 'byung khungs la sogs pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir de la med pa nyid kyang zlog par byed /
translated: Therefore, just as the term is applied to that, nonexistence is also negated in that which is devoid of the potency of the sources and so on.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gal te med pa ldog pa'i gzhi ma yin na ldog pa'i gzhi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gal te med pa ldog pa'i gzhi ma yin na ldog pa'i gzhi yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if nonexistence is not the basis of negation, then the basis of negation is also not established.

original: de bzhin du med pa bkag na yang yod bsgrub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du med pa bkag na yang yod bsgrub par 'gyur na /
translated: Likewise, if nonexistence is refuted, existence is established.

original: de yang mi rigs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhi la sogs pa dang mi ldan ba'i phyir sgras brjod par bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes skyon gsum brjod do //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs pa dang / de bzhin du gzhi la sogs pa dang mi ldan ba'i phyir sgras brjod par bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes skyon gsum brjod do //
translated: But that is illogical, and it would also not be expressed by terms because it would not be endowed with a basis and so on. Thus three faults are stated.

original: de'i spros pa dang nye bar spros pa'i don gang yin pa de thams cad ni med pa la med pa zhes tshul gsum pa med pa bshad pa ched du byas pas bsal zin te /
analyzed: de'i spros pa dang nye bar spros pa'i don gang yin pa de thams cad ni med pa la med pa zhes tshul gsum pa med pa bshad pa ched du byas pas bsal zin te /
translated: All the objects of elaboration and detailed elaboration are negated by the statement of the nonexistence of the three modes, which is done on purpose.

original: des na 'dir yang mi dpyad do //
analyzed: des na 'dir yang mi dpyad do //
translated: Therefore, here also, there is no analysis.

original: gzhan yang bdag med na ldog par mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag med na ldog par mi 'gyur mod /
translated: Moreover, if there is no self, there is no reversal.

original: bdag med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that there is no self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag yod pa'i sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag yod pa'i sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof of the existence of the self is engaged.

original: bsal ba'i phyogs gang yin pa de la ni sgrub byed 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyogs gang yin pa de la ni sgrub byed 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The proof is not engaged in the position that is to be refuted.

original: des na bdag grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor bas na med pa ma yin gyi the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bdag grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor bas na med pa ma yin gyi the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the proof is engaged for the sake of establishing the self, it is not nonexistent, but there is doubt.

original: kho bo cag bdag med pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag bdag med pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: We do not say that there is no self.

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyis bdag de ltar med pas khas blangs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyis bdag de ltar med pas khas blangs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: However, others assert that the self does not exist in that way.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gzhan gyis de ltar med par khas blangs pa de'i phyir na khas blangs pa tshad ma ma yin pa de las de ltar med par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ltar med par khas blangs pa de'i phyir na khas blangs pa tshad ma ma yin pa de las de ltar med par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Because others assert that it does not exist in that way, it is not the case that because of that assertion, it does not exist in that way, for that assertion is not valid cognition.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could be established in that way.

original: gzhan gyis ni gson po'i lus kyang bdag med par khas blangs pa des na de bzhin du 'gyur bas khyed kyi sgrub byed don med do zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni gson po'i lus kyang bdag med par khas blangs pa des na de bzhin du 'gyur bas khyed kyi sgrub byed don med do zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
translated: You may say, “The valid cognition accepted by others

original: gang zhig kho bo cag gis bdag med par 'dod pa de nyid la @162a * //🔽gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig kho bo cag gis bdag med par 'dod pa de nyid la @162a * // gzhan gyis khas blangs pa tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: proves what we assert to be selfless.

original: gzhan la ni nged kyi tshad mas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa gnod par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la ni nged kyi tshad mas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa gnod par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Our valid cognition is not valid for others, because it refutes what others accept.”

original: gal te de ltar khas blangs pa'i stobs kyis mthun pa'i phyogs med ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par byas nas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la ni ldog cing /
analyzed: gal te de ltar khas blangs pa'i stobs kyis mthun pa'i phyogs med ba dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par byas nas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la ni ldog cing /
translated: If you make the assertion that there is no similar example and that there is a dissimilar example, then you would be reversing the position that there is no similar example and that there is a dissimilar example.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod ba las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod ba las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You would be reversing the position that there is no similar example and that there is a dissimilar example.

original: ldog pa gcig tu nges par brtags te khyod kyis sgrub byed 'jug par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: ldog pa gcig tu nges par brtags te khyod kyis sgrub byed 'jug par byed pa yin na /
translated: If you investigate and determine that there is only one reversal, and you engage in your proof on that basis, then you have no proof.

original: khas blangs pa'i stobs kyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag nas tshad ma 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i stobs kyis mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag nas tshad ma 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The operation of a means of valid knowledge is not established by the power of an assertion, having posited a similar instance and a dissimilar instance.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar tshad ma 'jug pa ni bdag lung gis grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar tshad ma 'jug pa ni bdag lung gis grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: For, in that case, the operation of a means of valid knowledge would be established by itself.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pas byas na bsgrub bya la mi 'khrul ba yang khas blangs par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pas byas na bsgrub bya la mi 'khrul ba yang khas blangs par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were made by the assertion of a similar instance and a dissimilar instance, then non-error with regard to the probandum would also be made by the assertion.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pas grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pas grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is not established by inference.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs bas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis khas blangs bas mthun pa'i phyogs med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the similar instance does not exist because of the assertion of another.

original: de bas na re zhig mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las kyang ldog pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na re zhig mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las kyang ldog pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it has been explained that the reversal is also from the non-existence of a similar instance.

original: bdag the tshom za ba de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa med kyang srog la sogs par ldog par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag the tshom za ba de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las ldog pa med kyang srog la sogs par ldog par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since I have doubt about that, even though there is no reversal from the non-existence of a similar instance, I have doubt about the reversal to life, etc.

original: gang gi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog par the tshom za'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par the tshom za ba de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog par the tshom za'o //
translated: Because of the doubt about the reversal from the similar class, there is also doubt about the reversal from the dissimilar class.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po'i chos ni bye brag gcig la nges par yod pa nyid du grub na gzhan las ldog par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po'i chos ni bye brag gcig la nges par yod pa nyid du grub na gzhan las ldog par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the property of an entity is established as existing in only one particular case, it is established as being absent from the other.

original: bye brag gnyis kyis ma bsdus pa'i dngos po ni med de /
analyzed: bye brag gnyis kyis ma bsdus pa'i dngos po ni med de /
translated: There is no entity that is not included in the two particulars.

original: de na ci srid cig la nges par ma grub pa de srid du gzhan la ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de na ci srid cig la nges par ma grub pa de srid du gzhan la ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: As long as it is not established as existing in one, it is not established as absent from the other.

original: gal te gcig las nges par grub pa nyid kyis gzhan las ldog pas ma yin gyi //
analyzed: gal te gcig las nges par grub pa nyid kyis gzhan las ldog pas ma yin gyi //
translated: If it is not the case that the absence from the other is due to the establishment of existence in one,

original: 'on kyang gzhan las ldog par mthong ba las kyang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan las ldog par mthong ba las kyang yin no //
translated: but rather it is due to the observation of absence from the other,

original: bdag med pa las kyang srog la sogs pa ldog pa yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa las kyang srog la sogs pa ldog pa yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: then life and so on would be absent from the self, as has been explained.

original: da lta ma yin te /
analyzed: da lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case.

original: gal te gcig la yod par nges pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gcig la yod par nges pa ma yin na /
translated: If existence is not ascertained in one,

original: mthong ba'i dngos @162b po 'ga' zhig la bltar rung ba'i srog la sogs pa med par grub kyang ma mthong ba'i don rnams la srog la sogs pa the tshom du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dngos @162b po 'ga' zhig la bltar rung ba'i srog la sogs pa med par grub kyang ma mthong ba'i don rnams la srog la sogs pa the tshom du 'gyur ro //
translated: Although it is established that some visible things, such as a living being, are not suitable to be seen, there is doubt about the existence of life, etc., in regard to unseen things.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag med pa gzhan rnams la 'jug pa yin na bdag med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir bum ba la sogs pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag med pa gzhan rnams la 'jug pa yin na bdag med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir bum ba la sogs pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If life, etc., are the self, which is nonexistent, then since they would be without difference in selflessness, they would also be the self of a pot, etc.🔽Therefore, because they do not engage with some, they do not engage with those that are of the same type.

original: des na la la la mi 'jug pa'i phyir de'i rigs can la mi 'jug go zhes dogs pa la the tshom bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: des na la la la mi 'jug pa'i phyir de'i rigs can la mi 'jug go zhes dogs pa la the tshom bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To prove that doubt, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bye brag mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang de'i rigs la gnas pa'i gsal ba nyung zad la srid pa mthong ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba'i bye brag mtha' dag la khyab pa ma yin pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de yang de'i rigs la gnas pa'i gsal ba nyung zad la srid pa mthong ste /
translated: Because a thing that does not pervade all instances of a particular is seen to be possible in a few instances of that type, it is not ascertained that it is nonexistent in all instances.

original: dper na dngos po sra ba rnams kyi nang nas rdo rje la sogs pa sra ba 'ga' zhig la mtshon gyis mi chod pa mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dngos po sra ba rnams kyi nang nas rdo rje la sogs pa sra ba 'ga' zhig la mtshon gyis mi chod pa mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, among the hard things, some things like diamonds are seen to be uncuttable by weapons, but not all hard things are like that.

original: de tsam gyis ni sra ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad mtshon gyis mi chod par 'gyur ro zhes ni brjod par mi nus so ;🔽de bzhin du bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong yang gsal ba 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni sra ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad mtshon gyis mi chod par 'gyur ro zhes ni brjod par mi nus so ; de bzhin du bdag med pa 'ga' zhig la srog la sogs pa ma mthong yang gsal ba 'ga' zhig la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And one cannot say that all hard things are uncuttable, because there is no difference in hardness.🔽In the same way, although no self is seen in some things like the life faculty, it may be present in some other things.

original: gzhan yang srog la sogs pa dang bdag 'ga' ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang srog la sogs pa dang bdag 'ga' ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the self is not seen in the life faculty, etc.

original: mdor gzhag pa dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mdor gzhag pa dgrol ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain the meaning of the verse, he says:🔽The self is not seen in the life faculty, etc.

original: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis po phan tshun spangs te gnas pa dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis bshad zin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'gal ba ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog par the tshom za'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa rnam pa gnyis po phan tshun spangs te gnas pa dang / lhan cig mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin gyis bshad zin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'gal ba ma grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog par the tshom za'o //
translated: Since the two aspects of selflessness and life-force, etc., are mutually exclusive and do not coexist, and since the essential contradiction explained above is not established as a reason, one doubts that life-force, etc., are the opposite of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa spangs pas srog la sogs pa gnas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa spangs pas srog la sogs pa gnas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Since selflessness is not relinquished, life-force, etc., are not established.

original: srog la sogs pa rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'jug pa la bdag med pa nye bas ldog pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'jug pa la bdag med pa nye bas ldog pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that life-force, etc., are stopped by the proximity of selflessness when they are engaged without the cause being incomplete,

original: de ltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not tenable.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag med pa dang 'gal ba bdag gis khyab pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag med pa dang 'gal ba bdag gis khyab pa'i phyir 'gal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if life-force, etc., are the opposite of selflessness, wouldn’t they be contradictory because they are pervaded by self?🔽Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir srog la sogs ba bdag la nges pa yin na 'gal bas khyab pa'i phyir bdag med ba dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir srog la sogs ba bdag la nges pa yin na 'gal bas khyab pa'i phyir bdag med ba dang lhan cig 'gal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If life-force, etc., were definitely the self, they would be contradictory because they are pervaded by contradiction with selflessness.

original: nges pa yang de'i 'bras bu 'am de'i bdag nyid rang bzhin 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can gyis yin na /
analyzed: nges pa yang de'i 'bras bu 'am de'i bdag nyid rang bzhin 'brel pa'i bdag nyid can gyis yin na /
translated: Moreover, if ascertainment is the effect of that or if it is the nature of that, it is related by the nature of identity.

original: @163a * // de'i 'bras bu dang bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i bdag la nges pa de ni tha dad pas de'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir med do //
analyzed: @163a * // de'i 'bras bu dang bdag nyid kyis byas pa'i bdag la nges pa de ni tha dad pas de'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir med do //
translated: If it is the effect of that or if it is the nature of that, then ascertainment of the self is not established because it is not the effect of that, since it is different from that and does not have the nature of that.

original: skyon gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyis 'dod pa khas blangs nas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyis 'dod pa khas blangs nas bshad pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate another error, he says, having accepted the assertion of another:

original: srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog ba dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog ba dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The reversal of the absence of self, such as life force, and so on.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa dang / srog la sogs pa de dag yod par khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pas khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ldog tu chug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa med pas gson po'i lus la bdag yod par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa dang / srog la sogs pa de dag yod par khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pas khyab par bya ba bdag med pa ldog tu chug pa de lta na yang bdag med pa med pas gson po'i lus la bdag yod par mi 'grub po //
translated: Even if one allows that the reversal of the absence of self is the reversal of the absence of life force, and so on, which is pervaded by the nonexistence of self, and that the existence of life force, and so on, is pervaded by the reversal of the absence of life force, and so on, still, the existence of self in the body of the living being is not established because of the nonexistence of self.

original: ci ltar bdag med pa log na bdag med pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin bdag mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar bdag med pa log na bdag med pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin bdag mi 'grub ce na /
translated: But how could the self be established as the nature of the absence of self, since the absence of self is reversed when the self is reversed?🔽Nāgārjuna responds:

original: bshad pa / 'di ltar bdag med pa bdag ldog pa med bas bdag yod bar 'gyur ba rig pa can 'di ldog pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ltar bdag med pa bdag ldog pa med bas bdag yod bar 'gyur ba rig pa can 'di ldog pa ste /
translated: Thus, this awareness of the absence of self, which is not reversed when the self is reversed, is the self.

original: dngos po med pa med par dngos por 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa med par dngos por 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the nonexistence of an entity is asserted to be an entity.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na zhes smos te /
analyzed: dper na zhes smos te /
translated: For example, it is like this.

original: ci ltar srog la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar srog la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as life and so on are not reversed, life and so on are not asserted in a compatible context.

original: don 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pas sdud pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di nyid tshigs su bcad pas sdud pa ni /
translated: This very point is summarized in the following verse.

original: gal te gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa can ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa can ma yin na /
translated: If a reason is not a property of the dissimilar class,

original: 'o na mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'o na mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: then it is a property of the similar class,

original: ldog pa bkag pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa bkag pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere negation of the dissimilar class is the similar class.

original: 'on te gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba mi 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba mi 'dod na /
translated: But if you do not accept that the reason is concomitant with the similar class,

original: de lta na ni 'o na dgag pa bkag pa sgrub bar khas ma blangs ba des na bdag med pa yod pa ma yin na yang gson bo ni lus gang yin pa de bdag dang bcas par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na dgag pa bkag pa sgrub bar khas ma blangs ba des na bdag med pa yod pa ma yin na yang gson bo ni lus gang yin pa de bdag dang bcas par mi 'grub po //
translated: then you have not accepted the negation of the negation as an affirmation. Therefore, even if selflessness does not exist, it is not established that the living being is the body that possesses a self.

original: bdag bkag pa ni bdag med pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag bkag pa ni bdag med pa yin la /
translated: The negation of self is selflessness.

original: de bkag pa ni sgrub pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bdag mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de bkag pa ni sgrub pa ma yin pa de'i phyir bdag mi 'grub po //
translated: The negation of that is not an affirmation. Therefore, the self is not established.

original: cig shos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: cig shos kyis smras pa /
translated: The other says:

original: gal te gang las bdag med pa bkag kyang bdag rtogs par mi 'gyur ba srog la sogs pa yong pas khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pas bdag med ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag rtogs pa ni @163b ma yin gyi //
analyzed: gal te gang las bdag med pa bkag kyang bdag rtogs par mi 'gyur ba srog la sogs pa yong pas khyab par byed pa srog la sogs pa med pa ldog pas bdag med ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag rtogs pa ni @163b ma yin gyi //
translated: If the self is not understood through the negation of selflessness, then the self is not understood through the negation of the absence of life force, etc., because the negation of the absence of life force, etc., which pervades that from which selflessness is negated, does not negate selflessness.

original: 'on kyang srog la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i sgo kho nas bdag go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang srog la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i sgo kho nas bdag go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: However, life force, etc., are understood to be the self only through the door of affirmation.

original: nye bar 'jog pa nyid kyis yin gyi bdag med pa ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar 'jog pa nyid kyis yin gyi bdag med pa ldog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is by the mere placement of the mind that the self is understood, not by the reversal of selflessness.

original: gal te de ltar na 'o na bdag med pa las ldog pa la 'bras bu ci yod de ci yang med do //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'o na bdag med pa las ldog pa la 'bras bu ci yod de ci yang med do //
translated: If that is so, then what is the point of reversing selflessness? There is no point at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa de bdag med pa de la mi srid pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog la sogs pa de bdag med pa de la mi srid pa ste /
translated: Because life force and so on are impossible in the absence of self.🔽Since they are impossible, when one understands that they exist in the absence of self, then the cause for understanding the self is reversed. Therefore it is said that they cause the understanding of the self.

original: mi srid pa'i rgyus gang na rang yod pa de rang yod pas bdag med pa de med par go bar byed pa na bdag rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu de'i phyir bdag med pa de las ldog pa can yin pas na go bar byed par brjod pa yin te
analyzed: mi srid pa'i rgyus gang na rang yod pa de rang yod pas bdag med pa de med par go bar byed pa na bdag rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu de'i phyir bdag med pa de las ldog pa can yin pas na go bar byed par brjod pa yin te
translated: Since they are reversed, they are said to cause the understanding of the self.

original: / ldog pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / ldog pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “they would have a result.”

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba bdag med pa las ldog pas go bar byed pa nyid du byas pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba bdag med pa las ldog pas go bar byed pa nyid du byas pa ma yin na /
translated: If that were not so, if they did not cause the understanding of the self by reversing selflessness,🔽then they would not cause the understanding of the self.

original: gang gi phyir bdag med pas ldog pa can go bar byed par brjod pa srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa bdag grub pa la ci phan /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag med pas ldog pa can go bar byed par brjod pa srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa bdag grub pa la ci phan /
translated: Since the self is nonexistent, what purpose is served by positing that life force and so on, which are said to be the means of understanding the self, are the opposite of the self, which is nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa las ldog pa'i sgo nas go bar byed par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa las ldog pa'i sgo nas go bar byed par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be asserted that the means of understanding the self is the opposite of the self’s being nonexistent.

original: yang na srog la sogs pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas go bar byed pa yin mod /🔽'on kyang 'di la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: yang na srog la sogs pa sgrub pa'i sgo nas go bar byed pa yin mod / 'on kyang 'di la 'di skad ces /
translated: Or else, it is indeed the case that life force and so on are the means of understanding the self.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis bdag nyid nges par ma grub pa'i srog la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis bdag ci ltar grub pa brjod par bya'o //🔽gal te 'brel pa med pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis bdag nyid nges par ma grub pa'i srog la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis bdag ci ltar grub pa brjod par bya'o // gal te 'brel pa med pa nyid kyis sgrub par byed na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: However, in this regard, it should be stated how the self is established by those life force and so on, which are not established by themselves through being the same or being the effect of the self.

original: de ltar yin na thams cad kyi go byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na thams cad kyi go byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that they are established by the self through being unrelated, that is untenable, because that would lead to the absurd consequence that everything would be established by everything.🔽If you say that they are established by the self through being unrelated, that is untenable, because that would lead to the absurd consequence that everything would be established by everything.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa ma grub pas na bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pa la ma khyab pa dang / ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yang ma yin pa de bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ldog pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis mjug
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa ma grub pas na bdag med pa srog la sogs pa med pa la ma khyab pa dang / ldog pa gcig tu nges pa yang ma yin pa de bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ldog pa dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis mjug
translated: Because the relation is not established, the absence of self is not pervaded by the absence of life force, and the pervasion is not ascertained, therefore, because there is doubt about the forward and reverse pervasions, the reason that possesses the reverse pervasion is a common inconclusive reason.🔽This is the conclusion based on the context.

original: sdud pa'o // rtsod phyir khyad par spyi dag ste zhes gang bshad pa de la khyad par la rtsod pa bstan te /
analyzed: sdud pa'o // rtsod phyir khyad par spyi dag ste zhes gang bshad pa de la khyad par la rtsod pa bstan te /
translated: With regard to what was explained above, “The specific and the general are disputed,” the dispute about the specific is presented.

original: bzlog nas spyi la yang bzlog pa'i phyir ston pa ni gzhal bya nyid thun mong ba yang nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas la skur pa mdo sde pa gang yin pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa med pa la gzhal @164a * //
analyzed: bzlog nas spyi la yang bzlog pa'i phyir ston pa ni gzhal bya nyid thun mong ba yang nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas la skur pa mdo sde pa gang yin pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa med pa la gzhal @164a * //
translated: The presentation of the reversal of the general is “The common object of comprehension is also disputed.” The Sautrāntikas say that unconditioned phenomena such as space do not exist.

original: bya nyid rjes su 'gro ba mi rung ba'i phyir 'di ni mi rtag ba nyid la rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: bya nyid rjes su 'gro ba mi rung ba'i phyir 'di ni mi rtag ba nyid la rjes su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Because it is not possible for the predicate to follow the reason, this is a reason that follows the property of the subject.

original: des na 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba ni 'khrul pa med pa can mthun pa'i phyogs tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba ni 'khrul pa med pa can mthun pa'i phyogs tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, its following is unmistaken and limited to the similar class.

original: gzhol bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa nyid la yod pa yin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhol bya nyid ni mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa nyid la yod pa yin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rtag pa la ma yin te /
translated: The predicate impermanent exists in the similar class, but it does not exist in the dissimilar class,

original: de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that itself does not exist.

original: des na ldog pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su rigs pa can smra'o //
analyzed: des na ldog pa med pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su rigs pa can smra'o //
translated: Therefore, because it does not revert, the Naiyāyikas say that it is a reason that possesses following.

original: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi gtan tshigs de la yang gal te 'di mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa yin na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can gyi gtan tshigs de la yang gal te 'di mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa yin na /
translated: If that reason that possesses following exists only in the similar class,

original: ci ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa yin te /
translated: how can it be that it does not revert from the dissimilar class?

original: de nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par yang 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par yang 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Because of that, it would revert from the dissimilar class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med na yang ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa zhes brjod /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med na yang ci ltar mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod pa zhes brjod /
translated: If it is not the opposite of the discordant side, then how could it exist in the concordant side?

original: gang gi phyir gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa ma yin na /
translated: Because if the existence of the discordant side is not eliminated,

original: sgra nges par gzung pa'i 'bras bu ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra nges par gzung pa'i 'bras bu ci yang ma yin no //
translated: then the result of ascertaining sound is nothing at all.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa ni yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa rnam par gcod par byed na yang ci ltar mi ldog ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa ni yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa rnam par gcod par byed na yang ci ltar mi ldog ste /
translated: Because the opposite is not different from the elimination of existence, when existence is eliminated, how could it not be the opposite?

original: ldog pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa nyid 'di'i ldog pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs las yod pa nyid rnam par bcad pa nyid 'di'i ldog pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the elimination of the existence of the discordant side is the existence of the opposite.

original: 'di snyam du mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de la ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de la ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba med do snyam na /
translated: If you think that because the discordant side does not exist, it has neither an opposite nor a concordant side,

original: bshad pa / rjes su 'gro ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bshad pa / rjes su 'gro ba yang ma yin la /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains: It is not concordant.

original: ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes gnyi ga 'gog pa 'di ni 'gal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes gnyi ga 'gog pa 'di ni 'gal ba yang yin no //
translated: It is also contradictory to deny both.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar med do zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar med do zhes mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the negation of the pervasion of the counter-position, “It does not exist in this way,” is itself the proof of the contrapositive.

original: de dag ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive.

original: des na 'di ni rjes su 'gro ldog dang ldan pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na 'di ni rjes su 'gro ldog dang ldan pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, this is the proof of the pervasion and the contrapositive.

original: 'dir rigs pa can gyi brjod par bya ba med pa ni gzhi 'am gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir med pa la ltos te ldog pa dang / mi rung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las rnam par gcod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de nyid yang 'ongs pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa can gyi brjod par bya ba med pa ni gzhi 'am gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir med pa la ltos te ldog pa dang / mi rung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa las rnam par gcod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba de nyid yang 'ongs pa yin pas /
translated: Here, the Naiyāyika says, “Since the object of expression does not exist as a basis or otherwise, the contrapositive is not dependent on nonexistence, and since it is not tenable, the exclusion is not from the nonexistence of the counter-position.” This is exactly the same as what was said before.

original: gal te med pa las ldog @164b pa med na /
analyzed: gal te med pa las ldog @164b pa med na /
translated: If the contrapositive does not exist in the absence of existence,

original: ci ltar med pa la rjes su 'gro ba dgag par 'dod ces yang de nyid lan du brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar med pa la rjes su 'gro ba dgag par 'dod ces yang de nyid lan du brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: how can you assert the negation of the pervasion of nonexistence? This is exactly the same as the response given before.

original: ldog pa ni rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa las gzhan ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa ni rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa las gzhan ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reverse is nothing other than the negation of the forward.

original: 'di las kyang ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang ldog pa yin te /
translated: And also from this, there is the reverse:

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa ni gtan tshigs bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa ni gtan tshigs bkag pa yin no //
translated: because the reverse is the negation of the reason.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that is twofold:

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'phen pa ma yin par bkag pa dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin la ltos pa med pa med par dgag pa tsam mo //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin 'phen pa ma yin par bkag pa dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin la ltos pa med pa med par dgag pa tsam mo //
translated: the negation of the non-projection of the nature of entities, and the mere negation of the non-dependence on the nature of entities.

original: de la dngos po'i rang bzhin la reg pa can ma yin par dgag pa med ba la mi srid kyang /
analyzed: de la dngos po'i rang bzhin la reg pa can ma yin par dgag pa med ba la mi srid kyang /
translated: As for that, the negation of the non-contact with the nature of entities is impossible in the non-existent.

original: med par dgag pa gang yin pa de go ci ltar mi srid /
analyzed: med par dgag pa gang yin pa de go ci ltar mi srid /
translated: But how is the negation of the non-existent impossible?

original: 'di ltar gang gis na thams cad dngos po la reg pa can yin pas gang gis dngos po med pa la mi srid par 'gyur ba ma yin par dgag pa gcig pu ni dgag pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis na thams cad dngos po la reg pa can yin pas gang gis dngos po med pa la mi srid par 'gyur ba ma yin par dgag pa gcig pu ni dgag pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since the mere negation is not the object of negation, it is not the case that everything is the contact with entities, by which the non-existent would be impossible.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽gzhan med par dgag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / gzhan med par dgag pa yang yin la /
translated: Well then, what is it?🔽It is also the other, the negation of the non-existent.

original: de ni dngos po med pa la mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa la mi 'gal lo //
translated: And that is not contradictory in the non-existent.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: med par dgag pa de yang med pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: med par dgag pa de yang med pa la mi srid do //
translated: That negation of nonexistence is impossible in the absence of an existent basis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzhi dang yang dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi don can te /
analyzed: gzhi dang yang dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa'i khyad par gyi don can te /
translated: Because it is the meaning of the capacity of a basis, such as perfect giving, and so on,

original: brjod bar bya ba can dgag pa'i yul ston pa'i rnam par dbye ba gang yin pa de rnams dang mi ldan pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod bar bya ba can dgag pa'i yul ston pa'i rnam par dbye ba gang yin pa de rnams dang mi ldan pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is the cause of the absence of those divisions that reveal the object of negation.

original: gang zhig gzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du blos reg par mi nus pa de ni sgras kyang brjod par mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du blos reg par mi nus pa de ni sgras kyang brjod par mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: That which the mind cannot touch as the nature of a basis and so on cannot be expressed by words.
