original: rnam par rtog pa dang sgras yul du ma byas pa ni gzhan sgrub pa 'am dgag pa dang 'brel par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang sgras yul du ma byas pa ni gzhan sgrub pa 'am dgag pa dang 'brel par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not made an object by thought and words cannot be related to the affirmation or negation of another.

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i med pa yang gzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du brtag pa'am brjod par nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i med pa yang gzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du brtag pa'am brjod par nus pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And that which is nonexistent, devoid of all capacity, cannot be imagined or expressed as the nature of a basis and so on. Therefore it cannot be related to the affirmation or negation of another.

original: rtsod pa 'di la ni /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'di la ni /
translated: by the following verse:

original: de'i phyir dngos dngos med rten can //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos dngos med rten can //
translated: Therefore, existence and non-existence are based on something else,

original: phyi rol rten min sgra don la //
analyzed: phyi rol rten min sgra don la //
translated: but the meaning of words is not based on something else.🔽Here, all proofs and refutations are accepted

original: brten nas 'dir ni bsgrub pa dang // dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: brten nas 'dir ni bsgrub pa dang // dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin //
translated: based on that.

original: zhes lan btab zin pas de nyid las rtogs par bya'o //🔽gang gi phyir gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la nges par yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rjes @165a * //
analyzed: zhes lan btab zin pas de nyid las rtogs par bya'o // gang gi phyir gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la nges par yod pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir rjes @165a * //
translated: Since the answer has already been given, it should be understood from there.

original: su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Because whatever is ascertained to exist in the similar class is just excluded from the dissimilar class, therefore there is no so-called positive concomitance at all.

original: ldog pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa tsam la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa ni rjes su 'gro ba nges pa tsam la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because exclusion is based merely on the ascertainment of positive concomitance.

original: de de ltar na gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba ma yin na /
analyzed: de de ltar na gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba ma yin na /
translated: If it is like that, then if it does not follow in the dissimilar class,

original: 'on ldog pa yang yid par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'on ldog pa yang yid par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: then even exclusion would not be accepted.

original: gzhal bya nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But being an object of cognition does not not follow in the dissimilar class.

original: de ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul ba med pa can yin dngos po la mthong ba'i gzhal bya dngos po med pa la ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar rjes su 'gro ba 'khrul ba med pa can yin dngos po la mthong ba'i gzhal bya dngos po med pa la ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could the object of apprehension that is seen in a thing be in a non-thing?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga la brten pa nyid kyis na chos rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyi ga la brten pa nyid kyis na chos rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because it has already been explained that the three types of phenomena are based on things, non-things, and both.

original: des na gzhal bya nyid ni gnyi ga'i chos yin pa'i phyir dngos po la mthong ba yang dngos po med pa la mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na gzhal bya nyid ni gnyi ga'i chos yin pa'i phyir dngos po la mthong ba yang dngos po med pa la mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, since the object of apprehension is a phenomenon of both, it is not contradictory that seeing in a thing is also in a non-thing.

original: gal te dngos po med pa la chos 'ga' zhig yod na de ltar 'gyur ba yin na yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa la chos 'ga' zhig yod na de ltar 'gyur ba yin na yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If a phenomenon existed in a non-thing, that would be so, but it does not exist.

original: chos ni bstan pa'i don yin na med pa la ni 'gar yang brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ni bstan pa'i don yin na med pa la ni 'gar yang brten pa ma yin te /
translated: If a phenomenon is the object of expression, it is not based anywhere in the non-existent.

original: de ni rten nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rten nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not suitable to be a basis.

original: de skad smra ba ni rang gi tshig nyid kyis med pa la chos khas blangs par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de skad smra ba ni rang gi tshig nyid kyis med pa la chos khas blangs par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To explain that those who speak in that way accept phenomena in the non-existent through their own words, it is said:

original: dngos po med pa la ni chos 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di la med pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni chos 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di la med pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don ni chos can yin la /
translated: In the statement “Nothing exists for a non-thing,” the word “nothing” is the subject, which is the referent of a conceptual object expressed by a word.

original: dngos po'i chos mtha' dag dang bral ba de nyid de'i chos ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos mtha' dag dang bral ba de nyid de'i chos ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the very absence of all the qualities of a thing is its quality?

original: de ci ltar khyod med pa'i chos brjod pa nyid med do zhes smra /
analyzed: de ci ltar khyod med pa'i chos brjod pa nyid med do zhes smra /
translated: How can you say that the quality of non-existence is not a quality?

original: gal te chos dang bral ba chos med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos dang bral ba chos med pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the absence of a quality is not a quality,

original: de ci ltar chos yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar chos yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be a quality?

original: gang gi phyir gang gis chos dang bral ba chos su mi 'gyur ba dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid ni chos ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis chos dang bral ba chos su mi 'gyur ba dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid ni chos ma yin no //
translated: The nature of a thing is not a quality, because that which is devoid of a quality is not a quality.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po med kyang chos dang chos can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po med kyang chos dang chos can yin zhe na /
translated: Why is a non-thing a quality and a basis of a quality?

original: gang gi phyir med du zin kyang tha snyad kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis chos dang chos can gyi sgra de'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med du zin kyang tha snyad kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis chos dang chos can gyi sgra de'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: Because even though it does not exist, it is designated as a quality and a basis of a quality by some form of convention.

original: gang gi phyir de dag las kyang ngo bo 'ga' zhig ni rten chos gzhan ma spangs par sgra dang rtogs pa yul du byed la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag las kyang ngo bo 'ga' zhig ni rten chos gzhan ma spangs par sgra dang rtogs pa yul du byed la /
translated: Because, even from among those, some objects are taken as objects by terms and thoughts without abandoning the other phenomena that are their supports.

original: 'ga' zhag chos gzhan spangs par ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhag chos gzhan spangs par ro //
translated: Some are taken as objects by terms and thoughts after abandoning the other phenomena that are their supports.🔽If it were not so, then the conventional, which is the object of conceptual thought, would not exist as the entity of the phenomenon and the subject.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyis byas pa rnam par @165b rtog pa'i yul gyi chos dang / chos can gyi dngos po med pa yin na dngos po med pa de la sgra 'jug pa'i tha snyad med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyis byas pa rnam par @165b rtog pa'i yul gyi chos dang / chos can gyi dngos po med pa yin na dngos po med pa de la sgra 'jug pa'i tha snyad med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The conventional usage of terms would not exist for that nonentity.

original: sgra'i tha snyad ni chos dang chos can gyi dngos po la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i tha snyad ni chos dang chos can gyi dngos po la brten pa yin no //
translated: The conventional usage of terms is based on the entity of the phenomenon and the subject.

original: gal te chos dang chos can gyi dngos po ni don rnams kyi de kho na nyid dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos can gyi dngos po ni don rnams kyi de kho na nyid dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the entity of the phenomenon and the subject is not endowed with the reality of objects,

original: de ci ltar dngos po med pa la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar dngos po med pa la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could it be nonentity?

original: gal te yod pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid dang ldan pa yin na med pa la chos dang chos can gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid dang ldan pa yin na med pa la chos dang chos can gyi dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the existent is endowed with reality, the nonentity would not be the entity of the phenomenon and the subject.

original: don dam par ni med pa bzhin du yod pa la yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos po'i 'ga' yang yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni med pa bzhin du yod pa la yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos po'i 'ga' yang yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But in reality, there is no such thing as existence in the ultimate sense, nor is there any such thing as existence in the conventional sense.

original: 'o na chos dang chos can gyi dngos po ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chos dang chos can gyi dngos po ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: But how can there be a subject and an object?

original: med kyang chos dang chos can dang / de dag gi 'brel pa ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos bkod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: med kyang chos dang chos can dang / de dag gi 'brel pa ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos bkod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Even though they do not exist, the subject and the object and their relationship are merely imagined by the conceptual mind.

original: gal te chos dang chos can don dam par yin na de'i tshe de nyid dam gzhan yin /
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos can don dam par yin na de'i tshe de nyid dam gzhan yin /
translated: If the subject and the object exist in the ultimate sense, then they are either identical or different.

original: de nyid ni ma yin te chos brjod pa'i sgra thams cad rnam grangs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni ma yin te chos brjod pa'i sgra thams cad rnam grangs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not identical, because it would follow, absurdly, that all words expressing attributes would be synonymous.

original: tha dad par ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: They are not different, because they are seen to be the same.

original: chos dang chos can du ma nyid yin na lha spyin pa sogs pa'i sgra ltar gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur na yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos can du ma nyid yin na lha spyin pa sogs pa'i sgra ltar gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur na yod pa yang yin te /
translated: If the subject and the object were different, then they would not be the same basis, just as Devadatta and Yajñadatta are not the same basis.

original: de bas na don dam par de nyid dang gzhan nyid mi rung ba'i phyir dang / dngos po la rnam pa gzhan yang med pa'i phyir chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba ni dngos bo ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel du bshad zin te /
analyzed: de bas na don dam par de nyid dang gzhan nyid mi rung ba'i phyir dang / dngos po la rnam pa gzhan yang med pa'i phyir chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba ni dngos bo ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam 'grel du bshad zin te /
translated: Therefore, because identity and difference are not tenable ultimately, and because things do not have other aspects, the distinction between the property and the subject is not a real thing, and so on.

original: de nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This has already been explained in the Pramii(laviirttikam) and should be understood from there.

original: gang gi chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa blos byas pa de'i tshe yod pa bzhin du med pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir gang gis bzlog / yod pa bzhin du med pa la yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos por 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gang gi chos dang chos can gyi 'brel pa blos byas pa de'i tshe yod pa bzhin du med pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir gang gis bzlog / yod pa bzhin du med pa la yang chos dang chos can gyi dngos por 'gyur mod /
translated: When the relation between the property and the subject is mentally created, then, because it is the same whether it exists or does not exist, what prevents it from being the property and the subject even when it does not exist as it is?

original: gzhal bya nyid go ji ltar tshad ma ni gzhal bya'i 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid go ji ltar tshad ma ni gzhal bya'i 'bras bu yin na /
translated: If the object of comprehension is understood, how is the valid cognition the effect of the object of comprehension?

original: dngos po med pa ni 'ga'i yang rgyu tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni 'ga'i yang rgyu tshad ma yin no //
translated: How can a non-thing be the cause of any valid cognition?

original: tshad ma ni don byed pa la 'jug par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma ni don byed pa la 'jug par byed pa yin na /
translated: If valid cognition engages in the performance of a function,

original: dngos po med pa la ni nus pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni nus pa med do //
translated: it is not possible for a non-thing.

original: des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de yang gzhal bya ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de yang gzhal bya ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because the consciousness that has that as its object is not a valid cognition, that also is not an object of comprehension.

original: bshad pa / yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par gnas pa ste rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par gnas pa ste rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Existence, nonexistence, both, and neither are well known to be the categories.

original: su'i @166a * //🔽zhe na / de yin pa dang de ma yin ba ni de dang de ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: su'i @166a * // zhe na / de yin pa dang de ma yin ba ni de dang de ma yin pa ste /
translated: Whose?🔽That which is and is not that is that and not that.

original: yod pa dang med pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'o //
translated: That is existence and nonexistence.

original: de dag gi brda ni tha snyad do //
analyzed: de dag gi brda ni tha snyad do //
translated: The convention of those is expression.🔽The one who makes the expression that has those is the one who makes the expression. The categories of those are the well known.

original: de gang la yod pa'i tha snyad byed pa bo de rnams kyi rnam par gnas pa ni go bar byed pa ma nges ba yin bas gcig tu nges bar 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa'i tha snyad byed pa bo de rnams kyi rnam par gnas pa ni go bar byed pa ma nges ba yin bas gcig tu nges bar 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the expression is not ascertained, it is not apprehended as ascertained as one.

original: dngos po med pa gzhal bya yin na nges pa dang ldan par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gzhal bya yin na nges pa dang ldan par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a nonthing is an object of comprehension, it is not apprehended as ascertained.

original: 'di ltar med pa gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par bcad ba med pas yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin bar rnam par gzhag bar bya bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid nges pa med pas rnam par gzhag par🔽bya mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par bcad ba med pas yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin bar rnam par gzhag bar bya bar 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid nges pa med pas rnam par gzhag par bya mi nus te /
translated: Since there is no ascertainment without a contradiction, it is impossible to establish it.

original: mi mthun pa med par nges pa med par ni nges par rnam par gnas ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang gi tshe dngos po med pa nyid rnam par gnas par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe med ba'i phyir mi mthun pa ma nges pas rnam par gnas par bya ba sgrub byed nges pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med par nges pa med par ni nges par rnam par gnas ba'i rgyu sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // gang gi tshe dngos po med pa nyid rnam par gnas par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe med ba'i phyir mi mthun pa ma nges pas rnam par gnas par bya ba sgrub byed nges pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: Because there is no cause for the establishment of an ascertainment without a contradiction.

original: 'on kyang rang nyid kyang med pa'i phyir sgrub byed ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid kyang med pa'i phyir sgrub byed ma nges pa yin no //
translated: When non-existence is to be established, then not only is the establishment of it not ascertained because of the uncertainty of the contradiction, but also the establishment is not ascertained because it itself does not exist.

original: yod ba la sogs par rnam par gnas pa ma yin bar ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod ba la sogs par rnam par gnas pa ma yin bar ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not possible to establish existence, etc. in worldly conventions.

original: 'di ltar sngon po yod pa dang sngon po ma yin pa med pa dang / gnyi ga med pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po yod pa dang sngon po ma yin pa med pa dang / gnyi ga med pa 'am /
translated: Thus, all those who make assertions, such as “blue exists,” “non-blue does not exist,” “both do not exist,”

original: de bzhin du 'di ni yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes de nyid 'dod pa'i yul na yod pa dang / gzhan med par rnam par gzhag nas tha snyad byed pa po thams cad 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes de nyid 'dod pa'i yul na yod pa dang / gzhan med par rnam par gzhag nas tha snyad byed pa po thams cad 'jug pa yin no //
translated: or “this is just so, but not otherwise,” engage in verbal activity having established the existence of the object that is desired and the non-existence of the other.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dang de ma yin pa'i brda can zhes gtan dang ldan pa la ldan pa'i don brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dang de ma yin pa'i brda can zhes gtan dang ldan pa la ldan pa'i don brjod pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the expression “having the sign of that and not that” means having the object of that.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi yod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad ston par byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ci ltar rung ste zhes bya ba rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad kyi yod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad ston par byas pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ci ltar rung ste zhes bya ba rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis so //
translated: Since the existence, etc., of all things is not taught, therefore, how is it possible?

original: gal te dngos po las logs shig tu dngos po med pa gzhal bar bya ba ma yin du chug kyang ;
analyzed: gal te dngos po las logs shig tu dngos po med pa gzhal bar bya ba ma yin du chug kyang ;
translated: Even if it is granted that non-existence is not an object of knowledge apart from existence,

original: dngos po 'dzin pa'i sgo nas ni des gzhal bya yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa'i sgo nas ni des gzhal bya yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said that it is an object of knowledge by way of the apprehension of existence.

original: de gzhal bya ma yin na mi mthun pa med pa'i dngos po yang yongs su ma bcad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gzhal bya ma yin na mi mthun pa med pa'i dngos po yang yongs su ma bcad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not an object of comprehension, then it follows that a thing that is not a non-concordant object is not determined.

original: gal te dngos po'i yul can nyid tshad mar sngar brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i yul can nyid tshad mar sngar brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But wasn’t it said earlier that valid knowledge has a thing as its object?

original: de ci ltar med pa gzhal bya @166b yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar med pa gzhal bya @166b yin zhe na /
translated: How can a non-existent be an object of comprehension?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir dngos bo'i yul can nyid ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir dngos bo'i yul can nyid ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: It is said: Because a thing is not the object of valid knowledge.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni nges pa'i don thob bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni nges pa'i don thob bar byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition of valid knowledge is that it has the nature of causing the attainment of a definite object.

original: don dam pa med kyang rung ste thob bar bya ba nges ba'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam pa med kyang rung ste thob bar bya ba nges ba'i yul yin gyi /
translated: Even if an ultimate truth does not exist, it is the object of a definite object of attainment.

original: dngos po nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a thing.

original: gang gi phyir mi slu ba tshad yin pa de'i phyir gal te nges par byas pa'i rang gi yul de la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med na yod pa dang med pa la shes pas yod pa dang med pa nges par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi slu ba tshad yin pa de'i phyir gal te nges par byas pa'i rang gi yul de la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med na yod pa dang med pa la shes pas yod pa dang med pa nges par byed do //
translated: Because non-deception is valid knowledge, if the object that is ascertained by it is not undermined by direct perception or inference, then it is ascertained by the consciousness that exists or does not exist as existent or non-existent.

original: gnod pa med pa de bas na shes pa 'di la tshad ma'i rang bzhin don thob par nus pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa de bas na shes pa 'di la tshad ma'i rang bzhin don thob par nus pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this cognition has the nature of valid knowledge, because it is able to obtain the object.

original: don thob par nus pa gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid yod pas tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: don thob par nus pa gnod pa med pa'i yul can nyid yod pas tshad ma yin no //
translated: It is valid knowledge, because it has the nature of being non-deceptive with regard to the object that is to be obtained.

original: 'ga' zhig gi med pa thob pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi med pa thob pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The obtainment of non-existence is just this.

original: 'jug pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la sogs par de'i don bya bar bzod pa'i rang bzhin thob par med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la sogs par de'i don bya bar bzod pa'i rang bzhin thob par med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the obtainment of the nature of being able to perform the function of that object in the desired place, etc.

original: de'i phyir med pa'i yul can yang tshad ma yin pas med pa gzhal bya yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa'i yul can yang tshad ma yin pas med pa gzhal bya yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is valid knowledge even when having a non-existent object, non-existence is an object of comprehension.

original: gal te dngos bo med pa'i yul can yang tshad mar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dngos bo med pa'i yul can yang tshad mar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that even that which has a non-existent object is valid knowledge,🔽then what is the point of calling it valid knowledge?

original: 'o na ci ltar gtan tshigs thigs par sgro btags kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don bya ba sgrub pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam 'grel dang / le'u gnyis par mi dmigs pa thams cad don byed par rung ba'i dngos po ston pa'i byed pa can yin par bshad /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gtan tshigs thigs par sgro btags kyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni don bya ba sgrub pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / rnam 'grel dang / le'u gnyis par mi dmigs pa thams cad don byed par rung ba'i dngos po ston pa'i byed pa can yin par bshad /
translated: Well then, how do you interpret the Drop of Logic, which says, “Conceptual consciousnesses that apprehend the nature of superimposition are not valid cognitions because they do not apprehend the performance of function,” and the Thorough Exposition of Valid Cognition and the second chapter of the Ornament of the Middle Way, which explain that all nonapprehensions have the function of revealing things that are able to perform functions?

original: 'di dag gis don byed pa la mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhes kyang ci ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag gis don byed pa la mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhes kyang ci ltar bshad ce na /
translated: And how do you interpret the statement, “Because they are nondeceptive with respect to the performance of function”?

original: dngos po 'ba' zhig la ni tshad ma chung zad kyang yod par mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po 'ba' zhig la ni tshad ma chung zad kyang yod par mi brjod kyi /
translated: We do not say that there are any valid cognitions whatsoever with respect to mere things.

original: 'on kyang dngos po 'dzin pa'i tshad ma nyid dngos po med pa'i yul can yin no zhes 'di gnyis kyis don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po 'dzin pa'i tshad ma nyid dngos po med pa'i yul can yin no zhes 'di gnyis kyis don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //
translated: However, these two passages explain that the valid cognition that apprehends a thing has an object that is a nonthing.

original: de yongs su gcod par byed cing ;
analyzed: de yongs su gcod par byed cing ;
translated: It is that which determines that thing

original: don gzhan rnam par gcod bar byed la /
analyzed: don gzhan rnam par gcod bar byed la /
translated: and eliminates other objects.

original: rnam pa gzhan gsum pa yang med par ston par byed ces bshad pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gsum pa yang med par ston par byed ces bshad pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: and also because it explains that there is no third possibility.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dngos po'i 'bras bu yin pas dngos po nyid thob par byed pa na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma dngos po'i 'bras bu yin pas dngos po nyid thob par byed pa na /
translated: Therefore, since a valid cognition is the effect of an entity, when it obtains an entity,

original: gzhan rnam par bcad pa thob par byed pa'i phyir @167a * //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par bcad pa thob par byed pa'i phyir @167a * //
translated: it also obtains the exclusion of other.

original: dngos po nges pa na 'khrul pa med par nges ba gzhan nges pa la yang tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po nges pa na 'khrul pa med par nges ba gzhan nges pa la yang tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, when an entity is ascertained, the ascertainment of the absence of error is also a valid cognition.

original: gang gis 'bras bu ma yin ba dang / dngos po thob par mi phyed pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba rang rgyud pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu ma yin ba dang / dngos po thob par mi phyed pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba rang rgyud pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not autonomous, which would entail the fault of not distinguishing the effect from the nonentity.

original: des na dngos po med pa'i yul can tshad ma yin yang skyon med do //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa'i yul can tshad ma yin yang skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, even though a valid cognition has a nonentity as its object, there is no fault.

original: rigs pa can gyis yang smras pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa can gyis yang smras pa ni /
translated: The Naiyāyikas say:

original: gal te dngos po med pa thams cad shes bya dang gzhal bya la sogs pa rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yod pa'i phyir 'ga' yang rnam pa thams cad du dngos po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa thams cad shes bya dang gzhal bya la sogs pa rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar yod pa'i phyir 'ga' yang rnam pa thams cad du dngos po med pa ma yin no //
translated: If all nonentities were in some way objects of knowledge and objects of comprehension, then nothing would be completely nonexistent.

original: dngos po yang thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gcig tu yod pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: dngos po yang thams cad kyi rang bzhin du gcig tu yod pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: And there is no entity whatsoever that exists as a single nature of all things.

original: me chu'i rang bzhin du yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: me chu'i rang bzhin du yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not that it exists as the nature of fire and water.

original: gal te de lta na rnam pa gang gis med pa'i rnam pa de dngos bo med pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na rnam pa gang gis med pa'i rnam pa de dngos bo med pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then whatever form it is that does not exist, that form is a nonentity.

original: des na dngos po med pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, a nonentity exists.

original: de yang gzhal bya yin pas gzhal bya nyid gnyi ga'i chos su grub po//
analyzed: de yang gzhal bya yin pas gzhal bya nyid gnyi ga'i chos su grub po//
translated: And since it is an object of comprehension, the object of comprehension is established as a property of both.

original: de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa ma yin te /🔽ma dmigs ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma la ri bong yang yod la rva yang yod pa'i phyir dpe gnyi gas stong pa yin par mthong nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag ni yod pa ma yin te / ma dmigs ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshad ma la ri bong yang yod la rva yang yod pa'i phyir dpe gnyi gas stong pa yin par mthong nas /
translated: In the same way, the self does not exist because it is not observed, like the horns of a rabbit.🔽Seeing that the example is empty of both because the rabbit exists and the horns exist,

original: ri bong gi rva med par smra ba la gsal byed kyis bzhad gang du byas pa /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med par smra ba la gsal byed kyis bzhad gang du byas pa /
translated: the proponent of the nonexistence of the horns of a rabbit is ridiculed by the challenger.

original: ri bong dang rva dag yod par mthong ba'i rgyu'i phyir sangs rgyas pa ri bong gi rva med par smra ba la bzhad gang du byed pa de ni mi shes par ston bas bdag nyid la bzhad gang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ri bong dang rva dag yod par mthong ba'i rgyu'i phyir sangs rgyas pa ri bong gi rva med par smra ba la bzhad gang du byed pa de ni mi shes par ston bas bdag nyid la bzhad gang byed pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha’s disciples, who say that the rabbit’s horns do not exist, laugh at the Vaiseṣikas, who say that the rabbit’s horns exist. But the Buddha’s disciples, by saying this, show their own ignorance.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ltar ri bong gi rtsom byed yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i rva med do zhes rjod par byed par 'gyur la /🔽rva dang ma 'brel pa'i ri bong yang yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ri bong gi rtsom byed yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i rva med do zhes rjod par byed par 'gyur la / rva dang ma 'brel pa'i ri bong yang yod la /
translated: They say that the rabbit’s horns do not exist, but they do not say that the rabbit’s horns do not exist as the components of the rabbit.🔽The rabbit is not related to the horns, but the horns are related to the rabbit.

original: ri bong gi yan lag tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i rva yang yod do zhes bya ba'i lan 'di'i skabs ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: ri bong gi yan lag tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i rva yang yod do zhes bya ba'i lan 'di'i skabs ni ci yang med do //
translated: There is no occasion for saying that the horns do not exist as components of the rabbit.

original: de bas na bdag nyid la mi shes pas byed par bzhad gang byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid la mi shes pas byed par bzhad gang byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha’s disciples are laughing at themselves,

original: skabs su ma bab pa brjod pa'i phyir ro; ;
analyzed: skabs su ma bab pa brjod pa'i phyir ro; ;
translated: because they are talking nonsense.

original: ci ltar lan skabs sum bab ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar lan skabs sum bab ce na /
translated: How is it that they are talking nonsense?

original: gang gi na ri bong dang rva yod par brjod pa des na gnod par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi na ri bong dang rva yod par brjod pa des na gnod par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are talking nonsense because they are refuting the horns of the rabbit.

original: sun phyung bar 'gyur ba sangs rgyas pa de rva tsam mam /
analyzed: sun phyung bar 'gyur ba sangs rgyas pa de rva tsam mam /
translated: The refutation of this is as follows:🔽

original: ri bong tsam la bsnyon pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong tsam la bsnyon pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The refutation is not of a Buddhist who is a mere horn or a mere rabbit.

original: 'o na ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: khyad par can ri bong dang 'brel pa can @167b no ;
analyzed: khyad par can ri bong dang 'brel pa can @167b no ;
translated: It is a horn that is related to a rabbit, which is qualified by a particular.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ri bong gi zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ri bong gi zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “of a rabbit” is used.

original: gal te de ltar na ri bong dang rva gnyis kyi 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya ba'i rva ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na ri bong dang rva gnyis kyi 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya ba'i rva ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then it should be said that the horn and the rabbit are not related.

original: 'brel pa las 'brel pa can du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa las 'brel pa can du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The related object is known through the relation.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa dgag par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa dgag par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the relation is what is to be refuted.

original: cig shos rang gi tshig nyid kyis rva bkag par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: cig shos rang gi tshig nyid kyis rva bkag par brjod pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Since the other, the horn, is refuted by its own words, it is said:

original: ci ba lang la sogs ba rva can rnams kyi 'brel pa can rva la 'brel pa tsam khyad par yod kyi /
analyzed: ci ba lang la sogs ba rva can rnams kyi 'brel pa can rva la 'brel pa tsam khyad par yod kyi /
translated: Is the relation of the horns of cows and so on, which are related to the horns, merely a relation, or is there a difference?

original: rdzas rva ma yin nam /
analyzed: rdzas rva ma yin nam /
translated: Is the substance of the horn not a horn?

original: gal te rva can thams cad kyi rva tha dad pa med par gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rva can thams cad kyi rva tha dad pa med par gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If the horns of all horned beings were not different, they would be one.

original: de'i tshe gzhan bzhin du thams cad kyi thun mong gi rva dang ri bong gi 'brel pa dgag par 'gyur gyi rdzas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan bzhin du thams cad kyi thun mong gi rva dang ri bong gi 'brel pa dgag par 'gyur gyi rdzas ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the relation of the horn to the rabbit would be denied, just as it is to any other thing, but not the substance.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: rva can rnams la rva'i rang bzhin yang tha dad do //
analyzed: rva can rnams la rva'i rang bzhin yang tha dad do //
translated: The nature of the horn is different for those who have horns.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why?

original: 'bras bu so so la rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu so so la rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the cause is different for each effect.

original: rva la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi rtsom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rva la sogs pa ni 'bras bu yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi rtsom par byed pa yin no //
translated: The horn, etc. are the components of the substance which is the whole, the effect.

original: rtsom par byed pa yang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: rtsom par byed pa yang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
translated: And the components are different because the effect is different.

original: 'o na ni rgyu tha dad pa byed pa'i phyir 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di med do //
analyzed: 'o na ni rgyu tha dad pa byed pa'i phyir 'brel pa med ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di med do //
translated: Well then, the fault that you ascribe to us, namely, that the relation is not tenable because the cause is different, does not exist.

original: ri bong dang 'brel ba'i rva gang yin pa de nyid med pa de bas na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ci zhig brjod /
analyzed: ri bong dang 'brel ba'i rva gang yin pa de nyid med pa de bas na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ci zhig brjod /
translated: The horn that is related to the rabbit does not exist. Therefore, why do you say that it is inexpressible?

original: klan ka'i go skabs smras pa ni /
analyzed: klan ka'i go skabs smras pa ni /
translated: The opportunity for fault is stated:

original: rva yod pa rnams kyi rva dag rang bzhin tha dad pa yod ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rva yod pa rnams kyi rva dag rang bzhin tha dad pa yod ba yin gyi /
translated: The horns of those who have horns exist as different natures.

original: rva dang ldan pa ri bong gi rva rang bzhin gyi khyad par can ni med do //
analyzed: rva dang ldan pa ri bong gi rva rang bzhin gyi khyad par can ni med do //
translated: But the horns of a rabbit, which has horns, do not exist as a special nature.

original: 'di skad ces brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang la rva yod pa de'i khyad par can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang la rva yod pa de'i khyad par can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: The horns of one who has horns exist as a special nature.

original: ri bong la ni rva med pa nyid kyi khyad par can yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong la ni rva med pa nyid kyi khyad par can yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the horns of a rabbit, which do not exist, do not exist as a special nature.

original: des na ri bong de'i rva khyad par can ci zhig dgag par bya /
analyzed: des na ri bong de'i rva khyad par can ci zhig dgag par bya /
translated: Therefore, what special horns of a rabbit are to be refuted?

original: yod pa'i phyir rva tsam yang dgag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir rva tsam yang dgag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Because they exist, mere horns are also to be refuted.

original: des na 'brel ba dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir klan ka 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na 'brel ba dgag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir klan ka 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, because the connection is to be refuted, there is no fault at all.

original: gang gi phyir ci ltar khyed 'brel pa dgag par bya bar sgrub par 'dod pas de bzhin du ri bong gi rva khyad par can ni med do zhes brjod pa ltar kho bo de nyid smra'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ci ltar khyed 'brel pa dgag par bya bar sgrub par 'dod pas de bzhin du ri bong gi rva khyad par can ni med do zhes brjod pa ltar kho bo de nyid smra'o //
translated: Because of that, just as you assert that the connection is to be refuted, in the same way, we say that the special horns of a rabbit do not exist.

original: gdon mi za bar khyed kyis gang gi phyir rva can ltar ri bong la khyad bar can gyi rva med pa de'i phyir @168a * //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar khyed kyis gang gi phyir rva can ltar ri bong la khyad bar can gyi rva med pa de'i phyir @168a * //
translated: It is certain that you must accept that, just as a rabbit does not have a special horn, it does not have a horn at all.

original: 'brel pa dgag par bya ba yin no zhes brjod dgos so //
analyzed: 'brel pa dgag par bya ba yin no zhes brjod dgos so //
translated: You must say that the relation is to be refuted because the rabbit does not have a special horn like the horned animal.

original: kho bos kyang ri bong la khyad par can gyi rva med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kho bos kyang ri bong la khyad par can gyi rva med do zhes brjod do //
translated: We also say that the rabbit does not have a special horn.

original: des na gang gi phyir nga la klan kar 'gyur la bdag nyid ma yin pa yu bu cag gnyis la khyad par med do //
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir nga la klan kar 'gyur la bdag nyid ma yin pa yu bu cag gnyis la khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, since we are in agreement, there is no difference between us.

original: yang na khyad kyis dgag par bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin pa de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na khyad kyis dgag par bya ba'i 'brel pa gang yin pa de nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the relation that is to be refuted by the special reason is itself nonexistent, and so it is a nonentity.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po med pas 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po med pas 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then we agree that it is a nonentity.

original: de lta yin du zad mod /
analyzed: de lta yin du zad mod /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: khyod kyis kyang 'brel pa dgag bar bya ba yin gyi 'brel ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang 'brel pa dgag bar bya ba yin gyi 'brel ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: you refute the relation, but not the related.

original: 'brel pa can yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the related exists.

original: 'di ni khyed kyi tshig gi tshul don 'brel ba med pa can gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khyed kyi tshig gi tshul don 'brel ba med pa can gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another incoherent statement of yours.

original: 'brel pa can yod la 'brel pa med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can yod la 'brel pa med do zhes bya'o //
translated: You say that the related exists, but the relation does not.

original: 'brel pa can ni 'brel pa'i khyad par can yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa med na ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'brel pa can ni 'brel pa'i khyad par can yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa med na ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: But if the relation does not exist, how can there be a related?

original: dbyig pa med par ni de'i khyad par can dbyig pa can yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa med par ni de'i khyad par can dbyig pa can yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For without a stick, there is no one who has a stick.

original: de'i phyir tshig brtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig brtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, your statement is not tenable.

original: 'brel pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa can ri bong dang 'brel pa can gyi rva'i rdzas kyang med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa can ri bong dang 'brel pa can gyi rva'i rdzas kyang med do //
translated: Not only is there no relation, but also there is no substance of a rabbit’s horn that is related to a relation.

original: de skad smra na /
analyzed: de skad smra na /
translated: If you say this,

original: 'o na ni khyod kyis nged kyi 'dod pa chen po bsgrubs te /
analyzed: 'o na ni khyod kyis nged kyi 'dod pa chen po bsgrubs te /
translated: then you have accepted our position.

original: gang gi phyir nged kyang ri bong dang 'brel pa can gyi rva khyad par can med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nged kyang ri bong dang 'brel pa can gyi rva khyad par can med do zhes brjod do //
translated: We also say that there is no substance of a rabbit’s horn that is related to a relation.

original: gal te mthar 'di nyid gdon mi za bar brjod dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te mthar 'di nyid gdon mi za bar brjod dgos pa yin no //
translated: If you say this, then you have accepted our position.

original: khyod kyis 'di nyid dang por brjod na 'dod pa smra ba khyod 'gal ba 'du ba brjod pa la sogs pas ngas nyon mongs par mi bya ba zhig go //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'di nyid dang por brjod na 'dod pa smra ba khyod 'gal ba 'du ba brjod pa la sogs pas ngas nyon mongs par mi bya ba zhig go //
translated: You, the one who wants to speak, are in contradiction, since you first state this, but then you do not afflict me with the contradiction of stating what is contradictory, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyod ni lha rnams dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyod ni lha rnams dga' ba yin te /
translated: For this very reason, you are the delight of the gods,

original: dang por brjod par bya ba dang por mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang por brjod par bya ba dang por mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you do not state what should be stated first at the beginning.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, nonthings do not exist,

original: de yang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid kyang thun mong gi ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya nyid kyang thun mong gi ma nges pa yin no //
translated: and since they are objects of comprehension, the object of comprehension is also a common inconclusive reason.

original: de ltar ma nges pa brjod nas 'gal pa 'khrul pa med pa can yang slob dpon gyis rgyur bshad ni /
analyzed: de ltar ma nges pa brjod nas 'gal pa 'khrul pa med pa can yang slob dpon gyis rgyur bshad ni /
translated: Having stated the inconclusive reason in that way, the master also explains the contradictory inconclusive reason.

original: de ma nges pa gang gi nang du 'du zhe na /
analyzed: de ma nges pa gang gi nang du 'du zhe na /
translated: In which category is that inconclusive reason included?

original: de rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'dir bshad pas ma nges pa'i nang du bsdu bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'dir bshad pas ma nges pa'i nang du bsdu bas ci zhig bya /
translated: Since it is stated here that the object of inference is inconclusive, what is the point of including it in the inconclusive?

original: ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it not stated?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni @168b tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni @168b tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa ste /
translated: The object of inference is the trimodal logical mark that has been established by a valid cognition.

original: yul de la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul de la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for there to be a nonerroneous contradiction with regard to that object.

original: ci ltar mi srid ce na /🔽ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can rang bzhin dang 'bras bu rang bzhin 'brel pa can dag gam /
analyzed: ci ltar mi srid ce na / ji skad bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can rang bzhin dang 'bras bu rang bzhin 'brel pa can dag gam /
translated: How is it impossible?

original: bltar rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa la ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid do //
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa la ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid do //
translated: With regard to the nature and effect that have the characteristics as they have been explained, or with regard to the nonapprehension of an object that is suitable to appear, it is impossible for there to be a nonerroneous contradiction.

original: gang gi rang gis bsgrub bya la 'khrul pa med pa can gyi sgrub par byed pa gnyis gcig la 'gyur ba gcig ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rang gis bsgrub bya la 'khrul pa med pa can gyi sgrub par byed pa gnyis gcig la 'gyur ba gcig ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: In the case of a proof that is nonerroneous with regard to its own probandum, the two—the probandum and the proof—cannot be one, and that which is one cannot possess two contradictory natures.

original: gang zhig 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du 'gyur bar dag las mi 'khrul pa can gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du 'gyur bar dag las mi 'khrul pa can gzhan ni med do //
translated: And that which is nonerroneous with regard to the two—that is, that which is nonerroneous with regard to a contradiction—cannot be erroneous.

original: de bas na tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid do //
analyzed: de bas na tshad mas grub pa'i tshul gsum pa'i yul la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for there to be a nonerroneous contradiction with regard to an object that is trimodal and has been established by a valid cognition.

original: 'o na slob dpon gyis 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gang du brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon gyis 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gang du brjod ce na /
translated: Well then, where did the master Nagarjuna state the nonerroneous contradiction?

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma bshad pa de'i phyir lung gi don dbang po las 'das pa de dpyod pa'i skabs su lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma bshad pa de'i phyir lung gi don dbang po las 'das pa de dpyod pa'i skabs su lung la brten pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Because the object of inference is not explained, therefore, when the meaning of scripture is analyzed, that which is based on scripture is inference.

original: dbang po las 'das pa dpyod pa na dngos po ma mthong pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de'i stobs kyis lung las grub pa'i tshul gsum pa las rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa dpyod pa na dngos po ma mthong pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de'i stobs kyis lung las grub pa'i tshul gsum pa las rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: When the supersensible is analyzed, that which is not seen by the senses is not a valid means of knowledge. The power of that conception is the inference based on the three modes established from scripture.

original: de la brten nas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can bshad do //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can bshad do //
translated: Based on that, the nonerroneous contradiction is explained.

original: gal te dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid na lung dang ldan pa'i don la ci srid ce na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid na lung dang ldan pa'i don la ci srid ce na /
translated: If the nonerroneous contradiction is impossible in an inference that engages by the power of the thing, how could it be possible in the meaning of scripture?

original: bstan bcos byed pa rnams ni 'khrul pas don rnams la rang bzhin log par ston pa srid pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa rnams ni 'khrul pas don rnams la rang bzhin log par ston pa srid pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that those who compose treatises, due to error, may teach the nature of objects incorrectly.

original: gal te 'khrul pas rang bzhin log par ston srid pa'i phyir lung gi don la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pas rang bzhin log par ston srid pa'i phyir lung gi don la 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can srid pa yin na /
translated: If it is possible that due to error, the meaning of scripture may be taught incorrectly, then it is possible that the meaning of scripture may be contradictory and erroneous.

original: 'o na nged 'dra bas byas ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ji ltar mi srid ce na /
analyzed: 'o na nged 'dra bas byas ba'i rjes su dpag pa la ji ltar mi srid ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it that it is impossible for there to be such in the case of an inference composed by someone like us?

original: 'di ltar bdag dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa de rnams la ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang 'bras bu dang mi dmigs pa de rnams la ste /
translated: It is like this: in the case of the self, effect, and nonapprehension,

original: de rnams kyi nang du ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang du ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can mi srid do //
translated: it is impossible for there to be a contradiction and error in those.

original: don dam pa'i rnam par gnas pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rnam par gnas pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba la /
translated: Ultimate reality is called “the nature of things.”

original: de las ma 'das par 'dug pa ste gnas pa gang yin pa de @169a * //🔽rnams la ste /
analyzed: de las ma 'das par 'dug pa ste gnas pa gang yin pa de @169a * // rnams la ste /
translated: That which abides without going beyond that🔽is the nature of things.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: That is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po'i de kho na nyid ci ltar gnas pa de bzhin du bdag dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di rnams la 'khrul pa'i dbang gis 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ba'i go skabs yod pa🔽ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po'i de kho na nyid ci ltar gnas pa de bzhin du bdag dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di rnams la 'khrul pa'i dbang gis 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ba'i go skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the non-apprehension of self and effect is established in accordance with the reality of things, there is no opportunity for these to be contradictory by the power of error.

original: 'brel pa ma mthong ba ni 'bras bu 'am rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ma yin la /
analyzed: 'brel pa ma mthong ba ni 'bras bu 'am rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ma yin la /
translated: The non-perception of the relation is neither an effect nor a reason based on essence.

original: 'brel pa ma mthong ba ni 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma mthong ba ni 'khrul pa med do //
translated: The non-perception of the relation is not erroneous.

original: de las 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de las 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can gyi dper brjod pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is an example of a contradiction that is not erroneous.

original: 'di la drang srong chen po gzigs zan gyi thams cad du song ba yin no zhes bshad pa'i dngos kyi slob ma gnyis las /
analyzed: 'di la drang srong chen po gzigs zan gyi thams cad du song ba yin no zhes bshad pa'i dngos kyi slob ma gnyis las /
translated: In this regard, the great sage Kātyāyana said, “The all-pervading is all-pervading.” Two direct disciples of his🔽held different views.

original: be lu kas ni spyi thams cad du song ba dang / pe tha ras ni rang gi rten tsam thams cad du song par gzung ngo //
analyzed: be lu kas ni spyi thams cad du song ba dang / pe tha ras ni rang gi rten tsam thams cad du song par gzung ngo //
translated: Beloka held that the all-pervading is all-pervading, and Pethara held that the all-pervading is the mere support of itself.

original: de dag gi mkhan po 'das nas rtsod pa na pe lu kas cig shos las tshad ma'i lan smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gi mkhan po 'das nas rtsod pa na pe lu kas cig shos las tshad ma'i lan smras pa /
translated: After their preceptor had passed away, when there was a dispute, Bṛhaspati gave the answer of a logician to the other:

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni thams cad na yod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni thams cad na yod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “The universals of cow and so on exist in all places.” This is the probandum.

original: yul thams cad na gnas pa dang 'brel pa can 'du ba'i rten gyi gong bu dag dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yul thams cad na gnas pa dang 'brel pa can 'du ba'i rten gyi gong bu dag dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Because they are simultaneously related to the aggregates that are the basis of inherence, which are related to all places” is the reason.

original: nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba ni khyab pa'i yul lo //
translated: “Like space” is the pervasion.

original: nam mkha' ni yul thams cad yod pa rang dang ldan pa can dang 'du ba can gyi rdzas rnams dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa yul thams cad na yod pa de bzhin du spyi yang thams cad na yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni yul thams cad yod pa rang dang ldan pa can dang 'du ba can gyi rdzas rnams dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa yul thams cad na yod pa de bzhin du spyi yang thams cad na yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as space, which exists in all places, is simultaneously related to the substances that are related to all places, in the same way, the universal exists in all places.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid sbyar ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid sbyar ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to apply the definition of an essential reason, it is said:

original: spyi'i rang bzhin gang zhig yul du ma na yod pa'i rdzas de dag dang 'brel pa can gyi spyi'i rang bzhin de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa de dag gi yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin gang zhig yul du ma na yod pa'i rdzas de dag dang 'brel pa can gyi spyi'i rang bzhin de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa de dag gi yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The universal that is related to the substances that exist in many places is the universal that is related to just those that exist in those places.

original: yang ci'i phyir gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa ste /🔽de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gang zhig gang dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa ste / de'i yul na 'dug pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is the universal that is related to something the nature of that which exists in its place?

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig yul gang na med pa ni yul de gang la yod pa'i don de'i yul can der de na med pa'i don gyi rang gi ngo bos khyab par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig yul gang na med pa ni yul de gang la yod pa'i don de'i yul can der de na med pa'i don gyi rang gi ngo bos khyab par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that which does not exist in a certain place does not pervade the object that exists in that place with its own nature.

original: gang gis thag ring po na 'dug pa rnams la yang 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis thag ring po na 'dug pa rnams la yang 'gyur ba /
translated: Because of that, even those that exist far away

original: spyi dang de dang ldan pa rnams nor dang bdag @169b po'i 'brel pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi dang de dang ldan pa rnams nor dang bdag @169b po'i 'brel pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The relation of the universal and that which possesses the universal is not like the relation of a cow and its owner.

original: 'on kyang 'du bas yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'du bas yin la /
translated: Rather, it is through inherence.

original: de yang yul gcig pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: de yang yul gcig pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: And that is of those that have the same location.

original: pha rol po dag 'khrul pa brjod pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol po dag 'khrul pa brjod pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' la med kyang ste /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' la med kyang ste /
translated: You say that space is the nonexistence of form, etc., but form, etc.,

original: de dag ni yon tan yin yang yon tan can bum pa la sogs pa la 'du ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni yon tan yin yang yon tan can bum pa la sogs pa la 'du ba yin gyi /
translated: are qualities, and they are combined with the qualified pot, etc.,

original: nam mkha' la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni ma yin te /
translated: but not with space.

original: des na de'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, space is not the object of the cognition of form, etc.🔽The pot, etc., are combined with space, and therefore they are the object of the cognition of space.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni nam mkha' dang sbyor ba de'i yul can yin pa des na gzugs la sogs pa de'i yul can ma yin yang nam mkha'i yul can bum pa la sogs pa khyad par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni nam mkha' dang sbyor ba de'i yul can yin pa des na gzugs la sogs pa de'i yul can ma yin yang nam mkha'i yul can bum pa la sogs pa khyad par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, although form, etc., are not the object of the cognition of space, the pot, etc., which are the object of the cognition of form, etc., are distinguished as the object of space,

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are combined with space.

original: de bas na gang gis gang khyab par bya ba des ni khyab bya'i yul can du gyur par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ma nges so zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gang gis gang khyab par bya ba des ni khyab bya'i yul can du gyur par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ma nges so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that whatever is pervaded by something is the object of the cognition of that pervader.

original: gang las gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ba grub pa'i mtha' las grags par ldan pa dang 'du ba dag las yul dang yul can gyi dngos po gang yin pa yul la gnas pa nyid 'di ni re zhig
analyzed: gang las gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa yul tha mi dad par 'gyur ba grub pa'i mtha' las grags par ldan pa dang 'du ba dag las yul dang yul can gyi dngos po gang yin pa yul la gnas pa nyid 'di ni re zhig
translated: The object that is the basis of the object and subject is posited as existing in the object.

original: bzhag ste / 'jig rten pa nyams su myong bas rtogs pa tha dad pa 'am tha mi dad pa la brten nas gang gang na med pa des ni de'i yul can bdag nyid kyis khyab par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bzhag ste / 'jig rten pa nyams su myong bas rtogs pa tha dad pa 'am tha mi dad pa la brten nas gang gang na med pa des ni de'i yul can bdag nyid kyis khyab par byed pa ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Based on the experience of the world, it is understood that if something is absent in something, the latter does not pervade the former.

original: nyams su myong bas grub pa'i yul tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de nyid brjod par rnam par chad pa dang ma chad pa'i don dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin gyi yul la brten nas te /
analyzed: nyams su myong bas grub pa'i yul tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de nyid brjod par rnam par chad pa dang ma chad pa'i don dag tu snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i rang bzhin gyi yul la brten nas te /
translated: The object that is established by experience is either different from or the same as the object. It is based on the object that is suitable to generate a consciousness that appears as a meaning that is either interrupted or uninterrupted.

original: don gnyis po dag rnam par phye bar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par drung ba'i rang bzhin ni yul tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: don gnyis po dag rnam par phye bar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par drung ba'i rang bzhin ni yul tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The nature of an object that is suitable to generate a consciousness that appears as a division of the two objects is a different object.

original: rnam par phye ba med par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid ni tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba med par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i mtshan nyid ni tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: The characteristic of an object that is suitable to generate a consciousness that appears without division is nondifference.

original: gzugs dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams la ni rnam par bcad par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams la ni rnam par bcad par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin gyi /
translated: In regard to form, pot, and so on, a consciousness that appears as a division is not generated.

original: 'on kyang rnam par mchod par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par mchod par snang ba yin no //
translated: However, it appears as a nondivision.

original: des na bum pa dang de'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yul tha mi dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na bum pa dang de'i gzugs la sogs pa ni yul tha mi dad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, a pot and its form, and so on, are not different objects.

original: gal te 'di 'jig rten pa la brten pa'i rnam par spyod pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'jig rten pa la brten pa'i rnam par spyod pa ni ma yin na /
translated: If this is not a mode of activity based on the world,

original: des na 'dir 'jig rten pa'i yul gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'dir 'jig rten pa'i yul gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: then what is the use of a worldly object here?

original: bshad pa / @170a * //
analyzed: bshad pa / @170a * //
translated: In response,

original: so sor grub pa dag la ni ldan pa'i 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: so sor grub pa dag la ni ldan pa'i 'brel pa yin la /
translated: it is a relation of possession in regard to individual establishments.

original: so sor ma yin par 'grub par grub pa dag la ni 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi yang rnam par gzhag pa yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: so sor ma yin par 'grub par grub pa dag la ni 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi yang rnam par gzhag pa yin par mthong ngo //
translated: This is also seen to be the presentation of the treatise.

original: de la so sor grub pa ni yul tha dad par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la so sor grub pa ni yul tha dad par grub pa'o //
translated: There, that which is established as separate is established as having a different object.

original: so sor ma yin par grub pa ni yul tha dad par ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor ma yin par grub pa ni yul tha dad par ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir 'du ba'i 'brel pa yin no //
translated: That which is established as not separate is not established as having a different object, and therefore is related by the relation of inherence.

original: gal te yul tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa nyid bstan bcos las gdon mi za bar bsten par bya ba yin yang de nyid kho bo cag brjod pa'i phyir mi rigs pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te yul tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa nyid bstan bcos las gdon mi za bar bsten par bya ba yin yang de nyid kho bo cag brjod pa'i phyir mi rigs pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If it is necessary to state whether the object is separate or not separate in the treatise, what is unreasonable about our stating it?

original: des na 'dir rang gi ngo bos khyab pa ni yod pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: des na 'dir rang gi ngo bos khyab pa ni yod pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, here, that which is pervaded by its own nature is the pervasion.

original: des na nye bar mi gnas pa yang de na yod pa ma yin ba'i phyir khyab par byed pa med pas 'brel pa can nyid nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa las ldog pa na de na nye bar gnas pas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar mi gnas pa yang de na yod pa ma yin ba'i phyir khyab par byed pa med pas 'brel pa can nyid nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa las ldog pa na de na nye bar gnas pas khyab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the non-pervasion of the pervader is not present there, the presence of the related object is pervaded by its presence there.

original: de'i phyir spyi 'di'i rang yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa can /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi 'di'i rang yod pa tsam dang 'brel pa can /
translated: Therefore, this universal is related to the mere presence of its own particular.

original: 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyi yul na gnas bar bsgrub par bya ba de'i ngo bos khyab pas de dang 'brel pa can gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyi yul na gnas bar bsgrub par bya ba de'i ngo bos khyab pas de dang 'brel pa can gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The object that is the locus of the related substance is the probandum. Since it is pervaded by its nature, that which is related to it is an autonomous reason.

original: gzu bo 'ga' zhig mtshungs par ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzu bo 'ga' zhig mtshungs par ston pa ni /
translated: The statement that some are similar is as follows:

original: gal te rang gi rten la khyab par smra bas kyang rang gi rten gyi yul na spyi gnas par 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rten la khyab par smra bas kyang rang gi rten gyi yul na spyi gnas par 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If one asserts that the pervader of its own basis is the universal that exists in the locus of its own basis, then is it not asserted that the universal exists in the locus of its own basis?

original: de'i phyir phyir rgol ba mi 'dod pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyir rgol ba mi 'dod pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: Therefore, what is the unwanted consequence for the opponent?

original: mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the unwanted consequence, it is said:

original: spyi ni gnyis kyang bya ba med par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni gnyis kyang bya ba med par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The general is also asserted to be without activity.

original: gcig dang 'brel pa can gsal ba de skye ba las sngon yul de na med pa'i spyi de ni gsal ba de'i yul las yul gzhan du snga na med pa'i gsal ba skye ba na /
analyzed: gcig dang 'brel pa can gsal ba de skye ba las sngon yul de na med pa'i spyi de ni gsal ba de'i yul las yul gzhan du snga na med pa'i gsal ba skye ba na /
translated: The manifestation that is related to the one is produced from the object, and the universal that did not exist there previously is not related to that manifestation.

original: bya ba med pas mi 'gro ba'i phyir phyis kyang gsal ba de dang 'brel par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bya ba med pas mi 'gro ba'i phyir phyis kyang gsal ba de dang 'brel par mi rung ngo //
translated: Because it does not go to another place without activity, it is not suitable to be related to that manifestation later.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir yul tha dad ba dag dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa ni spyi'i yul thams cad khyab pa yin na grub bo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir yul tha dad ba dag dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa ni spyi'i yul thams cad khyab pa yin na grub bo //
translated: Because that is so, the object of the universal pervades all objects, and it is established that it is simultaneously related to different objects.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dngos po gcig dang 'brel pa can gyi don gyi yul gzhan pa sngon med skyes pa dag dang 'brel pa ni sngon nas yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dngos po gcig dang 'brel pa can gyi don gyi yul gzhan pa sngon med skyes pa dag dang 'brel pa ni sngon nas yin no //
translated: Because that is so, the object of the meaning that is related to one thing is related to other previously non-existent objects that are produced.

original: du ma ni ma song yang snga na med pa dang lhan cig gnas @170b par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: du ma ni ma song yang snga na med pa dang lhan cig gnas @170b par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Although many do not go, they become co-existent with the non-existent.

original: spyi gcig ni bya ba med ba'i phyir ma song bar yul gzhan ba dag dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: spyi gcig ni bya ba med ba'i phyir ma song bar yul gzhan ba dag dang cig car mngon par 'brel pa ni /
translated: The universal is not present in the other places, because it is devoid of activity.

original: gsol ba'i khyad par de dag gi bar de dag gsal ba gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang / gsal bas stong pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de khyab pa ste zin pa de med na mi 'byung ba der mi 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: gsol ba'i khyad par de dag gi bar de dag gsal ba gzhan gyi bdag nyid dang / gsal bas stong pa'i yul gyi bdag nyid gang yin pa de khyab pa ste zin pa de med na mi 'byung ba der mi 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The universal is that which is not present in the other places, which are devoid of the manifestation of the particular, and which are devoid of the manifestation.

original: dpe bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dpe bshad pa ni /
translated: The example is:

original: dper na yul du man gnas ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dang mngon par 'brel pa nyi ma la sogs pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na yul du man gnas ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dang mngon par 'brel pa nyi ma la sogs pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as the sun, etc., are related to the particular, the pot, etc., which are present in different places, so is the universal.

original: rang gi rten tsam thams cad la yod par smra ba pe tha re'i sbyor ba yang spyi ni thams cad du song ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rten tsam thams cad la yod par smra ba pe tha re'i sbyor ba yang spyi ni thams cad du song ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The application of the Bhartṛharians, who maintain that the universal exists in each of its substrata, is also refuted: The universal does not pervade everything. This is the proposition.

original: dmigs pa'i yul du 'gyur ba las gsal ba'i bar dag tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul du 'gyur ba las gsal ba'i bar dag tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because it is perceived in the particular, which is the object of perception. This is the reason.

original: spyi'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: spyi'i dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the general characteristic of an object?

original: mngon par gsal ba der 'dzin pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i phyir spyi gsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba der 'dzin pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i phyir spyi gsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is the object of a cognition that apprehends it as manifest.

original: des na gsal ba rnams kyi shes pa'i yul nyid du bsgrub pa ni mngon par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gsal ba rnams kyi shes pa'i yul nyid du bsgrub pa ni mngon par gsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the object of a cognition of a manifest particular is a manifest universal.

original: gal te de lta na gsal ba la lar de mngon par gsal ba yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gsal ba la lar de mngon par gsal ba yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then a particular is manifest in some places but not in all places.

original: bshad pa / spyi tha dad pa med ba'i phyir gsal ba gcig la gsal ba'i rgyus yul thams cad du gsal ba'i phyir mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / spyi tha dad pa med ba'i phyir gsal ba gcig la gsal ba'i rgyus yul thams cad du gsal ba'i phyir mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says: Because the universal is not different, a particular is manifest everywhere because of the cause of manifestation. It is free from the nature of nonmanifestation.

original: 'di snyam du chod pas thams cad du mngon par gsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du chod pas thams cad du mngon par gsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is not manifest everywhere because of obstruction,

original: bshad pa / tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir mchod pa yin no //
translated: we reply: It is manifest because it is not different.

original: spyi gcig nyid ni chod pa dang ma chod par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: spyi gcig nyid ni chod pa dang ma chod par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: One universal is not both manifest and obstructed.

original: mchod pa'i yul du yang dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: mchod pa'i yul du yang dmigs pa med do //
translated: There is no objective support for the object of worship.

original: 'o na thag ring por gnas pas mi gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thag ring por gnas pas mi gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not clear because it is far away,

original: tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir thag ring por gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir thag ring por gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not far away because it is not different.

original: thag ring por gnas pa ma yin par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: thag ring por gnas pa ma yin par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not perceived as far away.

original: 'o na bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not visible because it is invisible,
